story:
uh oh spaghetti audrey did a silly.
So most of you generously kindly donated to my previous Pozible campaign to help me get the funds together for a cacao shipment of $3800 & $500 website ... and the other costs of setting up a biz...

I even started giving out the lovely gifts like blocks of Cacao and scarves and such! but um - turns out I thought I'd selected flexible funding and pozible doesn't have that so .... apparently I read wrong.... which means here we are again!

To those who donated - I am so sorry that you have to go through a platform AGAIN - open to direct if you prefer as this will be less about the optics.

If you didn't get the chance in the last round - well NOW is your chance!!! 

THANK YOU for supporting my cacao dreams!

story:
WUF SHANTI

Created by a kid for other kids, this adorable dog yogi & meditation character teaches health, wellness, peace, & positivity. Think like the Barney of Yoga. It is  so important right now with everything going on in the world.

Wuf Shanti shares with children how to live mindfully, think like a yogi, look on the bright side of life, be kind to others, and live in gratitude. Our mission is to help children grow up to be happier teenagers and content peace loving adults. Science has shown that yoga, meditation, and positive thinking can help the healing process, and we truly believe the world will be a brighter place if we can teach children to "Think Well to Be Well".

The next generation is the key to changing this world. Wuf Shanti videos are on local PBS stations, the Children's TV Network (the in-house station in children hospitals across the country), and soon to be international on CTN. We have 60K followers on FB, Adam Levine posted about Adam and Wuf Shanti on his social media pages, and the mobile App is in development. We are determined to make a positive difference in the world. We need the help of OMazing people to support this mission and spread the word.

Learn more about us here, our mission, intention, values, the children hospitals Wuf Shanti  tours, and recent news articles: http://wufshanti.com/2017/07/learning-wuf-shanti/

We tour children’s hospitals. If you are affiliated with a hospital that you would like for us to visit, please email us at thinkwell@wufshanti.com.

Please join us by following and subscribing (for free):

www.wufshanti.com
 
www.facebook.com/wufshanti
 
https://www.youtube.com/c/WufShanti

THIS CAMPAIGN

This campaign will help us produce a Wuf Shanti mobile app and our coffee table style book. The App has music, videos, games, complete with yoga, meditations, and mindful mantras. The book has descriptions of poses, health benefits of each, suggested mantras, and beautiful pictures of Wuf Shanti doing each pose.

The best part is that a generous benefactor has agreed to MATCH whatever we raise here, up to a cap of 15K! That would help us do so much more and make a positive impact on children everywhere.

Wuf Shanti promotes health and wellness, and encourages peace and positivity. Children can learn the influence and importance of positive thinking on health and success in life.  Also, if children learn early how to live mindfully and deal with problems in a productive manner, then we will hopefully have a more tolerant world where kindness prevails and fewer incidents of grown-ups shooting up schools, concerts and movie theaters.

We are asking for 15,000 because of the match offer, which is so exciting for us, and it will help us complete these projects.

Thank you for joining us on this journey of giving gratitude and thinking well, and sharing this yogic-minded lifestyle for children! To learn more about Wuf Shanti, and how you can help promote wellness, please visit us at:

Wuf Shanti, Wuf Peace, Wuf Namaste`! :)

RISKS

This project doesn't require any pre-approval or premarket review; however, like any project, there is a risk, and that is that it may end up costing more to complete and/or the app could be declined by the hosting companies. We hope that is not the case, and we do not think it will be, but we are prepared to tackle that if we have to by never giving up because we wholeheartedly believe in this mission and the goodness Wuf Shanti can achieve in this world.

story:
FIRST LEG OF THE TOUR COMPLETE! SO WHAT DID WE DO?

Why contribute? Here's what we've done so far during the three weeks of the first leg of the tour out on the west coast!

We had the opportunity to connect and inspire over 8,000 students, ran a worldwide event to kickoff World Kindness week in over 120 cities worldwide, distributed over 2,500 Catching Kindness cards, engaged in hundreds of random acts of kindness, provided meals for the homeless, visited children’s hospitals: Doernbecher Children's Hospital in Portland and the Orthopaedic Institute for Children in LA, bringing gifts and love to the children there.

We need YOU to help fuel us forward! So my question to you is, has the work that I've done and Life Vest Inside has done inspired, touched or impacted you in any tiny way? If your answer is YES, then consider making a contribution - not because you have to, but because you WANT to! Because you WANT to know that you are part of all the change we are creating. At the end of the day, I can't force anyone to click the button, but I encourage you to realize that clicking that button is what keeps us afloat, keeps us creating the impact that inspired YOU! Kindness, like a boomerang always returns. So I ask you what can we do together in these next few hours to hit the goal?! Can we all make a commitment to give what we can?

For those just learning about Life Vest Inside, the proof is in the pudding! We have an amazing track record of success and want you to be a part of our continued success! 

Hope to add you to the list of Kindness Backers!

______________________________________________

To some the world is filled with war, hatred, violence and hopelessness. But together we have the power to fill this world with kindness, trust, hope and love. And so I’ll be heading out on a six week cross country kindness tour addressing the rift happening within our country. I’ll be leading talks, performing random acts of kindness and engaging everyday people and thought leaders around the importance of DIALOGUE; connecting with one another in spite of our differing beliefs. After all education is the greatest key to tolerance.

 

If we want to truly change the culture of our country we need to begin having meaningful conversations. And so the theme of this tour is focused on listening and sharing. It’s not about everyone believing the same thing, but rather everyone respecting the beliefs of the other. “For all the violence to cease we must agree to disagree.”

 

Please consider contributing what you can to help us reach our $50,000 goal!

   

There’s one thing you need to know about me - I LOVE people with all my heart! Ever since childhood, I had a deep passion to unite people in a way like never before; to truly change the world. To help people see beyond the labels and connect with the heart of one another; recognizing that each person is in fact a piece of the same puzzle.

I was a middle school teacher for 7 amazing years, the most transformative of my life! I left my job teaching back in September 2011 to start Life Vest Inside and pursue the dream of my four year old self who believed in her heart of hearts that she was destined to change the world. Life Vest Inside is a 501c3 non-profit organization with a mission to inspire, empower and educate people of all backgrounds to lead a life of kindness.

Life Vest Inside gained international acclaim when our short film, Kindness Boomerang went viral, landing me a spot to speak at TED. I’m super touched and honored to have been

featured on:

 

                                                       
 

This next journey is bound to be just as impactful but I need each of you to make it happen! Help me as I head out with my Kindness Caravan on a six week cross country tour around the USA, to spread the message of kindness and spur positive dialogue centered around increasing kindness perception within the US.

 

The more we connect and create a positive atmosphere to share varying ideas, the greater difference we can make in the world. In an effort to create greater, long lasting impact we will be producing a documentary chronicling the journey and sharing the stories of those we meet along the way.

 

Traveling across the US is no simple thing and can be costly, especially when you’re traveling with 4! Contribute what you can to make this amazing Kindness Boomerang journey take flight!

I know there is loads still ahead of me but I’m excited to see where my path will lead and I’m grateful to all those who have joined me for this extraordinary journey! Who knows, maybe the next goal is a Worldwide Tour!

 

An extension of my initial journey into the wonderful world of kindness, this listening and sharing tour will not only serve to continue spreading awareness about the power of kindness, but it will also bring to light ways in which we aim to increase kindness perception within the US over the course of the next ten years. My goal is to use this tour as a means to spark conversation and positive dialogue with people of all backgrounds around the importance of kindness and how together we can make the US a kinder place to live and from there the world at large. I’ll be using my new book, Kindness Boomerang, to inspire, empower and equip those I meet along the journey with tools to make a change in their own life and within their community.

 

So what will I be doing on the tour?

 

Kind Talks: With a focus on schools and Universities, I will be giving talks in each city and distributing copies of Kindness Boomerang, as a practical guide to begin creating a lasting impact. In addition, Kindness Curriculum (K-5) will be distributed at each school. Goal: 4 talks in each city (Universities, Middle School, High School, Elementary School).

Volunteer activities: Community members will be invited and encouraged to join me in local community based volunteer activities showing the importance of giving back within our own community. Goal: 1-2 volunteer activities/city. Activities can range from:

  • Providing (and serving!) special meals at shelters and soup kitchens
  • Dressing up and giving out loads of gifts and cheer to children at local children’s hospitals or orphanages
  • Cleaning up a local park
  • Visiting old age homes and hosting games of bingo

            

Community activities: Meet up with me in your city and join in on some of my favorite hobbies - I have LOADS of them and I always love picking up new ones! From playing sports (basketball, softball, tennis, ping pong, ice skating, rollerblading), to starting a jam session (yes, I am a drummer!), to yoga, to movies or plays, to amusement parks, laser tag, soul-cycle, karaoke, etc... Let’s have some fun!

  • Community basketball game or any sport for that matter
  • Community Yoga Session
  • Community Jam Session
  • Community Bike Ride
  • Community Board Game Night
  • Soul-Cycle Charity Ride

 

 

Random Acts of Kindness: Organized kindness is great but random kindness can have an extraordinary effect! Follow us on our journey as we complete our scavenger hunt list of acts of kindness to spread joy in loads of innovative ways to unsuspecting strangers throughout the journey! In each city I’ll be inviting community members to take part in fun kindness themed activities with me. In each city I’ll be inviting community members to take part in fun kindness themed activities with me. From Kindness Scavenger Hunts, to volunteering at soup kitchens, to playing bingo in nursing homes, to getting decked out in fun costumes and giving out free gifts and toys in hospitals, to giving out free hugs on the streets, to giving out free cups of coffee, to creating awesome chalk walks in your neighborhood, to giving meals to the homeless, to serenading strangers with some inspirational tunes, to throwing puppet shows for kids in local parks, to breaking out into flashmobs on your city streets, the list is endless!

Have an idea? I’d love to hear it! I’m totally open for suggestions!

 

Dance for Kindness (DFK): (Sunday, November 12th) Every year, to kick off World Kindness Week, Life Vest Inside organizes Dance for Kindness, a WorldWide FreezeMob/FlashMob during which groups from all across the globe unite under the banner of kindness and join together to perform to the same song, same dance, all happening on the same day. Dance for Kindness serves as a means of building awareness for World Kindness Day (Nov 13th). Since DFK will take place during the tour, we will coordinating with groups in each city to create an event or take part in an existing event in their city! As for me, I’ll be in San Fran during Dance for Kindness dancing with our head choreographer, Justin Cole!

Kindness Documentary and all things video: Follow the Kindness Caravan across the USA. In an effort to create greater, long lasting impact we will be producing a documentary chronicling the journey and sharing the stories of those we meet along the way.

In addition to tracking me as I travel across the US through our interactive Map where you can see photo’s and videos, I’m going to be holding YouTubeLIVE, Facebook LIVE, and InstaLIVE streams every week! I’ll be giving aways awesome Kindness Packages and gifts throughout the tour and challenging you guys to record your own #KindnessBoomerang videos! More details to come!

 

Help Us Raise $50K!

Traveling across the US is no simple thing and can be costly, especially when you’re traveling with 4! Contribute what you can to make this amazing Kindness Boomerang journey take flight! Funds raised will be used for expenses throughout the 6 week journey including:

 

  • Funding all of the acts of kindness that are performed along the way
  • Kindness Caravan: This includes wrapping the van we will be using to drive from west coast to east coast + Gas 
  • Airfare: we have 4 people joining on the tour (we will be starting in Vancouver, Washington)
  • Housing: This includes expenses for hotels and/or airbnb throughout the journey
  • Kindness Boomerang Giveaways: We would like to give away 50 books at each location to schools that can’t afford them. The book is a great resource for teachers
  • Food: Cause we gotta have fuel in our tanks to keep on keeping on!
  • Media: Includes videography, photography and all production for the course of the entire journey, including our awesome documentary of the journey.
  • Tour Manager: assisting with all of the logistics throughout the course of the tour
  • Insurance: safety is a priority!

 

Any additional funds raised will allow us to add on additional cities and perform even more acts of kindness!

The Kindness Boomerang tour will be taking place over

the course of six jam-packed weeks! (Locations are subject to change.)

 Week #1: Vancouver, Washington / Portland, Oregon

Week #2: San Francisco, California 

Week #3: Los Angeles, California / Las Vegas, Nevada  

Week #4: Denver, Colorado / Kansas City, Kansas 

Week #5: Nashville, TN

Week #6: Salisbury, Maryland / DC / New York

 

Learn a bit more about the awesome people joining me in the Kindness Caravan: Meet...

Orly Wahba,  yup that’s me!

 

Elana Ades (Social Media Guru)

  • Elana is a virgo, she enjoys food & loves a good adventure! “I can't wait to meet my fellow American's and share in the beauty that is kindness. You know what they say.... KINDNESS IS FREE - SPRINKLE THAT S--T EVERYWHERE!”
  • “All I know is that when someone is kind to me, I feel good.  I know that when I do something kind for someone else, I feel good. I know that when I see a kind act take place among others, I feel good. Common denominator of feeling good = kindness.”
  • Fun Fact: Favorite quote: Cinderella is proof that shoes can change your life.

 

Sophie Wilkie (tour photographer)

  • Hailing from the United Kingdom, Sophie Wilkie is a musician, photographer and artist. Sophie's passion for photography was born out of a love for light and an immense appreciation of the everyday beauty that surrounds us.
  • “To me, kindness is an essential, transformative and extraordinarily powerful force that moves mysteriously and weaves us all together.”
  • Fun Fact: Favorite food: A generous portion of chicken and farmers market veggie stew, with some sourdough bread and lots of butter. This, of course, is to be eaten on a chilly evening after a long and rainy hike!  

 

Mike Hedge (tour videographer)

  • Graduated from LA Film School majoring in producing and cinematography. As The Dust Settles is Mike’s first feature-length documentary that he produced and edited. Mike enjoys adventure travel, photography, gardening, and free energy research.
  • “Kindness is a gift. The beauty is that it feels nice to give gifts!”
  • Fun Fact: Your favorite quote:  “Nothing is more important than that you feel good. Just practice that and watch what happens.” ~Abraham Hicks

 

Schools include:

 

            - UN International School, NY          - Hebrew Wizards, CT

            - Brooklyn College, NY                        - Seton Catholic Middle School, Iowa

            - Baruch College, NY                            - Washington Middle School, Iowa

            - Wagner Ranch Elementary, CA      - Emery Weiner School, Texas

            - Yeshivah of Flatbush, NY                  - Village Middle School, Texas

            - Barkai Yeshivah, NY                            - SAR, NY

   

                      

“Orly was magical! The students truly enjoyed Orly’s youthful energy and really absorbed the importance of KINDNESS. Her passionate message motivated and inspired students to go back to their schools and DO GOOD THINGS!” ~Stuart Muszynski, Project Love

 

"Orly pulls at your heartstrings. She's authentic, relatable, and funny to boot! She's artfully woven together her real life personal experiences to pave the way for how people can turn everyday instances into magical moments that make the world a kinder place." ~Michele Landa, NY

 

“Not only was Orly’s message of kindness timely but her entire presentation was extremely motivating and inspiring. Her dedication and passion are contagious. She is an incredible speaker and I would recommend her to everyone.” ~Joe Martinez, Financial Advisor at Janney Montgomery Scott

             

“Orly did not just speak to a group of conference attendees, she spoke to me. Though the audience was large, her words individually pierced my conscience. Her story is one that should be heard and absorbed. I walked away from the talk with an increased appreciation of people around me, those I know, and even those I don't.” ~Ed Blumenthal, Executive Vice President, Wealth Management at Janney Montgomery Scott

 

“Orly’s combination of humor and personal reflection kept our audience both engaged and entertained, and her warmth and kind heart shone through. Orly doesn’t just talk - she walks the walk.” ~Andrea Steinkamp, Co-President, PTA of PS 199

 

“Orly was absolutely wonderful. It was the first time that I had seen all of our sales staff put down their phones and actually listen and engage. She is an amazing speaker and I would highly recommend her to anyone!” ~Kristen Beeman, Heffernan Insurance Brokers

“Orly’s speech resonated with our employees and moved many of them to tears. I highly recommend Orly for speaking engagements. Your team and/or employees will not be disappointed!” ~Pacific Hospitality Group

 

"Orly Wahba demonstrates the unique skill and courage of being self reflective and sharing her process with those around her." ~Rabbi Moses Haber, Rav Yeshivah - Barkai

Let’s not forget the importance of GRATITUDE! This tour would not be possible without the support of our sponsors who are true partners in kindness! They believe as deeply as we do in the importance of building a kinder, happier more unified world and we’re psyched to have them on board!

   

            

Two signed copies of Kindness Boomerang. Two personalized signed copies of Orly’s new book, Kindness Boomerang. One for you and one to gift forward to someone special in your life!

Kindness Boomerang: How to Save the World (and Yourself) Through 365 Daily Acts is a great resource, giving people practical daily ways to begin incorporating change into their life! For each day of the year you’ll find an act of kindness, inspirational quote and short reflection about the power of paying it forward!     

We're honored to have received such positive feedback from influencers making a difference in their own unique way!

Meir Kay                   Styled by Hrush            Sophia Bush

 

            

“Kindness Boomerang is filled with fun tips and ideas for finding happiness in everyday activities.” ~Tony Hsieh, NY Times bestselling author of “Delivering Happiness” and CEO of Zappos.com, Inc.

 

"Orly Wahba's book 'Kindness Boomerang' is more than good philosophy, it is a box of spiritual tools - it is full of heart and decent thoughts, good will, and makes available a ready course of action for any given day. This is the work of a beautiful and evolved human being. When I grow up, I hope to be more like Orly Wahba. Get this book! Change the world a little bit at a time, and you yourself can change...” ~Peter Scolari, Actor

 

"Kindness Boomerang is a little book that will make a big change, a little bite-sized bible of reminders for those who want to stay on the path of compassion.” ~Amanda Palmer, Artist, TED speaker and Author of Best Selling Book “The Art of Asking”

 

"Kindness Boomerang is a fantastic guidebook to bring daily acts of kindness into your life.” ~Tiffany Shlain, Emmy-nominated filmmaker & Founder of Character Day

 

"The need for kindness has never been greater. Orly Wahba's Kindness Boomerang gives you everything you need to make the leap from random acts to embodied, daily practice. Get it. Then live it!" - Jonathan Fields, founder of Good Life Project, author of How to Live a Good Life

 

“Orly Wahba has produced a treasure trove of kindness. This little book can help change the world for the better, one person at a time. It's wonderful.” ~Myron Kandel, CNN Founding Financial Editor

Kindness Boomerang T-shirt. Get your EXCLUSIVE #KindnessBoomerang tour t-shirt!

 

Kindness Boomerang tour swag: An exclusive duffle bag, t-shirt, sweatshirt and hat

 

Producer Credit: Receive Producer credits on our official tour documentary, plus receive special behind the scenes exclusive coverage and an invite to opening night of the film launch.   

 

Kindness Caravan: Sponsor our Official Kindness Caravan that we will be driving from coast to coast! Be listed as an Official Tour Sponsor! Your company logo placed on our wrapped tour van, signage at each event, verbal recognition at each event, digital promotion on our website and social channels, featured as our sponsor on our tour documentary video and media associated with the tour

 

         

Want to get further involved, book me to speak, organize a book signing, take part in a kindness activity or join me for one of my hobbies?

Reach out to me: orly@lifevestinside.com

 

Connect with us and follow along:

YouTube: youtube.com/lifevestinside

Facebook: facebook.com/lifevestinside

Instagram: instagram.com/lifevestinside

Goal: 4 talks in each city (Universities, Middle School, High School, Elementary School).Volunteer activities: Community members will be invited and encouraged to join me in local community based volunteer activities showing the importance of giving back within our own community. Goal: 1-2 volunteer activities/city. Activities can range from:
Providing (and serving!) special meals at shelters and soup kitchens
Dressing up and giving out loads of gifts and cheer to children at local children’s hospitals or orphanages
Cleaning up a local park
Visiting old age homes and hosting games of bingo
            Community activities: Meet up with me in your city and join in on some of my favorite hobbies - I have LOADS of them and I always love picking up new ones! From playing sports (basketball, softball, tennis, ping pong, ice skating, rollerblading), to starting a jam session (yes, I am a drummer!), to yoga, to movies or plays, to amusement parks, laser tag, soul-cycle, karaoke, etc... Let’s have some fun!
Community basketball game or any sport for that matter
Community Yoga Session
Community Jam Session
Community Bike Ride
Community Board Game Night
Soul-Cycle Charity Ride
  Random Acts of Kindness: Organized kindness is great but random kindness can have an extraordinary effect! Follow us on our journey as we complete our scavenger hunt list of acts of kindness to spread joy in loads of innovative ways to unsuspecting strangers throughout the journey! In each city I’ll be inviting community members to take part in fun kindness themed activities with me. In each city I’ll be inviting community members to take part in fun kindness themed activities with me. From Kindness Scavenger Hunts, to volunteering at soup kitchens, to playing bingo in nursing homes, to getting decked out in fun costumes and giving out free gifts and toys in hospitals, to giving out free hugs on the streets, to giving out free cups of coffee, to creating awesome chalk walks in your neighborhood, to giving meals to the homeless, to serenading strangers with some inspirational tunes, to throwing puppet shows for kids in local parks, to breaking out into flashmobs on your city streets, the list is endless!Have an idea? I’d love to hear it! I’m totally open for suggestions! Dance for Kindness (DFK): (Sunday, November 12th) Every year, to kick off World Kindness Week, Life Vest Inside organizes Dance for Kindness, a WorldWide FreezeMob/FlashMob during which groups from all across the globe unite under the banner of kindness and join together to perform to the same song, same dance, all happening on the same day. Dance for Kindness serves as a means of building awareness for World Kindness Day (Nov 13th). Since DFK will take place during the tour, we will coordinating with groups in each city to create an event or take part in an existing event in their city! As for me, I’ll be in San Fran during Dance for Kindness dancing with our head choreographer, Justin Cole!Kindness Documentary and all things video: Follow the Kindness Caravan across the USA. In an effort to create greater, long lasting impact we will be producing a documentary chronicling the journey and sharing the stories of those we meet along the way.In addition to tracking me as I travel across the US through our interactive Map where you can see photo’s and videos, I’m going to be holding YouTubeLIVE, Facebook LIVE, and InstaLIVE streams every week! I’ll be giving aways awesome Kindness Packages and gifts throughout the tour and challenging you guys to record your own #KindnessBoomerang videos! More details to come! Help Us Raise $50K!Traveling across the US is no simple thing and can be costly, especially when you’re traveling with 4! Contribute what you can to make this amazing Kindness Boomerang journey take flight! Funds raised will be used for expenses throughout the 6 week journey including: 
Funding all of the acts of kindness that are performed along the way

Kindness Caravan: This includes wrapping the van we will be using to drive from west coast to east coast + Gas 

Airfare: we have 4 people joining on the tour (we will be starting in Vancouver, Washington)

Housing: This includes expenses for hotels and/or airbnb throughout the journey

Kindness Boomerang Giveaways: We would like to give away 50 books at each location to schools that can’t afford them. The book is a great resource for teachers

Food: Cause we gotta have fuel in our tanks to keep on keeping on!

Media: Includes videography, photography and all production for the course of the entire journey, including our awesome documentary of the journey.

Tour Manager: assisting with all of the logistics throughout the course of the tour

Insurance: safety is a priority!
 Any additional funds raised will allow us to add on additional cities and perform even more acts of kindness!The Kindness Boomerang tour will be taking place over the course of six jam-packed weeks! (Locations are subject to change.) Week #1: Vancouver, Washington / Portland, OregonWeek #2: San Francisco, California Week #3: Los Angeles, California / Las Vegas, Nevada  Week #4: Denver, Colorado / Kansas City, Kansas Week #5: Nashville, TNWeek #6: Salisbury, Maryland / DC / New York Learn a bit more about the awesome people joining me in the Kindness Caravan: Meet...Orly Wahba,  yup that’s me! Elana Ades (Social Media Guru)
Elana is a virgo, she enjoys food & loves a good adventure! “I can't wait to meet my fellow American's and share in the beauty that is kindness. You know what they say.... KINDNESS IS FREE - SPRINKLE THAT S--T EVERYWHERE!”
“All I know is that when someone is kind to me, I feel good.  I know that when I do something kind for someone else, I feel good. I know that when I see a kind act take place among others, I feel good. Common denominator of feeling good = kindness.”
Fun Fact: Favorite quote: Cinderella is proof that shoes can change your life.
 Sophie Wilkie (tour photographer)
Hailing from the United Kingdom, Sophie Wilkie is a musician, photographer and artist. Sophie's passion for photography was born out of a love for light and an immense appreciation of the everyday beauty that surrounds us.
“To me, kindness is an essential, transformative and extraordinarily powerful force that moves mysteriously and weaves us all together.”
Fun Fact: Favorite food: A generous portion of chicken and farmers market veggie stew, with some sourdough bread and lots of butter. This, of course, is to be eaten on a chilly evening after a long and rainy hike!  
 Mike Hedge (tour videographer)
Graduated from LA Film School majoring in producing and cinematography. As The Dust Settles is Mike’s first feature-length documentary that he produced and edited. Mike enjoys adventure travel, photography, gardening, and free energy research.
“Kindness is a gift. The beauty is that it feels nice to give gifts!”
Fun Fact: Your favorite quote:  “Nothing is more important than that you feel good. Just practice that and watch what happens.” ~Abraham Hicks
 Schools include:             - UN International School, NY          - Hebrew Wizards, CT            - Brooklyn College, NY                        - Seton Catholic Middle School, Iowa            - Baruch College, NY                            - Washington Middle School, Iowa            - Wagner Ranch Elementary, CA      - Emery Weiner School, Texas            - Yeshivah of Flatbush, NY                  - Village Middle School, Texas            - Barkai Yeshivah, NY                            - SAR, NY                         “Orly was magical! The students truly enjoyed Orly’s youthful energy and really absorbed the importance of KINDNESS. Her passionate message motivated and inspired students to go back to their schools and DO GOOD THINGS!” ~Stuart Muszynski, Project Love "Orly pulls at your heartstrings. She's authentic, relatable, and funny to boot! She's artfully woven together her real life personal experiences to pave the way for how people can turn everyday instances into magical moments that make the world a kinder place." ~Michele Landa, NY “Not only was Orly’s message of kindness timely but her entire presentation was extremely motivating and inspiring. Her dedication and passion are contagious. She is an incredible speaker and I would recommend her to everyone.” ~Joe Martinez, Financial Advisor at Janney Montgomery Scott             “Orly did not just speak to a group of conference attendees, she spoke to me. Though the audience was large, her words individually pierced my conscience. Her story is one that should be heard and absorbed. I walked away from the talk with an increased appreciation of people around me, those I know, and even those I don't.” ~Ed Blumenthal, Executive Vice President, Wealth Management at Janney Montgomery Scott “Orly’s combination of humor and personal reflection kept our audience both engaged and entertained, and her warmth and kind heart shone through. Orly doesn’t just talk - she walks the walk.” ~Andrea Steinkamp, Co-President, PTA of PS 199 “Orly was absolutely wonderful. It was the first time that I had seen all of our sales staff put down their phones and actually listen and engage. She is an amazing speaker and I would highly recommend her to anyone!” ~Kristen Beeman, Heffernan Insurance Brokers“Orly’s speech resonated with our employees and moved many of them to tears. I highly recommend Orly for speaking engagements. Your team and/or employees will not be disappointed!” ~Pacific Hospitality Group "Orly Wahba demonstrates the unique skill and courage of being self reflective and sharing her process with those around her." ~Rabbi Moses Haber, Rav Yeshivah - BarkaiLet’s not forget the importance of GRATITUDE! This tour would not be possible without the support of our sponsors who are true partners in kindness! They believe as deeply as we do in the importance of building a kinder, happier more unified world and we’re psyched to have them on board!               Two signed copies of Kindness Boomerang. Two personalized signed copies of Orly’s new book, Kindness Boomerang. One for you and one to gift forward to someone special in your life!Kindness Boomerang: How to Save the World (and Yourself) Through 365 Daily Acts is a great resource, giving people practical daily ways to begin incorporating change into their life! For each day of the year you’ll find an act of kindness, inspirational quote and short reflection about the power of paying it forward!     We're honored to have received such positive feedback from influencers making a difference in their own unique way!Meir Kay                   Styled by Hrush            Sophia Bush             “Kindness Boomerang is filled with fun tips and ideas for finding happiness in everyday activities.” ~Tony Hsieh, NY Times bestselling author of “Delivering Happiness” and CEO of Zappos.com, Inc. "Orly Wahba's book 'Kindness Boomerang' is more than good philosophy, it is a box of spiritual tools - it is full of heart and decent thoughts, good will, and makes available a ready course of action for any given day. This is the work of a beautiful and evolved human being. When I grow up, I hope to be more like Orly Wahba. Get this book! Change the world a little bit at a time, and you yourself can change...” ~Peter Scolari, Actor "Kindness Boomerang is a little book that will make a big change, a little bite-sized bible of reminders for those who want to stay on the path of compassion.” ~Amanda Palmer, Artist, TED speaker and Author of Best Selling Book “The Art of Asking” "Kindness Boomerang is a fantastic guidebook to bring daily acts of kindness into your life.” ~Tiffany Shlain, Emmy-nominated filmmaker & Founder of Character Day "The need for kindness has never been greater. Orly Wahba's Kindness Boomerang gives you everything you need to make the leap from random acts to embodied, daily practice. Get it. Then live it!" - Jonathan Fields, founder of Good Life Project, author of How to Live a Good Life “Orly Wahba has produced a treasure trove of kindness. This little book can help change the world for the better, one person at a time. It's wonderful.” ~Myron Kandel, CNN Founding Financial EditorKindness Boomerang T-shirt. Get your EXCLUSIVE #KindnessBoomerang tour t-shirt! Kindness Boomerang tour swag: An exclusive duffle bag, t-shirt, sweatshirt and hat Producer Credit: Receive Producer credits on our official tour documentary, plus receive special behind the scenes exclusive coverage and an invite to opening night of the film launch.    Kindness Caravan: Sponsor our Official Kindness Caravan that we will be driving from coast to coast! Be listed as an Official Tour Sponsor! Your company logo placed on our wrapped tour van, signage at each event, verbal recognition at each event, digital promotion on our website and social channels, featured as our sponsor on our tour documentary video and media associated with the tour          Want to get further involved, book me to speak, organize a book signing, take part in a kindness activity or join me for one of my hobbies?Reach out to me: orly@lifevestinside.com Connect with us and follow along:YouTube: youtube.com/lifevestinsideFacebook: facebook.com/lifevestinsideInstagram: instagram.com/lifevestinside

story:
The Magick Ensues

Growing up in the Bronx has taught me one thing above many others: if you need something done, do it yourself and the rest will follow. This is expressed through our culture of survival, grit-based fashion, and the fact that we support each other from an unspoken bond of symbiosis. As a multidimensional creative and healer from the X, I've noticed copious patterns in how we relate to where we live. Very often our people are burdened with a feeling of lack because we see slums, poverty and political corruption before we see the rich magnitude of our native lands. When I created Crystals and Candy in 2015, it was a response to "woke" culture and constantly being told we would never have spaces for ourselves or access to healing because "they" didn't want us to. A year and 12 beautiful, bright events after, I'd helped build a community of amazing people who were interested in using astrology and meditation as tools to rebuild and heal themselves. I've had attendees cry in my arms and tell me a workshop helped them resolve internal turmoil, or that a crystal they received in my space protected them from harm. I met so many brilliant people, many who later became friends or clients. But something wasn't quite there yet.

My tarot patrons are mostly womyn of color. Most of them are artists, healers, and all of them are creators. The vast majority of them suffer from stagnation or blockage of the sacral chakra. As a patternfinder, training herbalist and shaman, I have no problem noting that these issues are rampant in womyn because of a lack of affirming, respect, and safety in expressing feminine energy.  This is also a strong symptom of disconnection from nature and the medicines that are available to transmute these pains. These blockages are the result of timeless suppression of the divine intuition and emotion within us, and when gone unacknowledged and neglected, can wreak havoc on mind body and soul.

Where does that end up? In the same place it can be solved: Community.

The Sweetness Circle was born of a need to create a space for womyn and gender non-conforming folks uptown, in places that are underfunded, underexposed, and underloved. It is a testament to the bright power of the divine feminine, and the need to give people access to that in a place that breeds it but rarely profits from it positively. The Bronx is the music capitol of the world, yet most of the healers and artists I know from here convene in spaces in Brooklyn and Manhattan for events. My borough is being blasted as a place of death or gentrification, but where does that leave the young people who are discovering their spiritual gifts in a space rife with pain? Where do kids who don't have the language to understand their identity or ancestral connection go? What space is there for the teens of the seas and the womyn of the waters to convene, decompress, co-create, and build resources for expansion?

There is a widespread need in the Bronx for physical space that is safe, accessible, and offers emotional and spiritual nourishment. We need access to spaces that offer us the deep, visceral healing our people have been denied for centuries and we need it now: we deserve it. We need spaces that allow us to do so without the constant chatter of lack, of political burnout, and anger-based building. We need spaces that allow us to rewrite narratives for ourselves and future generations. We deserve to use the instruments of joy and personal power to thrive.

It is here. And you can help.

These monthly events will include healing and informational workshops, features from incredible artists, musicians and crafters, and music to groove to: all by womyn of color and GNC folks. The workshops will mostly be womyn/GNC exclusive, with specific workshops open to non-womyn. Many workshops will focus on creating connections with our spiritual roots as POC, connecting with nature, and building deep bonds that can last lifetimes. Overall this space is tailored to help people of color build connections, resources, and develop their own medicine in their backyard. The Sweetness Circle is an anchor of love, creativity, and awareness based in the Uptown NYC area, but is open to folks from all boroughs.

Because I am a healer, I acknowledge the need for people to be compensated for their work. Your donations will provide stipends for facilitators, materials for workshops and artists, and spaces for the magick to happen in. These donations will go to things like journals, crystals and herbs, and various goodies for take-home magick. They will go to providing decorations for vendors who want to deck out their displays, nails and tape for artists who share their hearts with you on walls and in action. They will go into the pockets of the dope ass folks who DJ the tunes that play when you meet your new best friend. They will go into the minds of all of this generation's newest powerboxes, and inevitably, into healing their bloodlines and descendants. Your support of these beautiful beings will go into buying trash bags that will be filled with garbage from rivers as we walk and learn about the magick that is Oshun. It will go into the plants that will surround us as we learn of the medicine of the divine feminine, and how powerful it can be to be kind.

Play a role in the ending of a narrative of disempowerment. Play a role in someone learning about the musicbox inside themselves after a workshop blows out cobwebs. Come out and break some barriers.

De-colonize self. Re-engage joy.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Elizabeth Stewart, Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist in San Jose, CA and Founder/President of Kingdom Family Resources, a Community based Mental Health Service. From 1990 to 2012 I worked within Silicon Valley's  Santa Clara County as well as in Tulsa Ok, providing Mental Health support and facilitating in home services to kids and families involved in the Juvenile Justice System, Department of Children and Family Services, County Mental Health Services, Drug Rehabilitation services, and Psychiatric Hospital Services. What I found to be most effective is helping families in the environment they are struggling in vs. a child coming to the office for therapy and then returning home back to the same way of family functioning. How can a child work at changing his behavior if the environment has no change? This is why doing therapy with the Family in the environment is more effective and sustainable than a child coming to the office for therapy.  Often the child would be identified as the problem vs. the problem being the problem, thus pushing the child and family further into a hole that seemed to have no hope. In 2012 Kingdom Family Resources was incorporated with our vision of "Restore a heart, Restore a family, Transform lives for a lifetime".  We are here to help families look at the problem that is infecting the family and focus on treating the infection instead of labeling the person. This campaign is vital to helping families receive this level of support together in a safe environment that will provide education, skill building, resources, and fun. Most families that are in crisis or striving to have a sense of wellness often are not able to experience healing and peace because their approach to addressing the problem is not working.  We need to help families learn how to address the "infection" in a way that decreases stress, brings relief, and allows the family to hope again. Your support will provide opportunities for families to come  away from this camp with a renewed strength and hope, and we need your support to make this happen!  This is a rare occasion where a family can receive this level of support together for a weekend -guaranteed to change the life of a family.

This is what we need

 Sponsors to donate funds toward the camp fee of $220 for 2-4 family members; this will make the camp affordable for families to attend as well as help with costs for activities and supplies. We have 4 levels of giving available to you. Our Goal is $10,000.00 which will help pay for families to attend, Licensed Therapist, Certified wellness trainers, Mental Health facilitators, support staff, supplies, and resources.

What are the perks for you?  

1) Promotion of your business on KFR website, social media pages

2) Certificate of appreciation

3) Free therapy consultation

4) Table talk dinner with all sponsors to share how your giving supported families who attended the camp

5) Sponsorship plaque

Why are we having a therapeutic camp?

  • It's a time for families to be together in 1 setting receiving therapeutic support, education, and healing
  • It provides a time for families to refocus, regroup, and get back on track with living their best lives
  • Families that are healthy and productive are able to provide stability to the community.

60% of adults report experiencing abuse or other difficult family circumstances during
childhood. 

26% of children in the United States will witness or experience a traumatic event
before they turn four. 

Four of every 10 children in American say they experienced a physical assault during the past year, with one in 10 receiving an assault-related injury. 

1) National Center for Mental Health Promotion and Youth Violence Prevention, "Childhood Trauma and Its Effect on Healthy Development," July 2012 (http://sshs.promoteprevent.org/sites/default/fi...)

(2) JAMA Pediatrics, May 2013 (http://www.unh.edu/ccrc/pdf/05-13%20PED%20child...)

(3) Kilpatrick DG, Saunders BE. (1997). "Prevalence and Consequences of Child Victimization: Results from the National Survey of Adolescents." National Crime Victims Research and Treatment Center, Medical University of South Carolina


 

People need help and we are here to provide that help!

In 2016 we hosted our first Women's Empowerment Conference with young, middle aged, and adult women, and women were empowered and challenged to take their lives to the next level- this event was a success!  We've also had opportunity to support marriages and families receive effective therapy interventions that have helped the family remain in tact.  

It takes courage to acknowledge that you need an emotional tune up or to admit you are at your'e wits end and not sure what to do. Most people will wait until a crisis to receive help vs. being proactive and caring about yourself enough to address the pains and mismanagement of relationships in your life. If we want healthy communities we have to take the time to get healthy and that starts with you and I.

Risks & Challenges

Being a non profit makes us vulnerable to the opinions and perceptions of others and the truth is some may not see the value of helping families in the context of a therapeutic family camp- that's ok!  All we need to do is watch the news, and when violence, or rape, or suicide is in your neighborhood and on your block it becomes too close for comfort. And when it is happening at your house you will want the help. It is happening at someone's house today, right now! Trauma, dysfunction, and crime have been on my block and at my door and guess what- I didn't care what people thought, I just wanted HELP. KFR will keep seeking to help families and we will keep asking for financial support for the cause of family! Family is the most important investment on the earth!  Join me in helping families receive the help they need-that's what we're here to do - help!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can help share this campaign on your social media sites that would be great!
  • Maybe your organization can help raise funds with a bake sale 
  • I am also willing to come to your organization, workplace, school campus, and even church to provide Mental Health Education to help people understand the importance of addressing Mental Health, emotional, and behavioral needs.

And that's all there is to it.

60% of adults report experiencing abuse or other difficult family circumstances duringchildhood. 
26% of children in the United States will witness or experience a traumatic eventbefore they turn four. 
Four of every 10 children in American say they experienced a physical assault during the past year, with one in 10 receiving an assault-related injury. 

1) National Center for Mental Health Promotion and Youth Violence Prevention, "Childhood Trauma and Its Effect on Healthy Development," July 2012 (http://sshs.promoteprevent.org/sites/default/fi...)
(2) JAMA Pediatrics, May 2013 (http://www.unh.edu/ccrc/pdf/05-13%20PED%20child...)
(3) Kilpatrick DG, Saunders BE. (1997). "Prevalence and Consequences of Child Victimization: Results from the National Survey of Adolescents." National Crime Victims Research and Treatment Center, Medical University of South Carolina
 
People need help and we are here to provide that help!
In 2016 we hosted our first Women's Empowerment Conference with young, middle aged, and adult women, and women were empowered and challenged to take their lives to the next level- this event was a success!  We've also had opportunity to support marriages and families receive effective therapy interventions that have helped the family remain in tact.  
It takes courage to acknowledge that you need an emotional tune up or to admit you are at your'e wits end and not sure what to do. Most people will wait until a crisis to receive help vs. being proactive and caring about yourself enough to address the pains and mismanagement of relationships in your life. If we want healthy communities we have to take the time to get healthy and that starts with you and I.


Risks & Challenges
Being a non profit makes us vulnerable to the opinions and perceptions of others and the truth is some may not see the value of helping families in the context of a therapeutic family camp- that's ok!  All we need to do is watch the news, and when violence, or rape, or suicide is in your neighborhood and on your block it becomes too close for comfort. And when it is happening at your house you will want the help. It is happening at someone's house today, right now! Trauma, dysfunction, and crime have been on my block and at my door and guess what- I didn't care what people thought, I just wanted HELP. KFR will keep seeking to help families and we will keep asking for financial support for the cause of family! Family is the most important investment on the earth!  Join me in helping families receive the help they need-that's what we're here to do - help!
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can help share this campaign on your social media sites that would be great!
Maybe your organization can help raise funds with a bake sale 
I am also willing to come to your organization, workplace, school campus, and even church to provide Mental Health Education to help people understand the importance of addressing Mental Health, emotional, and behavioral needs.
And that's all there is to it.

story:
Aercoustics is at it again!  We are competing in the Canstruction Toronto 2017 competition.  Our past entries were huge successes -  Check out the award-winning larger-than-life Loonie we built!  Our entry won two awards (Structural Ingenuity and People's Choice).  Or check out the trench we built - you could actually walk into it and explore the front line of hunger in our city.

More importantly, you helped us raise over $12,000 dollars to buy 13,000 cans of food and 700 kg of rice to build our structures, which all then went to Daily Bread Food Bank. 

We love this event because it the creates an opportunity for us to apply our aptitude for creativity, teamwork, analytical problem solving skills to a fun event that benefits our community.

 

We need your help to finance this year's entry.  

 

By help make our campaign a success, you know your contribution will help provide relief to an ever-increasing hungry population in Toronto.

We really appreciate any support that you can lend to our campaign, whether it be a monetary donation, or making some noise about our campaign and passing along the info to your own contacts; Indiegogo makes it easy with its share tools!

story:
Short Summary

Carlstad Crusaders is an American Football Club in Karlstad, Sweden. We are one of the top American Football Clubs in Europe and the top team in Sweden. We have eight teams in different leagues from PeeWee to adult, men and women teams. 

We have produced players to top Div I college teams in USA as well as NFL and NFL Europe when it was played. 

Carlstad Crusaders were founded in 1991 and are currently planning to take the next step for our organization. We will create an American Football Sport Center dedicated to American Football to be a base for the sports development in the northern Europe.

Today the teams in our club practices at different facilities making transportation of equipment problematic. Where our youth and ladies teams practice we lack dressing rooms and showers. We have no light at the field so we can not practice late in the spring and the fall. There are no rooms for our coaches and staff to work, break down film and have meetings. 

These facilities will help us build an American Football program where the youth and elite players can grow and be better, and our club can excel in all areas.

What We Need & What You Get

Currently we have secured 2/3 of the fundings to build our new Sports Center and we are now reaching out to help us finalize the cost for this project. Our goal is to raise the last 1.000.000 USD that is needed to start the project. Even if we don´t reach our goal, all contributions are welcome and we will create the best Sport Center as we can with our available fundings. 

The fundings that are secured so far are from the municipal of Karlstad, foundations in Sweden and sponsors. 

In Karlstad a new sports area, Sannafältet, will be built with enough space for three sport arenas. Carlstad Crusaders have the opportunity to create a complete top class Sports Center dedicated to American football with modern training and meeting facilities as well as an heated artificial turf field with lights and stands.

The facility will be 16.000 square feet large, with areas to pursue all club activities, all year around and will have: 
- Social areas with a cafe. A natural meeting place to discuss American football over a cup of coffee, dine, have football nights etc.
- Office space where the clubs’ administrative staff and coaches can work during the day and evenings.
- A large area will be dedicated for physical exercise, with a gym and tracks where all the members of the club can conduct training in a professional environment.
- Classrooms for meetings of up to 80 people, board meetings, tactical reviews and lectures.
- Four large locker rooms with space for 45 players in each locker room.

The facility is within walking distance of Karlstad city centre in an attractive natural setting where it is easy to get to and from. A facility with the best conditions for the club to pursue continued success even in the future.

The Impact

One of the things that distinguishes Carlstad Crusaders is the focus on our core values. Joy and fellowship, democracy and participation, the right of everyone to be involved and, most importantly, fair play. These core values permeate the entire club, from the PeeWee teams all the way to the women and men's teams.

What makes Carlstad Crusaders special is that we will take care of everyone who comes here, we not only work with those who are skilled. We take care of everyone, regardless of experience, and teach them American football so that the individual can reach the full potential and have the best and most positive experience they can get.

When you become part of this club, you become not just part of a team or an age group. You become part of something bigger. You become part of a family, you become part of something big, not just one part.

Now, almost thirty years after the first crusade, Carlstad Crusaders prepare for new achievements. In order for this Sports Center to become a reality, we need your help.

Risks & Challenges

We have been working with this project for three years and we know that there are several problems that may occur on the journey before this Sport Center is a reality. We have staffed our project team with competent and experienced persons to help us achieve our goal. 

There are risks and challenges that lays ahead, but with secure funding we believe that we are well suited for what ever may cross our path of creating the platform for our club to take the next step toward greatness. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can´t contribute financially, help us spread the word by sharing your knowledge about this project. Or help us get in contact with persons, foundations or others that can help us.

We are also looking for sponsors that can help us with furniture, equipment or other helpful things for our club to grow and give youth and adult players the opportunity to try American Football.

story:
Brilliant Contours Has Solutions

    That Are Ready for Production

    to Bring Amazing Benefits to Women

    Healing from Breast Issues,

    But We've All But Exhausted Our Resources;

    We Need Your Help Now!

    Click Here To Watch Our YouTube Video Above To Learn


    Help Us Raise Funds To Begin Production and Distribution To Help Women Heal

    Brilliant Contours™, LLC, is serving the needs of women who suffer from breast-related health issues.  These beautiful garments are important whether the patient is recovering from ANY BREAST SURGERY, including breast augmentation, breast enhancement, breast reconstruction or mastectomy. We create innovative contouring and supportive garments that can assist in the corrective and stabilization process--Garments that help women heal physically, emotionally and spiritually.

    The company was started in 2013 by Janice Trane Jones. After having personally experienced the challenges of post-operative breast care, both with her own surgery and with that of her mother and her mother-in-law, Janice found surprisingly few options for women’s garments enabling recovery.

    She found that the available solutions amounted to nothing more than sports bras that were woefully inadequate to meet the special needs a woman has as she struggles with the discomfort and emotional trauma of post-surgical healing.  She found that virtually every woman who had undergone breast surgery was extremely unhappy and dissatisfied with the bras the hospitals had sent them home with. 

    Deeply committed to finding a solution, she decided to apply her some 25 years management experience, creativity and sewing skills and try and create a prototype bra that could be adjusted to conform as a woman would need it to be and the first product was born. That first prototype evolved over 20 months to the amazing comfort and support bra now ready to go out to the women of the world.  It features a completely new and innovative way of addressing breast healing and contouring in a bra which allows multiple adjustments to fit exactly to an individual woman's needs.  Additionally, the adjustments can be changed as healing progresses and needs change.

    "This beautiful support garment, tailored for women fighting breast cancer, helps them feel better about their femininity, about their chances of beating the cancer and about their physical strength as the bra gives physical as well as mental support."

    - Dr. Lois G. Steele MD, Tucson, AZ

    THE ANA'S HUMMINGBIRD COMFORT COMPRESSION BRA

    CONSTRUCTED FOR OPTIMAL COMFORT AND SUPPORT

                                                     The ideal post-operative

                                                  fitted compression garment



                          

                           • Unique patent pending strapping and holding system

                           • Innovative non-riding or sagging design    

                           • Unique front-opening zipper solution               

                           • Adjustable front straps for ease of use


                           • Treats each breast individually

                           • Post-mastectomy prosthesis pockets

                           • Addresses multiple complications or issues

                           • Allows for personal choice by the patient 

                           • Silhouette equalizing effect

                           • Strong support and durability

                           • Washable

                           • Non-allergenic

                           • Available in Proud Pink and Black colors

                           • Beautiful and soft fabrics

                           • Lacy, feminine, and fashionable in design

                         Top-quality construction, Made in the USA

    Watch This Interview with Breast Cancer Survivor Wendy Van Wie

    • This year alone, more than One Million Women in America will have breast surgery

    • Millions more will be treated for cosmetic breast issues

• Chances are that you or someone you love is currently facing breast-health issues


Why We Need To Raise At Least $45,000

Women facing procedures have emotional needs, prior to, during and after the breast surgery.

This is what we are all about. As a woman owned company, Brilliant Contours™ wants to provide products which help a woman feel good about her body, her emotional state and her physical comfort during and after recovery. The products reflect our concern and our mission to care about all women.

Janice has invested more than $100,000 which was used to hire an engineering firm, Phoenix Analysis & Design Technology, professional product developers/designers and to create numerous prototypes and conduct beta-testing during the more than 20 month development period. Nearly 15 different prototypes were produced as we perfected the Ana’s Hummingbird Comfort Compression Bra with the input from more than two dozen women who actually were in the recovery process. Now, we have purchased enough fabric to make the first 2,000 garments.  The fabric has been delivered to the sewing company in San Francisco which is ready to begin production.

Product Developers/Designers Cyndi Saggus (L) and Angela Anderson (R) have worked hard with Janice to bring these vital healing and stylish support garments to women.

Additionally, Janice has retained a marketing team to begin spreading the word to the news media and social media.  Janice has been speaking to numerous breast cancer awareness support groups and is scheduled for more presentations.  She also has begun the process for obtaining an FDA registration number which will allow women recovering from breast cancer surgery to be reimbursed by insurance companies for their Ana’s Hummingbird Comfort Compression Bra.

We anticipate completing our first production run in January, 2015.  During the first quarter of that year we will take delivery of at least 250 bras per month.  We are working with breast cancer support groups such as Bosom Buddies of Arizona and National Breast Cancer Foundation, Inc., and Susan G. Komen to spread the word about this remarkable new support garment that will mean so much to women dealing with the surgery.

Risks & Challenges

The greatest challenge Brilliant Contours faced was the actual design of the garment.  It took the input and suggestions of numerous women, together with the creative skills of Janice and her design team.

Future challenges will be gaining investment, both through Indiegogo and through private investment, in order to ramp up sales and distribution as well as increased production.  Janice has brought together qualified financial and operations executives to steer Brilliant Contours through the start up period now that the product design is complete.

Impact


Watch This Video to Understand


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Whether you can contribute a lot or only a little to this vital and important project, please help us get the word out through your social media, Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest and others.  Use the Indiegogo share tools. Visit our Facebook page and our website and help the women of the world learn about the healing benefits of Ana's Hummingbird Comfort Compression Bra!!!

    About The Perks

    In addition to her role as CEO of Brilliant Contours, LLC, Janice Trane Jones is a watercolor and oil painter currently residing in Phoenix, Arizona.

    Janice was honored to be accepted as the first Artist-in-Residence at Zion National Park during the fall of 2008. Janice won 3rd place in the “Wildlife” student division in Artist Magazine’s annual competition for 2009. She has also received numerous awards for her plein air competition oil paintings. Her most recent award was 2nd place at the Teton Plein Air Competition in Jackson Hole, Wyoming in June 2012.  She has sold over 400 paintings that are in private and corporate collections around the globe including Australia, Italy, Japan, Canada, Bosnia, British Isles and Germany. Two paintings are in the permanent collection of Zion National Park.

    Among the various Perks being offered to you in appreciation of your donation to our Indiegogo crowd-funding campaign are several prints of Janice's hummingbird original paintings.

    When you donate $15, we'll send you a heart felt "Thank You" note, signed by Janice.

    When you donate $25 you will receive 5" x 7" print of one of Janice Trane Jones' original Hummingbird paintings, "Hummingbird Duet."  A real collector's print.

                                             


    For your donation of $60, you get this great tank-top in white featuring the Brilliant Contours hummingbird icon ... This was a special request by some of Developer/Designer Angie's friends.

                                          



                                 

      Take advantage of a $100 donation perk which is a high quality Brilliant Contours hummingbird logo T-shirt.

                              

    As an alternative perk for a $100 donation you will receive Beautiful Hummingbird original painting print "Hibiscus Hummingbird Festival" on giclee printed media.  11" x 15" dimensions ready for framing.

                            


    Donate $360 and receive Ana's Hummingbird Comfort Compression Bra in Proud Pink or Black.  We will contact you by phone or email to ask your choice of color and size.

                              

    Donating $750 Includes four,  8" x 10" Matched Hummingbird Mat Mounted Prints on giclee printed media with 11" x 14" mat, personally signed by the artist together with a Gift Box of comfort items AND an Ana's Hummingbird Bra in your choice of Proud Pink or Black.  We will call you or email you to get your choice of color and size.

    At a $5000 donation level.  Ten Ana's Hummingbird Comfort Compression Bras will be donated to breast surgery patients in your name through the Bosom Buddies Breast Cancer Support Group.  Each bra will be inscribed with the name of a breast cancer survivor.  You can choose the names of the breast cancer survivors to be inscribed on the bras, or we will.  You get to hand deliver the bras to your local chapter of Bosom Buddies, or we can ship them to the group with a letter explaining your role in this wonderful donation.



    THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
recoop

Recoop is an innovative solution design organization focused on customized One Health solutions to combat global antibiotic resistance at its primary source: animals.

view our full business plan at z.umn.edu/recoop

 

Indiegogo

What We Need & What You Get

Long story short, we need some additional financial assistance to make our dream of reducing antibiotic resistance and improving global public health come true. Any amount helps!

Check out our perks! You can get some pretty awesome things like:

  • The chance to name a chicken (or a dozen!)
  • Recoop swag like t-shirts and stickers
  • Personalized souvenirs from Uganda

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Like and share our Facebook page at facebook.com/recooppublichealth
  • Share this campaign to your friends, coworkers, enemies, etc.
  • Send good vibes to us as we travel to Uganda this summer

So, what’s the impact?

The problem of antibiotic resistance

The United Nations recently identified antibiotic resistance as “a fundamental, long-term threat to human health, sustainable food production and development.” In the country of Uganda, bacteria that cause the most common clinic-treated illnesses have been found to be up to 100 percent resistant to the treatment of the available antibiotics.

While there is a high incidence of excessive antibiotic use in humans via OTC drugs, a large contributor to the resistance levels in countries like Uganda is the excessive use of antibiotics in livestock practices. In fact, 6 out of every 10 infectious diseases in humans are spread from animals. (https://www.cdc.gov/onehealth/) The consumption of animals with antibiotics as well as the excretion of excess antibiotics into the soil, groundwater, and environment significantly contribute to the global issue of human antibiotic resistance.

Our solution

At Recoop, we believe better-controlled antibiotic use can have large positive impacts on human health. We want to test this theory by launching our organization and running a pilot program this summer (2017) in Kampala, Uganda with local farmers.

Recoop will help local farmers become more efficient and cost effective with their antibiotic use within the poultry industry, since poultry is the main livestock protein consumed in Uganda. Our team members will evaluate the farm’s poultry raising practices and will aim to provide poultry farmers with a recommendation to reduce their overall antibiotic waste, while maintaining or increasing their overall poultry yield, and improving the hygiene of poultry consumption for humans.

Read more of our research and our full business plan at z.umn.edu/recoop

story:
Please save Alexandra’s life by helping her with brain surgery. At the best years of her life, 23 years old, in 2013, she was diagnosed with benign tumor called Cavernoma, located on the left collusum. Instead of enjoying youth, she was faced with life or death roll. Despite years of fighting the horrific destined illness, she had never lost hope to live her dream life and in a miracle of getting completely healed! But NOW, it’s the time for her inexplicable state of despair needing help and support from others.

Any, support you can share with Alexandra, would contribute in funding her final brain surgery in Germany, to save her life.

Alexandra had never experienced any symptoms of illness or issues with health. She grew up healthy and happy like any regular child. But one regular day, unexpectedly, she found herself waking up in the hospital with unbearable headache from losing consciousness, instead of her warm bed next to her family. Since, that day she was tithed to a lifestyle of endless vomiting, stress and anxiety attack, vision changes and all the challenges that the illness keeps bringing. Every night she lives with fear of going to sleep and waking up with terrible headaches and seizures.For years she had to be under monitor of doctors doing every treatment as possible including MRI monitoring. 

Cavernoma is a cluster of abnormal blood vessels that was found in her brain. It periodically bleeds in her brain and has been actively increasing its size, which is now standing at size of a 1.6 compare to initial 1. The process begins to grow close to the left ventricle in the front horn. 

Alexandra is now 30.5 years old, was lucky to meet the love of her life, with whom she is engaged. She dreams to have children and build healthy family, of what she cannot have with this condition. If she does now the baby or her might not survive. 

As her tumor is growing in tremendous speed, her only hope is to have this surgery in Germany, which she nor her family cannot fund. If you can contribute to her surgery, please donate below. The urgent surgery is scheduled for January 10th, 2020. At a given deadline, our goal is to make the surgery happen with everyone’s helping to save Alexandra’s life. All the funding from this will go towards solely towards her brain surgery that will take place in Hannover, Germany.

story:
Summary

Origin story

Lunch Break started taking shape after a particularly stressful morning at my day job. You know, the kind of morning with back-to-back meetings and dozens of e-mails each with their own manufactured emergency. By the time lunch rolled around, I was exhausted and dreaming of a siesta — sadly, a fading tradition — or a great mid-day meal like they enjoy in France. Instead, I ate chips out of a vending machine and spent 30 minutes scrolling through Instagram. I knew I was eating garbage and wasting my time, but I just didn't have the energy to come up with anything better. So, there I sat. 

Later that night, I found myself down a rabbit hole reading about how successful people spend their lunch breaks connecting, moving, reading, and eating well. I hated that I was often doing the exact opposite. Quickly, though, I realized that a year's worth of lunch breaks amounted to about 250 hours worth of time that could be spent living intentionally and actively working toward self-improvement. I just had to take advantage of the opportunity.

I decided to make a change, but I was missing the community and inspiration I knew I'd need to achieve results. So, I created Lunch Break to help myself and help others make lunch time more meaningful. Our first product is a weekly newsletter full of great reads and recommendations that reflect the things successful people do at lunch, but the long-term goal is to build a community that gathers digitally and IRL throughout the United States for lunchtime events and meet-ups.
 

About Kyle

I have nearly ten years experience working for some of the largest media organizations in the United States, including American City Business Journals, CNN, the Las Vegas Sun, and the New York Post. Along the way, I've designed newspapers and websites, reported and edited stories, and crafted digital product strategies that grow audience and revenue. I will be able to draw from the skills I've developed from these experiences to successfully grow Lunch Break. 

 

Impact

We live in a society that is over stimulated, over weight, and over worked. We're not so good at taking care of ourselves, and when we do talk about self-care it's usually in the context of a glass of wine and a face mask after work. If we're going to spend a third of our lives at work, shouldn't we take care of ourselves there, too? And shouldn't we do it in a way that is both meaningful and practical? 

 

What we need and what you get

What we need

If Lunch Break reaches its funding goal of $15,000, we will be able to start creating some original content, cover the costs of e-mail and web hosting, and implement a marketing strategy that will allow us to welcome 25,000 people to the Lunch Break community in its first year. Hitting this goal will position us to start offering subscribers book clubs, mentorship, networking and other IRL events that build authentic relationships and community ... all over lunch, of course.
 

What you get

We've set up a generous perk system to thank you for playing such an important role in launching the Lunch Break community.  

 

Risks and challenges

Prior to seeking crowd-funding, I tested the concept for Lunch Break with over 1,000 e-mail subscribers to test content strategy and determine whether this idea was worth pursuing. I took great care to make sure friends and family were excluded to gather unbiased feedback. The test generated encouraging results, and in less than a month since the test Lunch Break has doubled to nearly 3,000 subscribers.

Not only is Lunch Break growing, but it is beating industry averages in terms of engagement. According to MailChimp, the average open rate for media and publishing newsletters is 22% and the average click rate is 4.7%. The Lunch Break open rate is 29.8% and its click rate is 9.4%. The combination of rapid growth and strong engagement suggest a strong foundation for success.

Of course, there are still risks:

  • Lunch Break relies on original and aggregated content; if we meet or exceed our goal we will be able to produce more original content. If we do not meet or exceed our goal this will be tougher and money will primarily be used to fuel growth.
  • We have a proven marketing strategy that blends paid and organic growth. We believe we have a realistic plan that will result in 25,000 subscribers in year one, but there is no way to say for sure. 
  • Larger publishing companies with content, marketing, and sales teams could easily replicate this idea.

Check out the sample issue to learn more.


Other ways you can help

If you're unable to contribute, there are still other ways you can help make Lunch Break a reality:

  • Sign up for the Lunch Break newsletter; invite five friends to sign up, too
  • Share this campaign with colleagues, friends and family
