Share this campaign with colleagues, friends and family

story:
A Passion for Working With Special Needs

As an Adaptive Physical Educator, and Director of Easter Seals Community Based Programs for 18+ years, Cameron attuned her skills and her passion for seeing the potential of clients being in warm water.  Spanning from mild Arthritis, minor surgeries to major special needs such as Cerebral Palsy, amputation, Stroke and Parkinson’s. 

“Seeing the postures and pain of clients that come in with intense pain and movement issues, then their faces and even smiles as they leave, has been my biggest teacher and inspiration.“

Special Needs

This campaign is to raise money for an Aquatic Lift so we who work at the AquaZen Center can service our Special Needs client’s in safety and with ease of entry and exit from our pool environment. 

At this time our 13 X 17 foot above ground pool is located in an area where there is some degree of difficulty walking down to the pool, from where a car is parked.  Once on the deck entry into the pool is steep for anyone suffering from any problems with knees, hips or back.

The Aquazen Center, besides the day to day services we provide clients,  are committed to a once a month Free Clinic, that services any one who has financial or physical needs. 

Another one of our projects here at the Aquatic Integration Institute is to work with the Wounded Warrior’s, men and woman returning from the war with Post Tramatic Stress Disorder (PTSD).  The lift will enable those who have difficulty in walking a safe way to enter and exit the pool.

Our goal in purchasing the lift will be to provide safety and have a broader ability to service a larger population of clients needing Aquatic Therapy.

Your contribution will help us to achieve this goal, and be a service to the many who will now be able to receive aquatic therapy.  


What We Need & What You Get

The Aquatic Integration Institute is a privately funded and owned entity.  It’s daily costs and pool maintenance are privately paid for, its revenue earned is minimal.

So that we can purchase the Aquatic Lift we are asking for help.

We need $5,000 to purchase and install an aquatic lift.  Our goal is simple in that all the $ raised will go directly for the lift, if the $5,000 is not raised whatever $ is still needed to complete the purchase the Institute will cover the balance. 

All monies that are gifted are tax deductible and so a receipt will be sent to everyone participating in the fundraiser. 

The Impact

The impact that this lift will give to our Central Coast Community (especially North County) will be both large and significantly small. 

The Institutes purpose is to provide Aquatic Therapy to all peoples.  Those that can afford the therapy and to those who cannot..  So your contribution will be felt on the larger scale by the population of people who cannot get services either because of finances and or because of physical restrictions.

And on a smaller scale to those who can afford treatment but need a safe and easier access getting into the pool. 

Please think about all the people you know, friends and family members that you would like to invite to a pool, and know that your contribution will make this easier for those that may have not been able to attend due to safe access. 

Risks & Challenges

The risk to this fundraiser is non- existent.  This is not a money-making proposal, this is a service oriented project.  The only challenges and risks so far have been that clients who come to the pool have had to walk down quite a ways from their car to the pool over terrain that compromises someone who has balance and coordination issues.  This fundraisers goal is to create a better risk, challenge free environment for access. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We so appreciate every one of you that has gotten this far in reading our proposal.  Please know that you can help as well even if money is not what your able to give now.  If you can send on this invitation to anyone you know or can think of that may know someone that may know someone.  Please spread the word.  The more the word spreads, the more likely we will be able to install a lift to service those with special needs.

You can go to the indiegogo share tools and easily send our invite out to as many people as you wish. 

Again our Warmest Thanks for your support ~~~ Cameron West, Aquatic Integration Institute


Cameron West, CMT, SEP

Currently serves as the Director of Aquatic Integration Institute at the AquaZen Center in Templeton, where she develops and directs Practitioner Programs with concentrations in Aquatic Integration™ & Watsu®, T’ai Chi and EASY (energy aquatic shiatsu yoga).

Cameron is the founder of Aquatic Integration Institute (Aii) and Aquatic Integration, a form of water therapy which combines Eastern meridian and point work with myofascial release, proprioceptive neuromuscular facilitation and breath-work and has proven highly effective in a range of clinical settings from psychological and emotional release modalities to traditional rehabilitation of orthopedic trauma and spinal cord injury. She currently specializes in the training of practitioners in Physical and Somatic Therapy practices, in spas and health centers worldwide. Her Aquatic Integration curriculum has been approved for program credit by the Harbin School of Healing Arts at Harbin Hot Springs, Worldwide Aquatic Bodywork Association (WABA) and National Certification Board for Therapeutic Massage & Bodywork (NCBTMB).

story:
GIVE SOMETHING BIG.

Leigh Hurst was diagnosed with breast cancer at 33, and since then has gone on to create the Nationwide Non-Profit Feel Your Boobies® which raises awareness for early detection of breast cancer in young women. Leigh's creative campaigns through Feel Your Boobies® have saved countless lives, but now she's taken her mission one step further--to help women navigate the steps that come after a diagnosis. 

 For the first time ever, in her debut book SAY SOMETHING BIG, Leigh walks through her own breast cancer journey with advice and stories from five other survivors she met directly through Feel Your Boobies®. From processing the moment of diagnoses to celebrating cancer-versaries, Leigh provides insight and tips on what newly diagnosed women of any age can expect along the way and how these five women made big changes and decided to Say Something Big after finding their little lumps.

Sprinkled with inspiration and a bit of humor, Say Something Big is a Breast Cancer Support Group in a book: small enough to carry with you to those important appointments yet packed with encouragement to help make your voice louder than it ever was.

 

 

What We Need

We need this book to find itself to those who need it. By donating one or more books at whatever level you choose, you'll be helping a newly diagnosed woman find comfort, healing, and a bit of humor to accompany her on one of the hardest journeys of her life. 

Here's where the book copies will go:

  • Breast cancer outreach centers
  • Hospitals with breast cancer programs
  • Breast cancer support groups
  • To the non-profits run by the women included in the book who have bravely used their diagnosis to SAY SOMETHING BIG, and who continue to provide support and awareness for breast cancer. 

 

The Impact

The impact is a ripple that we hope won't end. Our goal for SAY SOMETHING BIG: Feel Your Boobies®. Find Your Voice. is that this little book helps women in a BIG way. 

Leigh was diagnosed with breast cancer on April 7th, so we're using her cancer-versary to SAY SOMETHING BIG. A diagnosis will change your dreams, but you can consciously create new goals with inspired direction that just might change someone's whole world. 

It's been 17 years since Leigh's diagnosis, so we're running this campaign for 17 days.

With your help, we'll be able to place 200 books across the world in various hospitals, centers, and non-profits who will deliver a free copy of SAY SOMETHING BIG, to a woman newly diagnosed. 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can financially participate during these trying times. Here are some other ways you can help the GIVE SOMETHING BIG campaign:

  • Help us by sharing the campaign on social media. Breast cancer doesn't take time off from Covid, and there may be someone on your feed who is newly diagnosed and needs a copy who can download a free Ebook!
  • If you've read the book or download the free Ebook, you can help by leaving a review on Amazon. Once the book as over 50 reviews, Amazon will promote it within the breast cancer category and expand the reach for this special book.

The Impact
The impact is a ripple that we hope won't end. Our goal for SAY SOMETHING BIG: Feel Your Boobies®. Find Your Voice. is that this little book helps women in a BIG way. 
Leigh was diagnosed with breast cancer on April 7th, so we're using her cancer-versary to SAY SOMETHING BIG. A diagnosis will change your dreams, but you can consciously create new goals with inspired direction that just might change someone's whole world. 
It's been 17 years since Leigh's diagnosis, so we're running this campaign for 17 days.
With your help, we'll be able to place 200 books across the world in various hospitals, centers, and non-profits who will deliver a free copy of SAY SOMETHING BIG, to a woman newly diagnosed. 
 

 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone can financially participate during these trying times. Here are some other ways you can help the GIVE SOMETHING BIG campaign:

Help us by sharing the campaign on social media. Breast cancer doesn't take time off from Covid, and there may be someone on your feed who is newly diagnosed and needs a copy who can download a free Ebook!
If you've read the book or download the free Ebook, you can help by leaving a review on Amazon. Once the book as over 50 reviews, Amazon will promote it within the breast cancer category and expand the reach for this special book.

story:
Convert your fear to freedom! Use protection!

Help us spread this important message by sharing this campaign now.  Bra-kets are for all women AND all the men who love them.

Our story:

We women struggle  with the issue of no pockets in our clothing.   So we all use our bras as a pocket because, we wear one with every outfit and, we need to carry things discreetly.  This was a problem of convenience only, until we all started needing our phones on us at all times.  Carrying a cell phone in a bra only creates another problem, which is the potential danger of having an electronic device close to our bodies.  Both the Radio Frequencies and the heat from a phone are major concerns. 

Does a cell phone in a bra cause breast cancer?  Does it not? 

We worry the answer may be…yes

Sadly, research has NEVER been done to provide evidence, but, it is a huge debate in the media and medical worlds right now.  In the meantime, The Bra-ket solves both the problem of convenience AND safety.

Your first reaction to “The Bra-ket” may be to laugh a little bit.  We are NOT offended!  In fact, the idea of The Bra-ket started from friends making fun of me for always carrying my phone in my bra and calling it my bra-ket.   

Behind all the jokes though, I was secretly terrified that using my bra as a pocket for my phone was dangerous!  Like many of you, my life has been personally affected by breast cancer as my mom is a survivor.   Actually, I don’t know a woman who isn’t scared of this disease and, I see women every day who have their phones in their bras.  Even at my last mammogram, the nurse praised The Bra-ket because she sees women using their bras to carry phones all the time.

I was inspired by the EMF protection devices used by the military and I thought  “There must be a way to provide safety while allowing a phone signal”.   Now, after  much research, design, and testing,  we have Bra-ket launch!  


What's a Bra-ket?

 The Bra-ket is a radio frequency shielded,  and heat Resistant cell phone case that attaches to your bra-strap so you can wear your phone and, carry your other stuff next to your body, more safely.  LETS BE SAFE, NOT SORRY!

Check out these additional Bra-ket benefits:

  • RF protection does not affect phone signal
  • Attaches to ANY bra strap, purse strap, backpack, etc
  • Protection and convenience anywhere
  • Stays put during any activity
  • Sleek design made with soft, comfortable materials

  • Detachable jewelry style strap 
  • No fussy attachments that can snag or ruin clothes
  • Separate outer pocket for cards, cash, ID, keys etc
  • Four sizes to accommodate all phone styles
  • Washable 


IMPORTANT:  WOMEN WHO WEAR A PACE MAKER OR ANY KIND OF HEART DEVICE SHOULD NOT WEAR A BRA-KET.


Bra-kets make safety.. sexy!

                                         

         do THIS.....

                                       

        NOT that!

Women love jewelery so we have added a jewelry type strap to the Bra-ket.  In fact, since the clasp is a silver locket, we affectionately call the strap, " the Locket for your Bra-ket".  With this strap, we can add bling to a Bra-ket, making it more fun and personalized.    Currently, there is only one bling option for a Bra-ket.  It's a bra charm in pink. Part of the campaigns funds will allow more bling, and color options.  


Bra-ket quick facts:

  • You don’t have to be a (DD) double diva!  A Bra-ket can be worn with any body type on any type of bra 
  • Choose the size Bra-ket that fits your phone, not your body size
  • Can be adjusted in any bra cup or even wearing a camisole for comfort. 
  • Patent Pending
  • The Bra-ket will not affect your phone signal
  • Shielding fabric is certified to contain no harmful substances and is independently tested for shielding performance.  Non-conductive surface, no grounding needed.  Does not contain flame retardant.  Has been tested for up to 30 washes  without reduction of protection.
  • The Bra-ket does not claim to prevent cancer, only to provide Radio Frequency shielding and heat protection when used as directed.
  • The Bra-ket is currently manufactured in the USA

How does a Bra-ket work?

First you choose which side, left or right, you want to wear your Bra-ket.  Then insert the strap through the corresponding loop on The Bra-ket,  wrap the strap around the bra strap and clasp.

Position the Bra-ket in the bra cup for comfort, always making sure the LOGO FACES OUT, as the shielding is in the back of The Bra-ket.   Place phone and any other items in your Bra-ket and enjoy!

"Using a spectrum analyzer to evaluate cell phones alone,  compared to cell phones in a Bra-ket resulted in reductions in RF emissions consistent and exceeding the specifications shown on the RF data and  information sheet." (see graph on gallery page) James Bailey, Engineer, CEO HVOD, August 30, 2013

Where we are now:

The initial design and independent testing are complete  and we have an amazing result in the Bra-ket!

Our first limited  production run is done and our market test  has been very successful.  No one who says bringing a product to market is cheap has ever done it.    To this point, we have paid for all the costs  but now, to spread this movement around the world, we need your help.  


How your contribution will help:

  • Global advertising and distribution
  • Mass production to bring manufacturing costs down
  • Continued research and development to gain traction and stay ahead of competition
  • Offer a wider variety of colors and design options in a timely manner
  • Packaging for efficient display and shipping


Risks and challenges:

If we don't meet our goal, we will continue to manufacture and distribute The Bra-kets to the best of our financial ability.  We feel  committed to The Bra-ket movement and believe it is important there be availability of The Bra-ket  for all women who "tuck and stash"  in their bra.

Can't contribute now?

Even if you can't contribute now, please use the Indiegogo sharebuttons and help us spread our Bra-ket movement message.  Imagine the peace of mind you can share.  Thank you sincerely, Your Breast Friends at The Bra-ket!

story:
Lutfen yeni linkimize gidiniz:

Hem NY hem de LA gozlemcisi icin hedefi arttirdik. Yeni linkimiz: 

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/amerika-daki-turklerin-oylari-yola-cikiyor/x/8357402

seçimlerin dürüstlüğünü garantilemek, oylarımızın boşuna gitmediğinden emin olmak için çok acil yardımınıza ihtiyacımız var…


çoğumuz vatani görevimizi yaptık, reyimizi kullandık.  şimdi oylarımızın sağsalim teslim edilmesi için maddi desteğinize ihtiyacımız var.


demokrasinin birinci kural (ve klişesi) "kişiler hak ettikleri gibi yönetilirler". hegel'e atfedilir. zalim bir sözdür.. başka bir versiyonu "her millet layık olduğu şekilde yönetilir"... daha bile zalimdir. churchill'e, montesquieu'ye, ve atatürk'e atfedilmiştir. esasında kaynağı joseph de maistre'dir. ama kime atfedilirse atfedilsin, aklın yolu birdir.


modern demokrasi, veya çağdaş batı demokrasisi, azınlık hegamonyasıdır. çoğu ülkede bu azınlık burjuvazidir. vatandaşın demokrasiye katılma yetisi seçme ve seçilme hakkıyla, yani oy hakkıyla sınırlıdır.


şimdi sıra verdiğimiz bu oyların başına birşey gelmeden YSK’ya tesliminde.


son dakikada aldığımız bir haber üzerine, maalesef bütçe problemleri sebebiyle gözlemciler oylarla birlikte Türkiye’ye uçamıyor.  oyların güvencesi için, gözlemcilerin de refakat etmesi gerek oylarımıza.  


bu bir parti mevzusu ådeğil-- hangi partiye destek olursanız olun (veya olmayın), maksat demokrasinin demokratça işlemesine katkıda bulunmak.


oylar 5 ağustos 2014 günü saat 23:15’de (new york saatiyle) new york’dan, saat 18:20’de (los angeles saatiyle) los angeles’dan kalkacak THY nin tarifeli uçağı ile Türkiye’ye gönderilecek. bu sebeple gözlemci arkadaşımızın, AKP gözlemcisi arkadaşı yalnız bırakmadan birlikte uçabilmesi için desteğinize ihtiyacımız var.


aynı uçakta olmaları gerek ve şu an New York ve Los Angeles’tan kalkacak uçuşlarda bilet ücreti $2135 ve $2500.  $3000’e ve hatta $3500’e kadar çıkabilir gün içinde.  o nedenle, hedefi $10000 koyduk.


unutmayın! belki de tarihe indiegogo’nun en kısa zamanda tamamına ulaşılmış projesi olarak geçeceğiz. sizin yardımınızla. 


verdiğiniz oyların güvenle yerine ulaştığından emin olmak hepimizin dileği… o zaman bu dileğin gerçekleşebilmesi için yardım elinizi uzatın.

şimdiden çok teşekkürler...

belki de tarihe indiegogo’nun en kısa zamanda tamamına ulaşılmış projesi olarak geçeceğiz. sizin yardımınızla. verdiğiniz oyların güvenle yerine ulaştığından emin olmak hepimizin dileği… o zaman bu dileğin gerçekleşebilmesi için yardım elinizi uzatın.şimdiden çok teşekkürler...

story:
About Purna Yoga 828

The Director of PY828

For those of you who don't know me, I'm Letitia Walker. I've done a lot of things in my life: philosophy professor, business owner, boutique manager, author, musician, and for the past 13 years, I've taught yoga. Opening a studio has been a long-held dream of mine. I feel so lucky to have the opportunity to realize this dream and introduce Purna Yoga to an ever-growing base. I can’t wait to share the studio and the benefits of Purna Yoga with you. Thank you for participating in the PY828 community.

"Letitia Walker’s dedication to yoga is obvious to anyone who has taken a class with her. Her knowledge of anatomy, biomechanics, and the poses themselves as well as the care and compassion she shows each student reflect how thoroughly she has absorbed yoga as an education, a discipline, and a lifestyle."  – A. N., long-time student and registered nurse

A State of the Ancient Art Facility

Purna Yoga 828 is a full service yoga studio with a large group practice space and a smaller room for privates and more intimate classes. PY828 represents my ideals for a yoga studio: beautiful, hardwood floors, a well-lit space with natural light streaming in, 12’ high ceilings, responsive climate control, and a wide variety of props to help every student go deeper in their practice.

And at the top of the prop list: the largest expanse of Great Yoga Walls of any studio in town! The Great Yoga Wall is used for a variety of purposes including releasing tension in the spine and deepening standing poses, twists, backbends, and restorative poses. It’s an invaluable tool for therapeutics as well.

PY828 will provide daily classes covering asana, pranayama, and meditation; monthly, 2-3 hour, mini-workshops on specific themes and topics; quarterly weekend workshops with nationally-known, traveling teachers; and continuing education for those who want to take their practices deeper.

 

What is Purna Yoga?

Purna is a yoga practice with both deep lineage and its eyes on the future with one foot in science and anatomy and one foot in the spiritual. At the heart of Purna Yoga is a safe, sustainable practice exploring anatomically-focused asana, nutritional and lifestyle information, applied philosophy, and a strong meditational component.

                  

Co-founder (and my teacher) Aadil Palkivala, after 40 years of studying with B.K.S Iyengar, discovered ways in which Iyengar’s work could be modified for greater safety and efficacy. With his wife, Savitri, creator of Heartfull™ Meditation, Aadil started Purna Yoga with the mission to teach people, not just poses, by adding the spiritual and mystical teaching of India’s independence movement founder, Sri Aurobindo, and his collaborator, The Mother.

Aurobindo’s philosophy can be summed up in one quote: “All life is yoga.” Purna, meaning complete, embodies this by addressing the whole person – body, mind, emotions, and spirit.  

Purna Yoga is great for first timers and people returning to yoga after an absence. It is also great paired with other forms of yoga such as Vinyasa Flow, as its slower, more deliberate style teaches an awareness that makes faster, more flow-based yoga safer and more effective. 

Purna Yoga addresses all kinds of aches, pains, and imbalances — whether physical, mental or emotional. It’s preventative as well as curative — making the already healthy, healthier with greater strength, stamina, and mental focus. It’s a style that can facilitate physical and personal transformations from the superficial to the deep. 

 

What we need:

The costs of modifying a preexisting space into a functioning yoga studio can really add up. When I found the space at 697D Haywood I knew it had great potential but needed A LOT of work.

The lighting was all fluorescent, the floor was a concrete slab covered with stick-on tiles, and the HVAC system was noisy and unreliable.

In order to make PY828 the best yoga facility it could be, I need to add the following:

  1. FLOORING – Engineered Maple hardwood flooring will be installed in the two studio rooms, providing a solid, sturdy, beautiful foundation on which to practice.
  2. YOGA WALLS –  All components of the Great Yoga Wall are custom made in America and assembled for precision and safety.  
  3. LIGHTING – We’re increasing the natural light by adding two large windows in the big room, one large window in the small room. Dimmable LED lighting allows us to control the light as needed for any class, from our early morning “Awake and Aware” to our Sunday afternoon restorative class, “Inverted Lake”.
  4. PAINT – the interior of the space also needed to be brightened. It took over 50 gallons (!) of paint to make the black ceiling white, but the results were worth it. Color is a real priority for Purna Yoga (this will also be reflected in the clothing we sell), and we want our walls to be as warm and welcoming as possible.  
  5. HVAC SYSTEM – Each room in the studio will be zoned for ultimate climate control that is immediately responsive to the student’s needs. We’re making all the necessary improvements to insure the atmosphere in both studio rooms are optimized.
  6. PROPS AND RESOURCES – Props, props, and more props! From foam to cork to wooden blocks, Three Minute Eggs, foam pads for shoulder stand and more, yoga belts of a variety of lengths, bolsters of all shapes and sizes, blankets, sandbags, backless yoga chairs, and more. PY828 believes in props!
  7. We will also have a small retail section for props, yoga-wear, and books to support your yoga studies and home practice.

None of these aspects on their own is cheap, but taken together they become truly costly.  We want to provide the already existing Asheville yoga community with the best possible yoga facility and are asking for your help to make this dream a reality.

 

Here's how you can help:

Choose your perk!

We're offering a wide variety of introductory packages so you can try out the studio and see what Purna Yoga can do for your health and wellness. Look over the perks and see which is right for you. 

Share!

If you’re a regular Purna Yoga student, please share this campaign on social media to let other potential students know about this new yoga opportunity! Simply click on the links at the upper right corner (next to the video) to share on Facebook and other sites.

With his wife, Savitri, creator of Heartfull™ Meditation, Aadil started Purna Yoga with the mission to teach people, not just poses, by adding the spiritual and mystical teaching of India’s independence movement founder, Sri Aurobindo, and his collaborator, The Mother.Aurobindo’s philosophy can be summed up in one quote: “All life is yoga.” Purna, meaning complete, embodies this by addressing the whole person – body, mind, emotions, and spirit.  Purna Yoga is great for first timers and people returning to yoga after an absence. It is also great paired with other forms of yoga such as Vinyasa Flow, as its slower, more deliberate style teaches an awareness that makes faster, more flow-based yoga safer and more effective. Purna Yoga addresses all kinds of aches, pains, and imbalances — whether physical, mental or emotional. It’s preventative as well as curative — making the already healthy, healthier with greater strength, stamina, and mental focus. FLOORING – Engineered Maple hardwood flooring will be installed in the two studio rooms, providing a solid, sturdy, beautiful foundation on which to practice.

YOGA WALLS –  All components of the Great Yoga Wall are custom made in America and assembled for precision and safety.  

LIGHTING – We’re increasing the natural light by adding two large windows in the big room, one large window in the small room. Dimmable LED lighting allows us to control the light as needed for any class, from our early morning “Awake and Aware” to our Sunday afternoon restorative class, “Inverted Lake”.

PAINT – the interior of the space also needed to be brightened. It took over 50 gallons (!) of paint to make the black ceiling white, but the results were worth it. Color is a real priority for Purna Yoga (this will also be reflected in the clothing we sell), and we want our walls to be as warm and welcoming as possible.  

HVAC SYSTEM – Each room in the studio will be zoned for ultimate climate control that is immediately responsive to the student’s needs. We’re making all the necessary improvements to insure the atmosphere in both studio rooms are optimized.

PROPS AND RESOURCES – Props, props, and more props! From foam to cork to wooden blocks, Three Minute Eggs, foam pads for shoulder stand and more, yoga belts of a variety of lengths, bolsters of all shapes and sizes, blankets, sandbags, backless yoga chairs, and more. PY828 believes in props!
We will also have a small retail section for props, yoga-wear, and books to support your yoga studies and home practice.
None of these aspects on their own is cheap, but taken together they become truly costly.  We want to provide the already existing Asheville yoga community with the best possible yoga facility and are asking for your help to make this dream a reality. Here's how you can help:Choose your perk!We're offering a wide variety of introductory packages so you can try out the studio and see what Purna Yoga can do for your health and wellness. Look over the perks and see which is right for you. Share!If you’re a regular Purna Yoga student, please share this campaign on social media to let other potential students know about this new yoga opportunity! Simply click on the links at the upper right corner (next to the video) to share on Facebook and other sites.

story:
Short Summary

I am Luz Adriana Cobos, Colombian and Swiss citizen. I studied Computer science engineering in Colombia and a MBA (specialized in Entrepreneurship and Business development) in Switzerland. I lived in Geneva, Switzerland where I worked with the United Nations System.

For the longest time I felt I was not living  my life of purpose and in 2010 I decided to start a new chapter in my life. Then I became a yoga teacher, studied nutrition and alternative therapies. In 2017 I packed everything and came back to Colombia for good (after living 21 years in Europe) with the project of building a Center for yoga and human development: Akashaja. 

*View of the project when finished

The campaign "Help opening doors with Akashaja" it is a project from the heart. I feel many people in Colombia (as it is around the world) want to go back to their roots and  to the important and  simple things of life.  Akashaja wants to offer courses and workshops with subjects related to human development having as a main axe Yoga, meditation, vegan food and nature. I believe the center has the potential to show undiscovered doors (talents, intentions, possibilities) and to help people to INvolve and re-connect to their true self, convictions, dreams, ideas and life purpose.

*Main Building (400 sqm)

Akashaja won´t be a hotel and will be opened for courses and workshops according to a specific calendar. In order to be able to create a financial stability we need to have ready the occupancy for 30 people. 

Although I collected all my savings and my pension fund to build this dream, these resources will cover only 2/3 of the project.

The crowdfunding will provide  1/3 of the total financial resources we need to cover the construction of  lodges for part of the guests,  the main yoga practice room and two pedestrian paths to go uphill. This will  allow us to be operational from the beginning. 

Investment map

What We Need & What You Get

With your contribution we will build everything in guadua (bamboo´s big thicker sister), green roofs, wood walls, solar electricity, dry toilettes, bamboo opened sky showers. In our compromise to be socially responsible we will keep using Colombian Guadua, national materials as much as possible; employing independent specialized Colombian Guadua constructors and wood artisans, local workers and  respecting Mother nature in the whole process. Your contribution can help us to maintain the Spirit of sustainability and ecology that guides this project from its very start point. 

You can see a breakdown table of the fees covered with the crowdfunding: 

Perks

Akashaja is about experiences, learning, sharing, having fun, meeting new people and so are our perks.

Our perks  are about  percentage of discounts that you can claim for one of our courses.  Perks can be claimed when we start functionning (we expect to open 60% of the occupancy by January 2019).

We are a services organisation and we are looking forward to having you in one of our courses and thank you for your support.

* Courses subjects: yoga, massage, bioconstruction, permaculture, taichi yan, taichi zhen, qigong, selfdefense, herbs, essential oils, handcraft, astrology, pendulums, energy therapies, amerindian tradicional culture and more.

Once we open the center you will have a variety of theme courses and you will have the possibility to claim the perk (discount) on "the one course " that catch your eye and your heart. It is not only about the discounts but the possibility to visit the beautiful region we are located. 

If we don't reach the goal

If we don't reach the goal, we will use the collected funds to build as much as we can with them. Banks interest in  Colombia are extremely high and we will prefer to go as far as we can with the collected funds rather than contracting an expensive credit. We will wait until we have more money to finish the construction in the scenario of being short on financial resources

Render of a lodge for four people

The Impact

Akashaja can contribute to the Colombian dreamed peace after decades and generations of internal conflict. How come? Yes, because many of us understood that peace can' t be signed and declared, we understood that it solely relies as an individual choice, conviction, intention and willingness to be discovered and lived.

In our 30.000 sqm we produce only organic fruits (different kind of mangos, oranges, lemons, mandarines, cacao, avocado, guanabana, banana, lulo and more) and we will have our own organic vegetables and herbs. In the near future we will produce organic essential oils and we will teach people how to use them. We have many other native trees that are used for medicine and health purposes, and others that silently mantain the ecological equilibrium, and we want to bring this knowledge back to people's life. 

Akashaja's vision is to help people to regain their power and retake responsibility over their health and life. We want to accompany them in their process, show them possibilities and teach them tools to balance their physical, spiritual and intellectual life: we are spiritual beings having a human experience and we are here for a purpose.

Risks & Challenges

Since 2/3 of the project are financially covered, we don't have debts and we have already constructed the main building, I will say there are more challenges than risks. Yet, risks are related to not making enough money to keep the place running in the long term, bad weather that will force us to cancel courses or workshops.

Our main challenges will be:

  1. To accommodate a minimum of participants to reach an even point and be able to pay our staff, services, logistics and bills. 
  2. Create workshops, courses, music concerts and expositions that will fulfill people' s expectations.

To overcome the challenges, a connected team with good deep intentions, ideas and harmonized energies will materialized this spirit. We are working with yoga teachers, taichi instructors, vegan chefs, local farmers, crafts(wo)men, traditional healers to create coherent and fun programs to be offered. We are ready to listen to people's ideas and suggestions.

Render of the Shala (main yoga room practice and lodge for 12 people)

Other Ways You Can Help

You can always share our Indiegogo link campaign, using the share tools with your friends, networks, contacts, family.

Thanks for your help!

story:
About the Campaign

Prior to the pandemic, the Home Run Collective (Andrea, Jaime, Kevin, and Noel) and The Woodlands had planned to host the 4th annual Couch or 5k on June 6th. In the interest of health and safety but in the spirit of togetherness, we are pivoting to a virtual run this year and invite you to join us by supporting Misfit Manor, a small nonprofit with a shoe-string budget and a big-hearted focus on “unadoptable” animals, and The Woodlands. This year, the decision has been made for all of us: call it the Year of the Couch. 

Over the last three years, the Couch or 5k has provided critical operating support for Misfit Manor, making the absence of this year’s event a unique challenge for the organization during a time that is challenging for everyone.

We are hosting this virtual fundraising event to encourage past, would-be, and future Couch or 5k participants to dig deep as a community of runners, donut enthusiasts, and animal lovers to maintain their support while partaking in the perks of the race that are still possible - enjoying the idyllic grounds of the open Woodlands Cemetery, winning prizes, eating donuts, and getting that t-shirt!

Throughout the next month, we will also select winners for gift cards and other prizes contributed by our partner, sponsors and other local businesses, and will offer special prizes for runners tagging themselves at The Woodlands (@woodlandsphila). So keep an eye out for communication during the campaign!

About Misfit Manor

Misfit Manor is a small nonprofit dedicated to rescuing, rehabilitating, and rehoming at-risk animals, providing refuge to those that cannot be adopted out, and reducing the number of owner-surrenders by helping people care for their companion animals.

For those interested in supporting Misfit Manor but unable to participate in the campaign, donations of any amount can be made via CashApp ($MisfitManor), PayPal (misfitmanorrescue@gmail.com), or Venmo (via @JaimeMorgan).

Feel free to reach out to us at dogs4donuts@gmail.com with any questions.

story:
Summary

Hello, we are Monica Gentile, Italian/Berlin-based choreographer, dancer, and movement researcher and Michael Reiley McDermott, American composer and teaching artist. We have been working independently in our fields of dance and music for over 15 years.

In late 2017 we began to integrate our teaching modalities into a new system of research for dancers, artists, yogis, and meditators called Listening Bodies.

We have had amazing feedback from the workshops we have taught in Philadelphia and Berlin. We are invited to teach in Mexico and Costa Rica next year. Sadly a funding source did not work out to pay for our travel costs which include:

  • Flights from Berlin to Mexico
  • Buses and smaller flights between Tulum, Puerto Vallarta, and Mexico City
  • Flight to San Jose, Costa Rica
  • Buses and taxi in Costa Rica
  • Flights back to the US and Europe.

The Impact

We are super excited to be developing this framework of teaching that integrates so many threads of our artistic, movement and sound practices. We really can't wait to spread our knowledge to the communities we are scheduled to teach in Mexico and Costa Rica.

Funding for the arts is a very precarious operation. Often, at the last minute, a funding source from grants and institutions can disappear. This is what happened to us. So we are turning to crowdfunding to pay for this part of our project. We are also hoping to build a community of supporters and contacts to help us grow the connections we are cultivating through our Listening Bodies work.

Your support means a lot to us. 

Our Work

Listening Bodies workshops includes practices in Movement Research/dance improvisation and partnering, Deep Listening, breathing techniques, sound-walks, guided meditations, mindfulness of listening and singing performance scores. Listening Bodies integrates Monica and Michael’s interest in physiology, anatomy, somatic practices, paleontology, evolutionary biology, neuroscience, and artificial intelligence.

During our travels, we will be working a lot! We are teaching eight workshops (and Michael will be performing a few concerts) in Mexico and Costa Rica (so far). Each work workshop ranges in length from 4-hours to several days. Every workshop takes a lot of time and writing, planning, coordinating, administrating, promoting, creating sounds (and some translating). So for two months, this will be our full-time jobs!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially there are other ways to help:

  • Send the campaign to a family member or friend who could support.
  • Share this Indiegogo campaign link on social media
  • Send us feedback through our website about ideas for future Listening Bodies project.

T H A N K Y O U

______________________________________________________________________________

Stiamo portando il nostro laboratorio di Pratiche Somatiche + Deep Listening in Messico e Costa Rica e abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto!

Abbiamo sviluppato una struttura integrata sul corpo e il movimento somatico, le pratiche di ascolto e la consapevolezza sonora. Siamo stati invitati ad insegnare questo laboratorio in diversi luoghi in Messico e Costa Rica. Abbiamo bisogno di raccogliere fondi per pagare i nostri costi di viaggio. 

Per favore, fai parte della nostra esplorazione in una nuova frontiera della ricerca e dell'indagine artistica.

La nostra storia:

Ciao, siamo Monica Gentile, coreografa, danzatrice e ricercatrice italiana / berlinese e Michael Reiley McDermott, compositore e artista americano. Abbiamo lavorato in modo indipendente nei nostri campi di ricerca artistica di danza e musica da oltre 15 anni.
Verso la fine del 2017 abbiamo iniziato ad integrare le nostre modalità di insegnamento in un nuovo sistema di ricerca chiamato Listening Bodies rivolto a  danzatori, artisti, praticanti di Yoga e meditazione.

Abbiamo avuto un feedback straordinario dai workshop che abbiamo tenuto a Philadelphia e a Berlino. Siamo invitati a insegnare in Messico e Costa Rica il prossimo anno nel 2019. Purtroppo una fonte di finanziamento non ha funzionato per pagare i nostri costi di viaggio che includono:

  •      Voli da Berlino al Messico
  •      Autobus e voli interni tra Tulum, Puerto Vallarta e Città del Messico
  •      Volo per San Jose, Costa Rica
  •      Autobus e taxi in Costa Rica
  •      Voli di ritorno negli Stati Uniti e in Europa.

L'impatto:

Siamo entusiasti di esplorare questa base di insegnamento che integra così tanti fili con le pratiche artistiche, di movimento e sonore da noi sviluppate. Inoltre abbiamo passione nel diffondere le nostre conoscenze alle comunità dove andremo ad insegnare in Messico e Costa Rica.

Il finanziamento per le arti è un'operazione molto precaria. Spesso, all'ultimo momento, una fonte di finanziamento da sovvenzioni e istituzioni può non essere disponibile. Questo è quello che è successo a noi. Quindi ci rivolgiamo al crowdfunding per pagare questa parte del nostro progetto. Speriamo anche di costruire una comunità di sostenitori e contatti per aiutarci a far crescere le connessioni che stiamo coltivando attraverso il nostro lavoro Listening bodies.

Il tuo supporto significa molto per noi. E ricorda che la tua donazione Indiegogo è deducibile dalle tasse!

Il nostro lavoro:

I workshop di Listening Bodies includono pratiche in Movement Research / improvvisazione di danza e partnering, Deep Listening, tecniche di respirazione, camminate sonore, meditazioni guidate, mindfulness dell ascolto e performance sonora. Listening Bodies integra l'interesse di Monica e Michael per la fisiologia, l'anatomia, le pratiche somatiche, la paleontologia, la biologia evolutiva, la neuroscienza e l'intelligenza artificiale.
Durante i nostri viaggi, lavoreremo molto! 

Daremo 8 laboratori (e Michael eseguirà alcuni concerti) in Messico e Costa Rica.  Ogni laboratorio durerà  4 ore al giorno per diversi giorni. Ogni laboratorio richiede molto tempo per la preparazione, la scrittura, il coordinamento, l'amministrazione, la promozione, la creazione di suoni (e in alcuni casi la traduzione). Quindi, per due mesi, questo sarà il nostro lavoro a tempo pieno!

Altri modi in cui puoi dare il tuo supporto, se non puoi contribuire finanziando ci sono altri modi per aiutare:

    Invia la campagna a un familiare o un amico che potrebbe supportare.
    Condividi questo Link della campagna Indiegogo sui social media
    Inviaci un feedback attraverso il nostro sito web sulle idee per meglio sviluppare il nostro progetto Listening Bodies

GRAZIE !

Quindi ci rivolgiamo al crowdfunding per pagare questa parte del nostro progetto. E ricorda che la tua donazione Indiegogo è deducibile dalle tasse!Il nostro lavoro:I workshop di Listening Bodies includono pratiche in Movement Research / improvvisazione di danza e partnering, Deep Listening, tecniche di respirazione, camminate sonore, meditazioni guidate, mindfulness dell ascolto e performance sonora. Listening Bodies integra l'interesse di Monica e Michael per la fisiologia, l'anatomia, le pratiche somatiche, la paleontologia, la biologia evolutiva, la neuroscienza e l'intelligenza artificiale.Durante i nostri viaggi, lavoreremo molto! Daremo 8 laboratori (e Michael eseguirà alcuni concerti) in Messico e Costa Rica.  Ogni laboratorio durerà  4 ore al giorno per diversi giorni. Ogni laboratorio richiede molto tempo per la preparazione, la scrittura, il coordinamento, l'amministrazione, la promozione, la creazione di suoni (e in alcuni casi la traduzione). Quindi, per due mesi, questo sarà il nostro lavoro a tempo pieno!Altri modi in cui puoi dare il tuo supporto, se non puoi contribuire finanziando ci sono altri modi per aiutare:    Invia la campagna a un familiare o un amico che potrebbe supportare.    Condividi questo Link della campagna Indiegogo sui social media    Inviaci un feedback attraverso il nostro sito web sulle idee per meglio sviluppare il nostro progetto Listening BodiesGRAZIE !

story:
Greetings Community!

This story began 5 years ago when I completed my 3-year training in Herbal Medicine.

Living in Oakland, I was bright-eyed and bushy-tailed about attending my first herbal symposium, then in existence for 23 years, just 3 plus hours north of where I lived.

I’ll admit- it had its merits. However, I was disappointed. Disappointed to be one of only two African American women in attendance out of some 300 participants. Not to mention, very few other faces of color, including the teaching staff, graced my presence-- from what my naked eyes could see and fine-tuned ears could hear.

Disappointment was an understatement. Not because containers such as those are unfamiliar, but rather, the under-representation of cultures with people of color in this vast world of ancient plant medicine and healing ways was so prevalent. Where were we?

My name is Tanya Henderson and I’ve been working as a practitioner in the field of Holistic Health & Natural Healing since 2006.

I founded the Women of Color Herbal & Healing Retreat (WOCHHR) nearly a year ago in efforts to inspire a healing environment that centers women of color seeking to reclaim the ancient ways of our ancestors and bathe in self-care practices connected to plant medicine and healing rituals. Prior to this, in 2015, I co-founded the late California Women of Color Herbal Symposium- a prime example of these needed spaces for Women of Color. However, the more sustainable they are- the better we fare!

This October is our 1st WOCHH Retreat , welcoming women of color from all lineages and ages to gather in celebration and healing. It is a place for grandmothers, mothers, daughters and granddaughters to have an inter-generational experience rooted in ancient wisdom. This precious and necessary space invites a deep awakening, embodiment, connection and inspiration through plant medicine teachings, indigenous life skills, womb wellness, nourishing meals and sisterhood. It is a homecoming and opportunity to teach, learn, rest, rejuvenate and commune with and on sacred land.

The WOCHH Retreat hopes to inspire:

  • A deeper connection to the plants & their medicines
  • An awakening and reclaiming of ancestral lineage and ancient medicine ways
  • Embodiment of self-care practices and healing from the inside out
  • Self & community empowerment
  • Cultivation of a strong sisterhood and healing community

Class Offerings:

  • Dreaming w/Plants
  • Distillation and the Art of Self Care w/Essential Oils & Hydrosols
  • Flower Medicine for the Heart & Spirit
  • Healing the Womb through Reproductive Justice & Traditional Medicine
  • Connecting w/Spirit Guides
  • Herbal Skin Care
  • Natural Plant Dying
  • Ma Yoni 'aT Womb Yoga

Ceremonial Offerings:

  • Rites of the Womb
  • Embodiment Healing
  • Fire Circle
  • Indigenous Dance & Drumming

 

We really need your help!

We are looking to raise $15,000 and believe that it IS possible with the help of community!

We recognize that we are holding something truly sacred in the palm of our hands- a radical healing movement ready to be born. We are working as diligently as possible in the deep alchemy stages of creating something from nothing. This is part of the magic and medicine we carry as peoples of color, and yet, we are trying hard to break the cycle of giving to the point of depletion and debt, as many of our ancestors were either not paid fair wages or at all for their labor.

As we bloom from survival mode into a thriving space of existence with your help, our intention is to bring this healing work forward into our community and beyond in a way that is sustainable from the inside out. We intend for this abundance to ripple forward to future generations who will, in turn, carry forth this sacred work.  All of this, however, requires a strong financial foundation.

We anticipate anywhere from 60 to 80 women and girls to be in attendance at the Retreat. And while the desire is high, the funds are low and intimidating for some potential participants who live paycheck to paycheck. We would like that no one be turned away for lack of funds.

While registration fees will cover much of the venue cost, there are external expenses that cannot be met without this funding.

Your donation will help us to cover:

  • Educational & printing costs
  • Teacher compensation
  • Scholarships
  • Class supplies
  • Administration costs
  • Seed funding to reserve next year's venue

Your contribution will also help us build a legacy of hope, healing and resiliency across the spectrum of communities of color and beyond. With these funds, we look forward to deeply exploring and embracing our her-stories from the ground up. Our stories will be retold through the eyes of ancient wisdom.

Please know that we are grateful for whatever you can contribute, as no gift is too small!

Your support makes a difference to every woman and child able to attend our Retreat as well as to those who love us and benefit directly or indirectly from our work in the world!

Other Ways to Support the WOCHH Retreat:

  • Spread the word by sharing our campaign across your social media networks using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Please tell women & girls of color about our Retreat via the link below:

        https://www.eventbrite.com/e/women-of-color-herbal-healing-retreat-registration-46604885467

  • Send us your blessings for a powerful & healing Retreat!!!

 

YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS ARE GREATLY APPRECIATED. THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING OUR CAMPAIGN. WE LOVE YOU!!!

story:
Vital Beat, Perth's Hip Hop Yoga studio, is coming to the north!

After 18 months delivering Hip Hop Yoga to the 6056 'hood, we're now bringing our signature style of beats & flows, to a space the City of Joondalup - and YOU can help us create the location you've been dreaming of.

We're a small family business with a dedication to building a powerful community around a love of yoga, and we want to show north-side how we pair our signature yoga with the kind of tunes that bring a smile to your face, and a wiggle to your hips. 

WHO ARE WE?

At the heart of true joy, we can always find music - music elevates our moods, warms our soul, enhances our performance, and stimulates our creative energy. It has the power to heal our hearts and enrich our lives.

The merging of music and yoga is not a new concept, but the music we choose at Vital Beat is a special kind of fun. It makes you smile, laugh, and wiggle your hips in downward dog. It makes you tap your fingers on the mat, hum your favourite tune, and get lost in the beauty of the beat. Yoga is the pursuit of bliss, the union of our mind, spirit, and body, through movement and breath. At Vital Beat we simply add a layer of rad music to help carry you out of your daily grind and bring you to a state of being present on your mat.

Hip hop yoga blends a dynamic flow yoga class with hip hop, RnB, funk, and soul, to create a fun, non-judgemental, and vibrant atmosphere. Our teachers are talented, warm, engaged, and supportive. Our Classes are energising, interesting, and both laughter & booty shaking are encouraged. Hip hop yoga embraces the therapeutic and joy-inducing benefits of music, and a sweet bass line, to take students through their practice. We sweat, we stretch, then we savasana!

Do we have just one class style? Nope! We offer Hip Hop Vinyasa, Slow Jamz Flow, Slow Jamz Yin/Yang, Soul Train Yin, Yogasculpt, Pregnancy Yoga, Mums n Bubs Yoga, Family Yoga, Kids Yoga, Meditation Classes, Charity Events & Retreats.

Want to know more about the class styles we offer? Pay us a visit at our Midland studio! Or check out our class descriptions here

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

Opening a new premises is no mean feat, and we're going to need a few things to get us off the ground!

1. Flooring -  warm, smooth, hygienic, and kind on your body

2. A sound system - because yoga + beats calls for a kickass stereo & subwoofer (fully sick)

3. Yoga props - bolsters, mats, blocks, and straps for a comfortable, supported practice, and

4. Furniture for a beautiful, calming, reception area that just makes you want to hang out!

5. Insurance, to protect both our premises, and our amazing teachers & students

 

And here's the thing though... we would never ask for something for nothing!! Unless of course you're utterly altruistic and thats cool too!

For your contribution to making our dreams a reality, you get amazing gifts, like discounts and access to our classes. Dont live near Joondalup? Thats fine! You can choose to use your class passes at our Midland studio!*

Have any questions about either of our studios? Get in touch, homie... kaye@vitalbeat.com.au

Can't donate this week? Thats cool, we'd totally love it if you SHARED this campaign on social media, to help us get the word out <3

*Normal membership rules apply

Learn more about us below:

Media:

  • Article: Nominated for Business Award 
  • Article: Social Media propels success
  • Feature: Spotlight on Vital Beat

Videos:

Collaboration with MSWA for 2017 World MS Day

Collaboration with Karrinyup Shopping Centre

Collaboration with Vicinity Centres for Midland Gate Flashmob Yoga

Feature for Big Review TV

story:
Help Me Seize the Day at Carpe Diem

My name is Debbie. I'm qualified in several Holistic therapies, Accounting and have management skills. For the last year I've been looking for a full time job as the kids are growing up and are less dependent. Having been out the serious work place for 15 years to bring up children(my own, Foster children and now step children) I have not even been offered an interview in anything other than in care work which i have done as a part time job all my adult life. I was starting to despair when this opportunity kept presenting itself in many unexpected ways over a couple of weeks, a dream, several people whom Id never met telling me about it, a relations new business same title. Eventually I couldn't ignore what was being shown to me and found out more information. 

The opportunity is to be a partner in ' Carpe Diem Therapy Center',

Carpe Diem is in Staple Hill, Bristol, quite an impoverished area. The center is a great but an under used resource with bundles of potential. It could with work provide a full time income for me,It will enable me to use all my skills and make me a very happy person with focus and purpose and to pursue my passion.

I love and wholey believe in the ability of Holistic therapies, Im a qualified Aromatherapist, meaning i know how to use essential oils to help ease symptoms experienced by clients. I and a reflexologist, by using the feet according to ancient chinese medicine it is possible to stimulate or soothe all of the body internal and external, opening the meridians to help the healing process. I am also qualified in Indianhead massage which is great for headaches and neck tension from office work and driving. Hopi ear candles which are helpful for migraines, sinus problems and are very calming for people or children who have ADHD, and lastly I am also qualified in Crystal Reiki. The center has a resident Physiotherapist and the other partner has many qualifications too. All in all we will offer a good all round service and are hoping to provide affordable therapies for those who need them

I have a small amount of money saved, as a mother of 5 dependent children that money is our emergency fund and its not nearly enough. I need to raise up to £5000 to give me enough to pay the lease deposit, annual service charge and public liability insurance, plus the rent whilst building my client base. A full refurbishment is needed as the place is tired, the outside needs new Signage and inside needs a complete overhaul, repainting and some furniture needs replacing. I have all my therapy equipment already to take in.

As a partner it will give me the chance to provide a service at a low cost for those who need it. I believe absolutely in the benefits of holistic therapy but I also feel it is often out of reach for those who most need it as it is often an expensive luxury. I want to show that Holistic therapies can be as effective as medication to help some illnesses and change the way people think. Also to offer other therapists affordable room hire in a clean relaxing and well equipped setting.

I'm not asking for money to just be handed to me, I would love the opportunity to work for it, so please, book a therapy with me then donate the fee, come and have your nails done and donate the fee, let me do your accounts and donate the fee, recommend me to someone who might do the same. Of course if you would just like to support me by making a donation that would be fantastic too.

I believe I have the skills to make this work with my back ground. I am already working in there trying to build up a client base so that in April I will be on my way to earning enough to cover my part of the rent and other costs plus an income. I also will be continuing with my part time job for the foreseeable future so I have a back up plan. We could if need be see if another therapist would be interested in coming on board too. 

If coming and having a treatment isn't possible and you have no accounts for me to do or unable to help me in a financial way, please spread the word, recommend me, share this on your social media. I would greatly appreciate any help.

story:
As-salaamu'alaikum!  We want to present an amazing opportunity for everyone to take advantage.  We believe there is nothing more powerful, more beneficial, more life-changing than going to Mecca and Medina. And of course the reward in it for those who perform it, as well as those who support it, is immense.  We are taking a group of youth and adults on our annual Umrah Retreat in December, insha'Allah. 

If you can support a person to make umrah, or help them by reducing the cost associated with the trip to bring it within reach for others, that would be truly appreciated. There are many who have never gone, and yearn to go, but cannot due their financial limitation.  For those that have gone with us previously, the impact has been lasting till this very day. 

The package price we have worked out is $2495 plus transportation to IAD (DC) airport.  Any amount that you can give will be helpful insha'Allah.  If many pitch in even a small amount, it turns into a lot, which can bring a great benefit and reward bi'idhillah. 

May Allah swt accept from everyone. JazakumAllahu khairan!

story:
Overview

Eliza Bishop / Ngawang Lhakyi
My first Buddhist Teacher was a Sakya Nun (Spanish by birth) living in New York City who was also my Iyengar Yoga Teacher. Her presence, speech, and instructions were charged with clarity on a level I had never encountered previously. I attended her classes as much as possible and then in 2008, decided to stop my life in New York City, give away all my belongings, and purchased a one way ticket to India. Shortly thereafter, I was working in a school in South India, for children with autism, and incorporating yoga and meditation, into their curriculum. After 3 months in this school, the way became clear to travel to the north of India, to Dehradun, and study yoga with Swati and Rajiv Chanchani who implemented a national program of Yoga In Schools across India. I took the train for several days and arrived in Dehradun where I got into a white taxi, who drove me into town, and as I exited the taxi, a nun was standing there, and told me to go and get a blessing from His Holiness Sakya Trizin who lived just up the road, in his home monastery. This interaction was again full of intense clarity and also love. After several days in my little home at the Yoga Centre, I woke up one morning, and knew it was time to go down the hill and meet His Holiness Sakya Trizin. I skipped yoga class, and literally ran several kilometres down the hill to the temple. On the way down the hill a, Tibetan woman, Drolma, smiled and handed me a white kata, which I had no idea, what to do with, but I accepted this fortuitous offering. Then, I reached the temple, climbed the steps, and felt time and space literally stop, as I saw His Holiness Sakya Trizin sitting on his throne. Somehow I already knew what to do, to prostrate, to offer the kata, kneel for a blessing. I experienced the greatest peace - within - during this encounter. After this blessing, I sat down, as close to His Holiness, as possible, for about 6 hours, until the temple closed. Since this moment, in 2008, I have been listening to my teacher, His Holiness Sakya Trizin, speak of matters that have become increasingly important to me, and dearer to my heart, than I can express in words. I am indescribably grateful to HH Sakya Trizin and Khenpo Appey Rinpoche for their profound Root Teachings. 
Now, 6 years later, I have the incredible opportunity to make an 8 month, traditional, approximation, retreat with my teacher. This is the first time, such a precious gem, is even being offered in the western world. I am absolutely ripe and ready for this retreat, and the causes and conditions are arising in a positive way to support this aim of practicing and accomplishing the retreat. This is the step I have wished and aspired to take for 2 years, and now it's arrived. May this benefit all.

What I am asking for and offering

I am asking for the external support of 2,400 Euros and I will match this support from my own funds. The funding is going to the centre where I will make my retreat, as they will be providing my daily needs for the duration of retreat. 

The Impact:

The concept of retreat crosses many disciplines. Basically, it's an impeccable opportunity to practice without distractions, and in this way is a pure gift. I know that my perception of the world is deeply linked with my internal attitude. The process of transforming the inner self begins with the practices of meditation, recitations of sutras, and visualisations, among other things. By opening the mind of my heart - step by step - I can be free from illusions, expectations, ignorance, hope, and fear. 


I have successfully completed two retreats before, one in India, and another in Nepal though not of this length. I am so inspired by other practitioners who have completed longer retreats and integrated these realisations into their daily life. I also know I am so fortunate to encounter this opportunity so young. In the words of the great master His Eminence Chogye Trichen Rinpoche, "may the wealth which matures into the quintessence of dual benefit, be received, practiced, and transmitted on the fingertips of the fortunate, for time and space without beginning or ending."

Other Ways You Can Help

One of the biggest ways you can also support this effort is to genuinely share this campaign page with people who can actualise support for the project. I am grateful in ways beyond words, from my heart, for all assistance, sharing, and giving.
story_txt:
OverviewEliza Bishop / Ngawang LhakyiMy first Buddhist Teacher was a Sakya Nun (Spanish by birth) living in New York City who was also my Iyengar Yoga Teacher. Her presence, speech, and instructions were charged with clarity on a level I had never encountered previously. I attended her classes as much as possible and then in 2008, decided to stop my life in New York City, give away all my belongings, and purchased a one way ticket to India. Shortly thereafter, I was working in a school in South India, for children with autism, and incorporating yoga and meditation, into their curriculum. After 3 months in this school, the way became clear to travel to the north of India, to Dehradun, and study yoga with Swati and Rajiv Chanchani who implemented a national program of Yoga In Schools across India. I took the train for several days and arrived in Dehradun where I got into a white taxi, who drove me into town, and as I exited the taxi, a nun was standing there, and told me to go and get a blessing from His Holiness Sakya Trizin who lived just up the road, in his home monastery. This interaction was again full of intense clarity and also love. After several days in my little home at the Yoga Centre, I woke up one morning, and knew it was time to go down the hill and meet His Holiness Sakya Trizin. I skipped yoga class, and literally ran several kilometres down the hill to the temple. On the way down the hill a, Tibetan woman, Drolma, smiled and handed me a white kata, which I had no idea, what to do with, but I accepted this fortuitous offering. Then, I reached the temple, climbed the steps, and felt time and space literally stop, as I saw His Holiness Sakya Trizin sitting on his throne. Somehow I already knew what to do, to prostrate, to offer the kata, kneel for a blessing. I experienced the greatest peace - within - during this encounter. After this blessing, I sat down, as close to His Holiness, as possible, for about 6 hours, until the temple closed. Since this moment, in 2008, I have been listening to my teacher, His Holiness Sakya Trizin, speak of matters that have become increasingly important to me, and dearer to my heart, than I can express in words. I am indescribably grateful to HH Sakya Trizin and Khenpo Appey Rinpoche for their profound Root Teachings. Now, 6 years later, I have the incredible opportunity to make an 8 month, traditional, approximation, retreat with my teacher. This is the first time, such a precious gem, is even being offered in the western world. I am absolutely ripe and ready for this retreat, and the causes and conditions are arising in a positive way to support this aim of practicing and accomplishing the retreat. This is the step I have wished and aspired to take for 2 years, and now it's arrived. May this benefit all.What I am asking for and offeringI am asking for the external support of 2,400 Euros and I will match this support from my own funds. The funding is going to the centre where I will make my retreat, as they will be providing my daily needs for the duration of retreat. 
The Impact:
The concept of retreat crosses many disciplines. Basically, it's an impeccable opportunity to practice without distractions, and in this way is a pure gift. I know that my perception of the world is deeply linked with my internal attitude. The process of transforming the inner self begins with the practices of meditation, recitations of sutras, and visualisations, among other things. By opening the mind of my heart - step by step - I can be free from illusions, expectations, ignorance, hope, and fear. I have successfully completed two retreats before, one in India, and another in Nepal though not of this length. I am so inspired by other practitioners who have completed longer retreats and integrated these realisations into their daily life. I also know I am so fortunate to encounter this opportunity so young. In the words of the great master His Eminence Chogye Trichen Rinpoche, "may the wealth which matures into the quintessence of dual benefit, be received, practiced, and transmitted on the fingertips of the fortunate, for time and space without beginning or ending."


Other Ways You Can Help
One of the biggest ways you can also support this effort is to genuinely share this campaign page with people who can actualise support for the project. I am grateful in ways beyond words, from my heart, for all assistance, sharing, and giving.

story:
Short Summary

In January 2013, while on my healing journey, battling with a heart dis-ease called ARVD (Arrhythmogenic Right Ventricular Displaysia), I was introduce to Kemetic Yoga. Little did I know that 10 months later I would become a Basu (Kemetic Yoga Instructor).  In July of that same year, I was invited to become certified by attending Awaken the Maroon Within Holistic Retreat in Portland, Jamaica. Following the invitation I was very excited and was blessed to have found a way to make it there by November 2nd of that same year.  I am happy to report that the retreat truly awakened the power within me to heal. We all have that power within. It’s a matter of re-membering yourself and tapping into your life source. This retreat opened my eyes and made it possible for me (in spite of what any doctor can tell me) to become a Certified Basu. Today eye teach Kemetic Yoga daily for free and will continue on this healing path bringing hope to those who think they can't heal. This November is my 1 year anniversary as a Basu and I feel it is my duty to give back by helping and assisting at this year's certification retreat in Portland, Jamaica.

What We Need & What You Get

Your help is needed to make this mission possible. Humbly I ask that you be a part of this journey as well by helping this mission become a reality.

The mission requires that I raise $3,000 by October 17, 2014. The amount covers the airfare and 14 day retreat expenses. At this time any amount will help but for every $50 donated, you will receive a hand-crafted, adjustable, 100% copper bracelet as a gift from me to you. Please know that I will do everything in my power to raise these funds and will remain positive through it all. 

The Impact

The impact my mission will have on the students has everything to do with having the advantage of what most have thought to be a “mission impossible” coming from a woman with a chronic heart dis-ease who has fought against all adversity and is living to tell about it. Through it all I have achieved many accomplishments including raising a daughter, becoming a Massage Therapist, starting an in-home all natural health and beauty product line and recently becoming a Certified Kemetic Yoga Instructor. In spite of my will to thrive and see this mission through, your help is still required.

Risks and Challenges

The risks and challenges I face on a daily basis are real. But nonetheless I am detrmined to bypass all obstacles and move forward with this mission. This is my life's purpose to uplift fallen humanity and be a guiding light to those lost in the depths of the illusions and lies that keep them from healing.

Other Ways You Can Help

If this attempt does not reach its goal, the funds collected will still be contributed to the retreat. Remember you can always help by spreading the word and asking others to contribute to a healing cause.

story:
Overview 

 

We are The Food Friends of Knoxville, a local group of students at the University of Tennessee. Our mission is to raise at least $1,200 for Second Harvest Food Bank’s Food for Kids program. By donating you will not only help feed starving children, but you will help foster positive growth in our community and local economy. 

 

About Us 

 

The Food Friends is a group of students assembled in our Public Writing class. We are applying the skills we have learned in class to create a crowdfunding page to raise funds for Second Harvest.

 

Food For Kids

 

The Food for Kids program is arguable one of, if not the most, valuable services offered by Second Harvest. They provide vulnerable children, who miss meals on a regular basis, meals every Friday in order to combat childhood hunger over the weekend. Food for Kids is connected with 280 schools and teachers from these schools compile a list of students who are at risk of hunger. This program feeds kids in 18 different counties, and benefits over 12,000 kids. Children who participate in the Food for Kids program have reported improved self-esteem, behavior and concentration. 

 

How Childhood Hunger Affects Us All

 

According to feeding America, about one in every five children is East Tennessee is struggling with childhood hunger. Studies have shown that  with higher rates of childhood hunger tend to detriment overall economic growth. By donating to the campaign, you will not only help feed starving children, but you will also help foster positive growth in our community and local economy. 

 

What Your Donation Does 

 

Your donations will go directly to the Food For Kids program at Second Harvest. This Program is extremely efficient and effective in its efforts to end childhood hunger. Each Dollar you donate will provide three meals for a hungry child.

story:
It hit me one day in December 2015…

I came to realize that I’d been ignoring my inner-compass -- then landing in that same spot, feeling frustrated and resigned. I needed to get back into my element, my most passionate and life-transforming calling  - women’s empowerment...of mind, body, soul and overall quality of life.

And, my comeback would be anchored with a core, sustainable product and community that would appeal, bring together, and be accessible to women within the global marketplace.  It’s my pleasure to introduce the MY AMAZING LYFE MAP eCOURSE.

WHY A LIFE MAP?

It was crystal clear that I needed to understand WHAT was amiss inside of my WHOLE life. So, I pushed back, closed my door to the world and went inward. As I mapped out EVERY area of my life, I discovered:

  • I was randomly grabbing at opportunities because didn’t have a purpose-centered game plan for my life, post-AAWOT
  • I wasn’t harmonizing my WHOLE life, choosing to leave the harder, emotional stuff unchecked.
  • Without a guide, some of my choices were being made more out of desperation, than desire.

Consequently, I continued to hijack my money, time, relationships, self-confidence and well-being.

 

 

THE ELEMENTS:

  • The My Amazing LYFE Map eCourse is our anchor product which guides our community members through the creation of a 12-channel life map that encompasses wellness, emotional, spiritual, professional, financial and experiential freedom. Each “lab” includes goal setting, self-assessments, vision boards, challenges, community engagement, collaboration, and celebration.

 

  • My Amazing LYFE webinars and podcasts, to help support our community members’ life mapping and implementation journey. We’ll engage our expansive network of powerhouse coaches and trainers — each offering to share their gifts, products and services with our community — to educate, empower and inspire women.

 

  • My Amazing LYFE Retreats and local “pop up” events will bring our LYFE Maps and online connections to life with fun, live empowerment events throughout  the US and worldwide. These retreats will include rest and relaxation as well as local involvement and adventure reminiscent of past African American Women on Tour retreats in Paris, St. Kitts, and Barbados.

 

  • My Amazing LYFE branded collectibles, including customized journals, apparel, home accessories, and other products and services that women will need to advance their transformational journey.

 

  • My Amazing LYFE is proud to be in partnership with Polaris, a leader in the global fight to eradicate modern slavery. Named after the North Star that guided slaves to freedom in the U.S., Polaris systematically disrupts the human trafficking networks that rob human beings of their lives and their freedom. A portion of every My Amazing LYFE Map eCourse sold will be donated to this outstanding organization.

How will the money be invested?

Launch team: instructional designer, editor, marketing experts: $2,940

Website design, development and video production: $2,510

Crowdfunding fees (est.): $1,600

Advertising, promotion, Polaris donation: $1,950

Shipping and handling of rewards to contributors: $500

 

My Amazing LYFE Map focuses on your WHOLE SELF … not just the sexy parts:

 

  • LYFE Reality acknowledges your current situation without any fanfare or attachment, simply the starting point from which everything emerges and blossoms.
  • Emotional LYFE is key coursework to helping you unpack, resolve, then repackage past experiences and present circumstances  into bundles of forgiveness, fortitude and fascination.
  • Wellness LYFE helps you identify which small shifts you’ll make that will have a huge impact on your levels of stress or anxiety, energy, and overall physical well-being.
  • Family LYFE supports you, as you journey to  build, strengthen, redefine, or even rethink your most important relationships, within the boundaries of balance, harmony and happiness.
  • Love LYFE guides you through exercises  to soothe your mind, amplify your capacity for self-love, and open your heart to attracting, harmoniously caring for and being cared by your Divine right mate.
  • Social LYFE helps you to create time for fun, adventure and experiences in your life that are healthy, creative, diverse, community-building and memorable.
  • Professional LYFE supports the evolution of your intellectual, career and entrepreneurial goals so that you may fuel your genius, realize financial rewards, and serve to better humanity.
  • Money LYFE guides you through your perspective and affinity to making, keeping, investing and sharing money, as well as establishes course-correcting goals to build cash flow and wealth.
  • Experiential LYFE helps you to live beyond your comfort level, opening and trusting your mind and heart to new ideas, thoughts, feelings, perceptions of the world, beliefs and actions.
  • Spiritual LYFE helps you to better understanding and achieve soulful connectedness, as well as greater peace, gladness and thankfulness.
  • Core LYFE Values guides you to choosing what you stand for and why.  Every other LYFE aspect flows from this highest point of what’s core to your essence and principles.
  • LYFE Legacy guides you to define precisely what do you want to be known for. What legacy will you leave for your family, community, environment and the people you serve?

The My Amazing LYFE Movement stands for:

SELF-AWARENESS  |  SELF-CARE  |  SELF-ACTIVISM  |  SELF-LOVE

Live. Your. Freedom. Every Day!

 

This Course challenges you…

 

...to slow down, to quiet your mind and body; to connect with your core needs and desires – then commit them to “pen to paper” enhanced with soulful, energizing visuals, affirming words and symbols.

 

And, you’ll get plenty of aids, resources and prompts to help craft your realities, goals and milestones. Your LYFE Map becomes a living document, that you freely update as often as you wish.

 

Once you have your LYFE MAP Course, it’s yours for life. The one I completed in December 2015 is very different from mine today…as it should be, as we grow and evolve.

 

This Course includes Community…

...so you can connect with others who’re walking a similar walk. Sharing, encouragement and celebration are the central rules of our community’s engagement, growth and betterment.

 

This Course is about charitable giving…

...to combat human trafficking!  These causes are near and dear to me, and it’s a part of my calling to do what I can - what WE can - to help liberate and stand stronger for women and children at home and globally.
