story:
Please join us as we continue our program of providing nutritional support to our 70 Elderly clients in the Ngara district of Tanzania.  Our next step after sucessfully building our beekeeping station, is to build a large brick Chicken Coop and fill it with 100 Hens that will provide eggs as a protein source for our clients.  Protein in the diet is a very scarce commodity in Africa and even 2 eggs per week per client will raise their nutrition levels significantly.  

You can help us reach our goal by providing funding for the building of the Chicken Coop or by purchasing the 100 Hens or by providing feed for the chickens for the first year of operation.  As soon as we bring water to the district and plant grain we will be able to sustain the feeding of the chickens as a internal cost.  THINK about how important eggs are in our daily life and imagine that with your help we can provide a great source of food for our 70 clients.

story:
Let me tell you about my dog Osiris, she saved my life on more than one occasion, it may sound dramatic and maybe it is but without her I would have lost all hope in living. Osiris is an amazing, powerful spirit who came into my life at just the right time. She is playful, determined, and just doesn't give up and now she needs my help. 

Like many dog breeds, Osiris is prone to torn ACL's and desperately needs surgery to return her to a life of adventure, play and outdoor living. It's not been easy to ask you for help, as her owner I've worked really hard to save the money for her surgery. I'm an Uber driver and work at a pet hotel but every time I saved money life came up. Osiris is in pain, I don't want to let my pride get in the way of her being happy, healthy and pain free. 

So here is the deal, I've met a lot of other people who have dogs that suffer from the same problem, I want to earn enough to get Osiris surgery and then work with my vet to help other families get the same treatment for their dogs. Of course your donation comes with swag, check out our perks. 

And please don't forget to share this with your friends and other dog lovers. 

Remember, all the moneys past our goal will help other dogs get the same surgery.

story:
Short Summary

Take a moment and think...

Think about washing your hands; think about getting a glass of water, flushing the toilet, wash your hands with hands soaps... These are all things that most of us consider pretty essential to maintaining good personal hygiene to prevent water communicable diseases, right?

Now imagine that you were born into different circumstances. This is what life is like for millions of people in India’s most marginalised communities every single day. But with your help, we can change this.

In India, diarrhoea alone causes more than 1,600 deaths every 24 hours. At the root of this, more often than not, are unsafe water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) practices and facilities.

What We Need & What You Get

Our solution to this unfortunate situation is our HandWashing project, a small-scale, grassroots program with that will have a big impact. We plan to start a fundraising campaign which seeks to collect HAND SOAPS (50 gr size) to reach out to remote localities and help educate children in rural communities in north India.

We will provide 3000 hand soaps and 2 informative posters to each school (one in English and one in Hindi) for 6780 children of 24 schools and one orphanage in western Uttar Pradesh, eastern Haryana and New Delhi. The collection of funds will start the 8th of October until the 31st of October 2018.

Once we collect the funds for our project, we will prepare the distribution of the hand soaps to the children in the selected schools, as well as schedule the workshops during the provision of hand soaps (which will begin around the 1st of November until the 15th of November 2018). Then we will gather feedbacks forms from the schools teachers and principals to elaborate the final report of the project and its results.

The Impact

The impact that HEEALS wants to foster in children is to change behaviors on handwashing and WASH practices. This approach through handwashing training, adaptation and integration, will prevent children to suffer water communicable diseases and others infections, focusing their growth just in academic goals.

HEEALS seeks to improve access to safe and affordable drinking water for all by spreading the message on the importance of WASH practices to families in remote communities, creating networks between other communities improving the life conditions of the society. Using proper hand hygiene to keep hands clean is critical to reducing the risk of health care-associated infections in people. To reach the objective, it is crucial to support and strengthen the participation of local communities in improving water and sanitation management as well as stop open defecation practices, paying special attention to the needs of women and girls and those in vulnerable situations.

Risks & Challenges

The largest democracy in the world carries with it the world's hungriest country; Around 220 million Indians struggle to get the 2100 calories a day recommended by the WHO. Currently, India is the tenth richest country in the world and the first in number of undernourished. Child malnutrition rates in India are almost five times higher than in China and twice as high as in Sub-Saharan countries. Nearly half of all children - approximately 60 million - are underweight, 45% have excessive growth retardation for their age, 20% are stunted in growth (too thin for height, indicating acute malnutrition), 75% have anemia, and 57% lack a vitamin A.

Other Ways You Can Help

We also have several reports that highlight the need for WASH intervention in marginalized communities. The reports are available for viewing on our website: (http://heeals.org). As any NGO working towards a cause, the only obstacle to our endeavors is the lack of funding.


We look forward for your assistance to increase our financial resources to help materialize this campaign into a movement it is capable of being. We would be extremely glad and indebted with gratitude if your collaboration could help us achieve our dream.

story:
Make my hair make a difference.

Hi there! I'm Gabriel Creek. About 6 years ago my dad was diagnosed with Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis. It a progressive disease of the lungs where the tiny air sacs in the lungs (bronchioles) lose their elasticity. That's the "Pulmonary Fibrosis" part. Doctors often don't know the cause. That's what makes it "Idiopathic." My dad was one of the lucky ones.  He was able to qualify for a lung transplant. Without that surgery he was not going to be with us much longer. My dad's outcome only happens in about 6% of cases.

In March of 2020 I got a haircut. (I know, I know - which hair did I cut? Har har.) Little did I know, shortly after that, the Covid crisis would hit and the bottom of the world dropped out. I've not been to a barber since. My hair is now quite long, and I want to make a bald..er...bold choice with it. So I'm holding a contest for my next hairdo. 

Here's the deal: My hair is long enough that I can donate it to Children with Hair Loss. They create wigs for kids with medical conditions where hair loss is common (Chemotherapy, Alopecia, etc.). And my hair is soft and luxurious if I do say so myself. So I thought I'd donate my hair to them. Simple enough, right?

But what about the hair you'll have left?

That's where you come in. I've decided to create a contest for my next hairdo. You'll vote with your donations for the next 30 days. At the end of the 30 days, if I have reached at least $1000, I will drive myself right to the barber shop and cut my hair in the style that received the most dollars. 

Here's the catch: If I don't make $1000 in donations I get to choose my own style. But if we meet or exceed $1000, then I will not only get the style that received the most votes, but I must wear that style for a complete month before I can do anything about it.

Either way, all hair will go to Children with Hair Loss, and whatever donations I receive will go to the IPF Foundation. So even if we don't hit our goal, we'll still be able to make at least a small difference.

The Impact

My plan is to take whatever funds this campaign raises, and split the donations between two organizations: The IFP Foundation, and Children with Hair Loss. I'll send 75% of the donations to the IPF Foundation, and Children with Hair Loss will get 25% and my gorgeous locks.

The IPF Foundation is an independent, nonprofit organization founded with the mission to accelerate cures for IPF. We are here with a singular purpose — to support medical research to discover treatments and cures for pulmonary fibrosis. 

IPF incidence has doubled over the last decade. As a disease, IPF kills an estimated 50,000 people annually, with roughly half of all cases going undiagnosed. Despite the large number of lives impacted by IPF, it continues to be under recognized, and under studied. (https://ipffoundation.org/)

Children With Hair Loss is a 501 (c) 3 non-profit organization that provides human hair replacements at no cost to children and young adults facing medically-related hair loss.  When a child's hair is lost due to Cancer treatments, Alopecia, Trichotillomania, Burns, etc., the painful effects are far deeper than just cosmetic.  Each year, the number of children requesting our hair replacements increases and with your support, we can continue to increase the number of children we are able to help in the future! (https://childrenwithhairloss.us/)

story:
About me 

Hey, I am Latticia, a 23 year old passionate about wellness and self-care. From as early as 14, I have been watching my mother look after herself through eating well and nourishing her skin by making her own products like scrubs and masks. Around 16 to 19 I battled with acne and hyper-pigmentation, covering my skin in makeup to make myself feel somewhat confident. 

When I turned 20 I decided I needed to take a wellness approach to my body and my skin. Cutting out harsh chemical products, eating better and making skincare products to clear up my skin. 

LATTICIA as a brand is a chance for me to share my knowledge on ingredients and wellness. LATTICIA is a lifestyle brand, designed, formulated and curated by me. 

My brand

LATTICIA is a lifestyle brand rooted in wellness and self-love. 

LATTICIA  is derived from the Latin greeting laetitia (“joy”, “gladness”, “delight”).

Everything I make and create is a reflection of things I truly love, whether that is wellness related digital content, beauty products and  much more.

My values

Vegan - Using 100% natural, organic and plant based ingredients. Utilising simple formulation processes.

Multi use - Formulating products that serve more than one purpose

Holistic - Using ingredients with therapeautic properties to help aid and nourish skin.

Knowledge - Using social media platforms/ digital content to promote and inform my audience on a wellness lifestyle.

Effective - Selecting effective and nourishing ingredients to ensure that products work effectively.

Inclusive - Creating a lifestyle brand for ALL. Representation in imagery must be diverse. 

Eco friendly - Recyclable, Eco-friendly packaging. 

Safe - No soaps, No sulfates, No parabens, No synthetic, chemicals, No harsh exfoliants.

Empowering- A lifestyle brand that celebrates you.

My promise

To create a digital space and physical products that are centered around wellness and self-love.

Taking care of myself and using wellness as a form of self-care has been the greatest discovery for me. I hope that with my brand, I can continue to grow and share with others.

Help me get it to market

In order to launch my first product - the Whipped Shea Soufflé, I need £800.

This is how I will spend the money:

- £160 to meet cosmetic EU regulations 

- £90 for labels

- £65 for postcards 

- £85 for packaging 

- £400 for ingredients

How can you help?

By essentially pre-ordering my products you can help me to cover these costs. To have a product line and brand rooted in wellness is so important to me and you can make that happen by simply pledging.

When will I receive my order?

My campaign will run till the end of may. During the month of June I will be: sending out my recipe to be cosmetically tested, order labels, ingredients and packaging materials, setting up and launching my website and prepping campaign orders. You can expect to receive your goodies by the end of July.

story:
Help Us Grow

After a year in small studio space in Davidshall, we’ve decided to move to a bigger and quieter location in the new development of Sorgenfri (Rörsjöstaden / St. Knut). Our first year has exceeded our expectations and now is the time to continue to grow and develop. With your help, we will be able to create this new home!  See below for what we'll do with your donation.

 

Why Do We Need Funding?

As a small business wanting to grow, its difficult to take the leap and it can be difficult to survive. With help from our community we have a good chance to become a sustainable studio in Malmo for many years to come.

 

Our Vision & Plans for the Future

Yoga Roots was developed by the both of us with a wish to create an international, multi-cultural community for people in Malmö. We began this studio on a passion. We both moved from different countries to Sweden to pursue what we love and started Yoga Roots from the ground up - mat by mat. We have personally invested in the first year of the studio and now we are looking to anyone who loves our concept and who wants to help us grow!

 

We began small, with a focus and care for each and everyone of our students and our plan is to continue with this in the future. However, our vision for the studio has outgrown our current space. To fully create our vision, we need our own physical studio space and we have found the perfect studio for us - in a newly developed area, where we have the opportunity to choose each detail that goes into the studio. Our new space will have our own reception area, changing rooms, retail space (mats & yoga products), social & tea drinking area, shower and separate studio space. We feel like this is a great change to give our students what they need from their second home, while still maintaining our personal connection with our students.

 

What We Need

We are looking to raise 175,000 SEK / / € 18,000 to cover the costs of:

  • Hiring amazing teachers to the Yoga Roots team!
  • Essential equipment: such as bolsters, blocks, yoga straps, etc. needed with the expansion.
  • Furniture to build the reception, seating & lounge area and changing rooms  to make the studio feel like a true home.
  • Technology: computer, booking system, speakers and music for the studio.
  • Additional renovations to the space - installation of environmentally friendly flooring, high efficiancy ventilation, adding lighting, frosting and blinds for the windows, our logo on the window / doors.
  • Make a sustainable transition to the space: increasing in size, increases our monthly costs.

 

Perks

In return for your donation we have a range of great “perks” to choose from. You can take the opportunity to be one of the first students to use our beautiful new space. The options range from a discounted month pass to a VIP year membership, all which will be held at our new space starting in March! We are grateful for any support - big or small.

 

More about Yoga Roots

Yoga Roots is Malmö’s only purely international studio. The studio is founded by two female, international entrepreneurs: Bethany Henderson & Tereze Kestere. We offer a range of classes each week, from the calmest restorative yoga and yin classes, to the more dynamic vinyasa yoga, pilates and barre.

We also have a secret plan to premier a brand new concept - never before seen in the area! Keep your eyes out for this!

Read more on our website, www.yogarootsmalmo.com.

 

Other ways you can help

We understand that not everyone is able to contribute a financial amount. Please help us to spread the word about our new studio and our crowdfunding campaign on social media with your friends. Everything helps!

With love and thanks,

Bethany & Tereze

story:
East Tennessee Children’s Hospital is a non-profit that provides top medical care in the region for those who cannot afford it. They have an open door policy that doesn’t discriminate against race, religion, gender, or economic status.  They are committed to helping families and their children who do not have sufficient means to pay for health insurance or medical resources.


Where are your funds going? A LiteGait. What’s a LiteGait? I’m glad you asked.  A LiteGait is a  piece of equipment designed to help kids learn how to walk!  It’s designed to take away the body weight of the child so that they can learn how to walk without bearing any weight. The cost of this piece of equipment is just over $13,000, though. Yes, this is a large amount of money but you can help! We have set our goal at $1,000, with hope to raise more. Every donation is one step closer to reaching our goal.

 

The East Tennessee Children’s Hospital is vital to the Knoxville community.  Since they rely heavily on donations, you can directly impact the lives of your fellow Knoxvillians!

 

We understand that monetary donations aren’t always possible, but there are still ways you can help out. Spreading the word through social media and informing others can help advocate for the children. We appreciate any contribution you are able to make to help give kids hope to learn to walk again.

 

Best Wishes,

 

Jack, Katie, Christian, Porter, and Taylor

story:
OUR BEGINNING

By Carlos Noceda, Daniel Nuñez y Gian Carlo Zegarra.

A few years ago we began to think about a business model that would be friendly to agrarians. Within the development of this goal  we traveled to La Torre - Chinguirip, Cajarmarca in Perú, where we find the harsh reality of malnutrition and anemia experienced by thousands of children.
During this  trip we saw children fainting for half an hour, tired because of the lack of good food and drinking water. On this trip we met Mariluz, a 12-year-old girl who did not smile, because her parents had died a few weeks ago. His mother died  because of colics,  due to  lack of a medical care, economic resources, good food and care. Her father, died recently because of the alcoholism, due to a strong depression by the death of his wife. A short time later it suffered a heart attack and Mariluz next to her three brothers turned into  orphans.
From this trip, our business idea was not only to pay fair prices to those who foresee the Andean cereals, but we wanted to help change the lives of those affected children, trying to generate a responsible human consumption movement, which we will implement little by litte.

ABOUT NUTRISHAKE

Nutrishake, beyond being a company that sells nutritious products, focuses on helping its community, generating better jobs opportunities for agrarians, offering them a fair payment and a better quality of life for children suffering from malnutrition and anemia in Peru. We fight against this problem by financing projects with the same purpose.
We understand that the importance of responsible consumption is necessary, so we are starting to implement it  with our products, which not only benefit farmers and children, because it´s also beneficial to those who consume Nutrishake.
We are fully committed in the possibility of creating a movement that benefits all, bearing in mind that helping others that want to take care of theirself and others.
 

WHAT’S OUR BUDGET?


The last year we have helped 124 children throughout Peru. We hope to be helping 4000 children by 2019,.

Last year we helped 124 children in Peru, we estimate that by 2019 with your help we can improve the lives of 4,000 children suffering from malnutrition and anemia. That is why our budget to be raised with this campaign is $ 25,000, which will be used for the production of more products and the financing of new projects that combat this problem of children that would make this project a sustainable growth.

This budget is based on prior procedures, because this amount is a small part of the $ 150,000 we have budgeted to achieve our dream impact in 2 years time.

 

WHERE TO FIND US

Nutrishake´s office is located in the district of San Isidro in Lima-Perú, in a cowork of the ministry of production of Peru as a financed startup from entrepreneurship programs. ( Av. Guardia Civil 834). Here we have a small group with big hearts that is dedicated to work for responsible human consumption, which improve the lives of thousands of children.

WE’RE ONLINE

- Facebook: Nutrishake Andino.

- Instagram: nutrishakeandino

- Website:www.nutrishakeandino.com

 

MEDIA MENTIONS

- Gana más tv:

http://revistaganamas.com.pe/startup-nutrishake...

RISKS & CHALLENGES

The Andean cereal market in Peru is large and still more the nutritional beverages sector, since there are brands that have a larger commercial tray with a much larger budget; There is also the fact that people are often unaware of the importance of responsible human consumption and social interest, preferring to buy low-cost products.

 

OTHER WAY YOU CAN HELP

We appreciate you for reading this! You can help us by sharing the link of this campaign or talking about it, because all help is an important contribution for us.
Help us change the lives of thousands of children!
story_txt: OUR BEGINNINGBy Carlos Noceda, Daniel Nuñez y Gian Carlo Zegarra.A few years ago we began to think about a business model that would be friendly to agrarians. Within the development of this goal  we traveled to La Torre - Chinguirip, Cajarmarca in Perú, where we find the harsh reality of malnutrition and anemia experienced by thousands of children.During this  trip we saw children fainting for half an hour, tired because of the lack of good food and drinking water. On this trip we met Mariluz, a 12-year-old girl who did not smile, because her parents had died a few weeks ago. His mother died  because of colics,  due to  lack of a medical care, economic resources, good food and care. Her father, died recently because of the alcoholism, due to a strong depression by the death of his wife. A short time later it suffered a heart attack and Mariluz next to her three brothers turned into  orphans.From this trip, our business idea was not only to pay fair prices to those who foresee the Andean cereals, but we wanted to help change the lives of those affected children, trying to generate a responsible human consumption movement, which we will implement little by litte.ABOUT NUTRISHAKENutrishake, beyond being a company that sells nutritious products, focuses on helping its community, generating better jobs opportunities for agrarians, offering them a fair payment and a better quality of life for children suffering from malnutrition and anemia in Peru. We fight against this problem by financing projects with the same purpose.We understand that the importance of responsible consumption is necessary, so we are starting to implement it  with our products, which not only benefit farmers and children, because it´s also beneficial to those who consume Nutrishake.We are fully committed in the possibility of creating a movement that benefits all, bearing in mind that helping others that want to take care of theirself and others. WHAT’S OUR BUDGET?The last year we have helped 124 children throughout Peru. We hope to be helping 4000 children by 2019,.Last year we helped 124 children in Peru, we estimate that by 2019 with your help we can improve the lives of 4,000 children suffering from malnutrition and anemia. That is why our budget to be raised with this campaign is $ 25,000, which will be used for the production of more products and the financing of new projects that combat this problem of children that would make this project a sustainable growth.This budget is based on prior procedures, because this amount is a small part of the $ 150,000 we have budgeted to achieve our dream impact in 2 years time. WHERE TO FIND USNutrishake´s office is located in the district of San Isidro in Lima-Perú, in a cowork of the ministry of production of Peru as a financed startup from entrepreneurship programs. ( Av. Guardia Civil 834). Here we have a small group with big hearts that is dedicated to work for responsible human consumption, which improve the lives of thousands of children.WE’RE ONLINE- Facebook: Nutrishake Andino.- Instagram: nutrishakeandino- Website:www.nutrishakeandino.com MEDIA MENTIONS- Gana más tv:http://revistaganamas.com.pe/startup-nutrishake...http://revistaganamas.com.pe/startup-peruana-nu...http://revistaganamas.com.pe/nutrishake-andino-...- El Comercio:http://elcomercio.pe/economia/negocios/nutrisha...http://elcomercio.pe/economia/negocios/startup-...Startup Chile:http://www.startupchile.org/peruvian-startup-nu... http://gestion.pe/tecnologia/startup-nutrishake... RISKS & CHALLENGESThe Andean cereal market in Peru is large and still more the nutritional beverages sector, since there are brands that have a larger commercial tray with a much larger budget; There is also the fact that people are often unaware of the importance of responsible human consumption and social interest, preferring to buy low-cost products. OTHER WAY YOU CAN HELPWe appreciate you for reading this! You can help us by sharing the link of this campaign or talking about it, because all help is an important contribution for us.Help us change the lives of thousands of children!

story:
It’s time to expand the existing yoga and self-care culture into community healing! Healthy community is the prime factor for any successful healing and growth.

Hello! My name is Cassandra Vitale. I am a 500 hour certified yoga instructor, Reiki Master, EFT Certified Practitioner, and Artist.

It has always been my mission to give to my community and the world. I am happy that the mantra "Think Global. Act Local." is now used so commonly. The best way to give to the world—my sphere of concern—and make it thrive for us all is by doing what I can within my sphere of influence.

I have lived in Long Beach, my sphere of influence, for 32 years, having grown up in the Bixby Knolls neighborhood where I have been a student, desk receptionist, and teacher at FreeSpirit Yoga for the past 9 years. I went to high school at Long Beach Polytechnic, and college and graduate school at Cal State Long Beach. I currently reside in Downtown Long Beach.

My life has very much been about giving to my Long Beach community. Aside from running my own healing business for the past 7 years as a sole-proprietor, I have taught free yoga to low-income seniors, people in addiction recovery programs, homeless in shelters; and given away countless teaching hours to people who simply cannot afford it.  I am a founding member of The Friendship Neighborhood, a neighborhood non-profit organization in Downtown Long Beach serving a polarized urban residential area. In the past two years I have personally raised over $1500 for non-profit organizations that work with the homeless in Los Angeles, and advised on projects that raised nearly $40,000 for homeless youth shelters.

All my work in the yoga community and with the less-fortunate has prepared me to become the owner of FreeSpirit Yoga, for which I am now seeking your help.

The previous owners of FreeSpirit Yoga have done a fantastic job creating a heart-centered business. This yoga studio is already the perfect space and has the perfect foundation for what I intend to evolve into a broader community space for the up-and-coming neighborhood of Bixby Knolls, supporting a model for how a community can develop without losing its traditions, diversity, or soul.

The self-care and holistic wellness industry has for too long treated self-care as a means to an end. And, there is nothing wrong with that! It's important for people to feel good in their mind, body, and spirit. Having a safe space to recharge and connect to our inner worlds is paramount to our wellness as human beings. FreeSpirit Yoga is already this space, doing an amazing job of getting people feeling comfortable in their own skin and learning how to relax and recharge.

I will honor all current students and reach out to the wider demographics of the neighborhood, bringing people together to learn and practice yoga and many other holistic wellness techniques such as Reiki, journaling, meditation, and EFT.

It is now merely the time to take the next step in self-healing, which is to take those good feelings and that charged up inspiration out into the world, with the intention of giving. As the new owner of FreeSpirit Yoga my mission is to bring all of our peace, tranquility, self actualization, strength, and flexibility into the world, to give and demonstrate how strong community multiplies the benefits of our personal self-care practice. In fact, this is why the self-care movement has been so positive. Many people are prepared, for the first time in their lives, to give with the highest intention of serving all.

I intend to add a community outreach program to FreeSpirit Yoga where students will have the opportunity to give to their community by participating in enriching activities such as neighborhood trash clean-ups, food drives, furnishing homes for low-income families—the possibilities are endless. The ways in which the students at FreeSpirit Yoga will be able to give to their community through organized service will evolve, just as their self-care evolves. I want the world to see that Yogis do more than just sit up straight, breathe, and be serene. We can give our good energy to our community and our world! 

Contributors will not only have the opportunity to become members and even VIP members of FreeSpirit Yoga, which means they will get to come to our space and do yoga, they will also be contributing to the wellness of the entire neighborhood of Bixby Knolls as well as the City of Long Beach. Contributors will be investing in a new model of self-care that goes beyond the individual empowerment, and sees that energy turning back outwards. Contributors will be supporting a new emphasis on self-care with the intention of serving all, not just feeling good for the sake of feeling good, which, again, was a necessary step!

I was born and raised in Long Beach. I will always give my skills, service, and love to the city that has given so much to me. By keeping the studio in the hands of a dedicated community member, we ensure that the human beings in the space and the values of the space are honored and can be allowed to evolve. This continuity has become too rare in our culture. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $25,000 dollars to cover the cost of the studio itself as well as business licenses, escrow, taxes, and insurance, as well as a small savings to keep things moving smoothly through the transition of ownership, 

We are offering unique perks that you will receive along with your contributions, such as: VIP lifetime memberships to FreeSpirit Yoga and 2-year and 1-year VIP memberships. We are offering smaller class packages as well. 

Along with yoga other perks include: prints of Cassandra's own macro-flower photography, Reiki packages, EFT (tapping) packages, and Tarot Card readings. Fabian Bouthillette has offered one-on-one self-study counseling through his Intuitive Integrity Journaling program.

If I don't reach my entire goal, [EDIT: I've reached my goal and will buy the studio. Raising funds to buy the studio out-right and cover start-up costs, now.] I will invest in my current business, which is already expanding and growing in the ways I've described to you. Specifically, I already have collaborations with Michael Tardiff, a former army paratrooper in the 82nd airborne, and Fabian Bouthillette, a former navy officer and graduate of the United States Naval Academy. These two veterans are well established in southern California as peace activists and as healers. Both Michael and Fabian are active with Vets Journey Home, a community healing program among veterans, and with The Wilderness Institute in Ventura County. They share the same mission of expanding self-care into community healing, and support the creation of a space in Long Beach to do this. Collaboration with other “global thinkers, local actors” is already in motion. In my mind and heart (and theirs) not making the goal on this campaign is not an option. The power and benefit of continuing and building on FreeSpirit Yoga’s location, space, and reputation is too great to give up, especially with immediate opportunity for greater collaboration.

The main challenges I foresee after creating the funding is filling the big shoes that our amazing previous owners are leaving behind. I know that to be the owner of a space like FreeSpirit will challenge me to grow as a leader, a professional, a business woman, and as a spiritual guide. I am confident that I have a huge support system of loving people who will be there for me throughout this entire endeavor. As a woman who has dedicated her life to the practice of yoga and other healing arts, I have many tools, healers, and coaches at my disposal to support me as I grow into the owner and leader of the space. As of right now the studio is in a great place and I intend to keep it great, and increase its greatness in all ways possible.  

Lastly, if one wants to contribute to the campaign in other ways that do not involve money, you can always share and promote the campaign on your social media, let people know by telling them in person, and check in with Cassandra to see what else is needed. There are many ways to participate in this community building campaign and everyone is invited to be a part of it!

story:
The Canstruction Toronto event challenge is to build a structure made entirely of (canned) food, all of which is then donated to the Daily Bread Food Bank. All of the money you donate will go towards buying the food required to build our top-secret structure. We need to raise well over $4000 dollars to make our entry another huge success, and maximize the quality and quantity of the canned food which will be donated to the Daily Bread Food Bank.

Our past entries were huge successes - check out the award-winning "BeaCan of Hope" lighthouse pictured here, or the larger-than-life Loonie we built! Though both entries won accolades for design and structural stability, the real prize is having raised over $3,800 in food donations last year alone. We love this event because it the creates an opportunity for us to apply our aptitude for creativity, teamwork, and analytical problem solving skills to a fun event that benefits our community. We need your help to finance this year's entry. If you donate to our initiative, your contribution will help provide relief to an ever-increasing hungry population in Toronto. We truly appreciate any support that you can lend to our campaign, whether it be a monetary donation, or making some noise about this event and passing along the info to your own contacts.

story:
Summary

Sylvia House will be a bridge between drug/alcohol treatment and long-term sobriety, a transitional home where women can practice healthy habits and address underlying psychological barriers to recovery.

 

The Need

Addiction touches everyone. If you yourself have not struggled, you know or love someone who has. 

The US opiate epidemic has reached devastating proportions: over 60,000 overdose deaths in 2016, and 1 in 7 Americans facing a substance use disorder. Addiction is progressive, chronic, and relapsing. Among people who receive treatment, the relapse rate is 40-60%. 

But there is hope-- addiction is treatable.

Longer periods of support and treatment increase the likelihood of long-term sobriety. Sylvia House will build the safe environment and structured program women in recovery need and deserve. 

 

A Women-Only Space

Women are more powerfully impacted by the social and physiological consequences of addiction, and 80% of women who seek treatment are trauma survivors. Sylvia House will be a safe, secure, and nurturing home, and our program will address the unique challenges and needs of women in early recovery. 

 

Better Than Other Sober Homes 

The current marketplace consists primarily of three types of sober living homes:

  1. Non-profit shelter-like environments that are a needed alternative to homelessness and sex work
  2. For-profit houses that engage in patient brokering, exploitation of insurance benefits, and predatory advertising.  
  3. Luxury West Coast homes that focus on spa-like accommodations instead of life skill development and relapse prevention

Sylvia House will 1.) be more comfortable and safer than the nonprofits, 2.) operate with rigorous integrity and a Board of Advisors, and 3.) implement an action-based therapeutic program. 

 

What We Need

We need help with startup costs: acquisition of a rental home and purchasing household items. We also need help with all the typical expenses of opening a business: legal, accounting, etc. For a detailed breakdown of fund use, visit the Use of Crowdfunded Money page on our website. If we are fortunate enough to raise over and above 60k, here is what we plan to do.

 

Who We Are

We are an organized group of individuals with a passion for recovery and ambition to create the best sober living house in the country.

We are led by founder and CEO Mandy Learo. Mandy has been in the holistic wellness and yoga industry since 2008, when she earned her teacher training certification at a traditional ashram in Maharashtra, India. She has taught in studio, gym, institutional, university, and corporate environments throughout South Florida and upstate New York. She grew to specialize in the transformative utility of yoga practice, especially for changing destructive behaviors and habits. Mandy draws from her personal struggle with addiction, which consumed fifteen years of her life and resulted in multiple stays at detox and inpatient treatment facilities. She knows firsthand how difficult it is to transition out of treatment to an independent life in sobriety. Having found recovery herself, she is passionate about spreading the message of hope to addicted persons and their families. She moved to Greenville in August of 2016, along with her husband and baby son, with a dream and drive to open the best sober living home in the country.​

Our board of advisors currently includes Melissa Panasko, LISW-CP, a clinical psychologist who has been serving the Greenville community for eighteen years; Pete Richichi, owner and CEO of Wynit Distribution LLC; Jordin Jensen, ADP Business Development Coordinator and Recovery Activist;  and Keeley Mezzancello, Registered Dietitian and Certified Strength and Conditioning Specialist.

 

Your Privacy

Should you choose to donate anonymously, your name will not appear under "Backers," and we will not mention you in our social media or on our website.  

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    The best way you can help is by contributing to our cause, which will help us make our vision a reality. 

    PLEASE share this page on your social networks-- make some noise about recovery and spread the message of hope! Easy sharing links are located on the bottom right corner of the video. 

    If you feel moved to help with your expertise, labor, or time, email info@sylviahouse.com.  

     

    Links

    • Philosophy and Mission
    • How We're Different
    • FAQ
    • A Day at Sylvia House

     

    Pitch Video Credits

    Thanks to MJ Slide, Corey Wavle, and Justin Nix, who created our video. Special thanks to Gigi Nally, lead actress, and to Mie Potter, Savannah Newkirk, Amy Hood, Mary Hill, Shelbi Chase, Wendi Elliot, Lisa Pridemore, and Mandy Blankenship, who generously donated their time and positive energy. Also thanks to Doreen Brooks for hosting cast and crew and for making everyone feel welcome. Credit to Marianne Williamson for the ending quote: "Personal transformation... ultimately a personal one."

story:
Hello! We are students at the University of Tennessee, and we are working together to raise money for The Restoration House in order to help them continue building new housing for single-mothers and their families. Thank you so much for giving us your time!

 

The Restoration House is a nonprofit organization that walks alongside single-mothers, assisting them develop career readiness and to become more financially responsible. One of the biggest ways The Restoration House assists single-mothers is through providing transitional housing to the families in need.

 

Currently The Restoration House is working on ‘building Phase II’ of their own transitional housing complex, known as The Village. The Village currently has six living units as well as a community center. Plans for ‘building Phase II’ will add an additional eighteen living units, bringing the total up to twenty-four.

 

With this addition The Village would have the potential to help up to 160 single mothers and up to 320 children over the next ten years. Along with being able to help more families in need, the expansion would decrease the cost per family by 59%.

 

With 18 new families moving in to The Village there is an increasing need for more laptops in the community center for parents and children to use. The donations we receive will go toward purchasing more laptops, as well as a locking cabinet and a charging station for the laptops.

 

This is where we need your help. As of now The Restoration House is in the fundraising part of building Phase II and we need your help to reach our goal and help them to provide housing for a single-mother and their family in need.
story_txt:
Hello! We are students at the University of Tennessee, and we are working together to raise money for The Restoration House in order to help them continue building new housing for single-mothers and their families. Thank you so much for giving us your time!
 
The Restoration House is a nonprofit organization that walks alongside single-mothers, assisting them develop career readiness and to become more financially responsible. One of the biggest ways The Restoration House assists single-mothers is through providing transitional housing to the families in need.
 
Currently The Restoration House is working on ‘building Phase II’ of their own transitional housing complex, known as The Village. The Village currently has six living units as well as a community center. Plans for ‘building Phase II’ will add an additional eighteen living units, bringing the total up to twenty-four.
 
With this addition The Village would have the potential to help up to 160 single mothers and up to 320 children over the next ten years. Along with being able to help more families in need, the expansion would decrease the cost per family by 59%.
 
With 18 new families moving in to The Village there is an increasing need for more laptops in the community center for parents and children to use. The donations we receive will go toward purchasing more laptops, as well as a locking cabinet and a charging station for the laptops.
 
This is where we need your help. As of now The Restoration House is in the fundraising part of building Phase II and we need your help to reach our goal and help them to provide housing for a single-mother and their family in need.

story:
Hi! My name is Cameron Stack and I am the President and CEO of BasicallYours. Currently, I am a full-time student at Utah Valley University with an entrepreneurial mindset, aimed at making a difference in the world. I have two passions, one is traveling and exploring the wonderful earth, we live on and the other is to continually innovate while giving back to the world.  I would like to pursue my passion for innovation and would love to continually take strides in coming up with new ideas and creating products that would make a difference in our society and our world.

With that in mind, we are asking for your help in launching our first line of product for our all natural handcrafted skin and body company BasicallYours. 

Quality Ingredients. I'm working with crazy good vendors and using top notch product and still not overcharging, I think it's important to be economical and still not sacrifice on the quality of a good product. 

Referral Contest

Simply log in to Indiegogo if you have not already, or create an account by signing up here. Then, visit the campaign page on Indiegogo and look to the right of the main video for the "Link" button. ​

 

Our Products 

  • Deodorants
  • Lip balms 
  • More Products on the Way....

OUR DEODORANT

 

FOR MEN

Timber (Rosemary & Euc)

Summit (Wintergreen)

Lakeside ( Lavender & Mela)

True North (Spruce & Cypress)

 

FOR WOMAN

Lavender

Grapefruit

Bergamot

Cinnamon

 

All of our products are All Natural, Organic, GMO-Free, Fair Trade, Cruelty-Free, Handmade, Small Batches and are made from the purest ingredients in the world, so our products are good for your body and good for the world around you.

Because it actually works! 

﻿✓ Free of aluminum compounds, parabens, triclosan, and phthalates

✓ Effectively NEUTRALIZES odor and keeps you dry

✓ No Irritation! Perfect for even the most sensitive skin

✓ Fresh gender-neutral scent you'll love

                

Any business has start-up costs, but we want to do more than just have a basic brick and mortar shop that focuses on selling a product. Our desire is to educate, learn, and to be conscientious business owners, making products that are ethically sourced and created mindfully and patiently. This is not an inexpensive endeavor.  

Special thanks to our currently and past employees and interns, who's made this all possible!!!

- Domus Go, COO

- Casey Deeds - Head of Design - Stanford Class of 2017

- Brian Acevedo  - Social Media Director - LDSBC Social Media Program , 2017
- Sofia Munoz - Digital Media Intern - LDSBC Social Media Program, 2017

- Marcos Pickett - Social Media Intern - LDSBC Social Media Program, 2017

 

Previous Employees and Interns, at schools such as Berkeley, Baylor, Georgia Institute Tech, the University of Texas at Austin & Hult International Business School, Academy of Art San Francisco,

- Brice Espino - Head of Marketing - Hult International Business School - Masters of the Social Entrepreneurship, 2016

Ashley Osei-Kuffour, Kimberly Brown, Christian Shaheen, Megan King, Nagilee Lee

 

We are hoping to raise $25,000 to help pay for: 

  1. Ethical, organic, natural, ingredients including essential oils, natural base oils, soaps, and herbs.
  2. Sustainable packaging, including UV-blocking glass bottles, steel tins made in the USA, and biodegradable, recyclable, and reusable natural paper products.
  3. Production costs, including space and the tools, needed to make our products.
  4. Pay all of are hard-working Interns and team members.
  5. Legal licensing for wholesale and trademarking.
  6. Marketing, travel, and outreach to help build our brand.
  7. Website maintenance

The backbreaking manual labor of creating the product ourselves didn't bother us back, But now that we're growing and we're struggling to keep up with demand. We're confident we can sell 5,000 sticks of BasicallYours quickly, but we need funding to bridge the gap.

So, we decided to have our first round of fundraising via crowdfunding to prove just how passionate people get about a natural deodorant that actually works.

 

If we raise 5k

.

If we raise 25K

What you get out of it! 

With your support, we will be able to do many great things for our business and brand. You will be helping us work towards being an impactful presence in the skin care community, so we want to give you something back. 

Long Term Goals:

Education and empower consumers about their health

Launch other non-toxic products

Expand into retail and get athlete sponsorship

For our largest contributors, we will meet with you and  customize a complete aromatherapeutic experience for your body and your home.

What your Money helps do. Your contributions are so greatly appreciated and will go towards the labels, packaging, product, marketing efforts, and cost of other product development. Thank you so so much!!

If we do not reach our goal... 

While our goal is to raise the entire $25,000, we understand that this goal may not be reached. Regardless of the level of funds we raise, all proceeds will go towards the development and continued creation of ethically produced sustainable skin care in line with our mission. 

We are providing products that are very thoughtfully crafted in a way that preserves the integrity of the natural world and the conscientious consumer. It is our mission to make sure that everything we do is beneficial, not only to the people who use our products, but also those involved in the sourcing of the materials we use at every level. We live in a critical time, where caring about the environment is more important than ever. We are not about following a "green" trend, but rather about making a meaningful impact on our environment, both in our immediate surroundings and the larger world. We wish to promote a respectful and sustainable connectivity, recognizing that our actions do not just affect us, but all of those involved, from our customers to our purveyors to those who grow, forage, and make the ingredients we use. 

We have been very diligent about educating ourselves not only when is comes to aspects of this particular industry, but also practical principles of ethics, particularly when it comes to making holistic and natural products in this global economy. 

In the US, men and women use about 10 personal care products a day - things like body wash, shampoo, face lotion, deodorant, fragrance, sunscreen, etc.

On average, each of these products contain 10-15 different synthetic chemicals, exposing us a wide array synthetic chemicals every day, even before we’ve left the house.

While some of these chemicals are proven to be safe, many are known or suspected toxins and the vast majority (80%) have not been adequately tested for safe use on humans.

Research now shows that these toxins can penetrate the skin (or are otherwise ingested), potentially causing serious health issues over time (cancer, reproductive issues, neurological issues, etc).

How can this be? Turns out the US personal care industry is completely unregulated. Companies have free rein to choose from over 10,000 synthetic chemicals to formulate cheap - and often unhealthy - products.

In fact in the US there’s been no new regulation governing the use of chemicals for personal care since 1938! While the FDA has only banned 11 ingredients since then, the more cautious European Union has banned over 1,300. 

But there’s hope! With recent advances in ‘green chemistry’, today it’s possible to formulate all-natural products that perform as well as - or even better than - conventional products.

How BasicallYours Gives Back

for every $100 dollars we make will plant a tree in the forest of California and grow back what was killed in wildfires or such and help the planet one tree at a time.

What We Need & What You Get 

Not only do you get products you want at discounted prices, plus your able help us create more amazing products!

Where are your products made? BasicallYours LLC is based in Provo, UT and all of the products are proudly manufactured in the USA.

When will you ship out the products?

Shortly after the campaign ends, we’ll take a couple of weeks to process orders, fulfill, and send them out, approximately late December. Everyone is guaranteed to get their products! 

 

If you can't contribute, you can still help us by share this campagin with you're friends on Social Media!

story:
A Time For Growth

The Gardengate Horticulture Program is a space of healing and
recovery for people living with addictions and/or mental health
conditions, focusing on the development of self confidence, community
connectedness, independence and wellness. It is operated by Open
Door Group (ODG), a non-profit registered charity established in 1976
built on the fundamental belief that everyone has the ability to succeed.
Through activities in the garden, participants work towards personal
goals such as healthy eating and active living. We provide vocational
rehabilitation and pre-employment training.

The time has come for us to expand our Gardengate facility, which will
allow us to help even more British Columbians reach their full potential.
We’re excited to launch our first ever fundraising campaign, with the
goal of reaching $500,000 by May 2020.

We can make it happen with your support.

 

Our Vision

Since Gardengate’s inception in 2000, we have been operating out of a
700ft space, half of which is not heated, and unusable during the chilly
winter months. Over the years, our program has grown but our space
has not. Just as plants need repotting in order to thrive, we too need
room to grow!


Our proposed new facility, equipped with a fully functioning commercial
kitchen will allow us to serve more participants and expand the range of
skills we help nurture, such as cooking, carpentry, sales, marketing, and
machine maintenance.

Community Impact

Personal wellness and community wellness go hand in hand. Participants
leave Gardengate with improved self esteem, greater self sufficiency,
and vocational skills that prepare them to enter (or re-enter) the
workforce. Everything they work towards here at Gardengate has
a positive knock-on effect for the Kamloops community. From our
seasonal plant sales, to our commitment to sustainable food security,
to our partnerships with local schools and employers, Gardengate is
an essential part of the Kamloops community. With your help, our new
facility will create an even greater impact.

 

Get in touch with us:
Robert Wright, Gardengate Program Manager
robert.wright@opendoorgroup.org
250.554.9453
opendoorgroup.org/gardengate

story:
The current standard of skincare is extremely cheap ingredients so they have BigProfit, all-promises/no-reality, and no care whatsoever for the user. If they cared, there wouldn't be ingredients that cause cancer in ANY amount. If they cared, there wouldn't be cheap fillers. 

But I think that most consumers think the skincare companies do care. These companies say, "LOOK at the market trends! No one CARES that we are putting the fillers and cancer-causing, hormone-disruptors in their soap because THEY KEEP BUYING IT!" So the cycle keeps on keeping on. 

I want to live in a place where caring about human beings is not only "nice", it is absolutely necessary to be able to continue in business. So I'm going to make that place I want to live in.

The best skincare in the world is made with the individual in mind. The best skincare in the world comes from listening to needs and concerns. The best skincare in the world is made from the cleanest, most natural, least modified ingredients available. 

The best skincare in the world looks at your skin with reverence for being the largest organ in the body and also the largest receiver of pollutants and now the most likely to get cancer at some point in your life. If I am going to charge myself with taking care of that organ for thousands of people, then I am going to get serious about HOW to take care of it right.

In a world of pollution, changing climates, political unrest, heartbreaking realizations, corporate rule, government ass-hattery, and generally depressing news daily- how can I think about skincare? 

I ask myself this daily. The answer simply has to be that I am trying to make the best skincare in the world. That doesn't JUST mean the best products in the world. It's a whole way of going about it, a way of thinking and believing and acting. 

I am not a skincare guru, Nature is. 

As the years go by, I come to deeper understandings of what Nature presents us and how to properly utilize it in a modern way. 

I want to be the best because I think that truly caring about people is what "the best" is. For this type of business model to be able to rise to the top in a world where Money and Profits rule would be a game-changer. I want people to EXPECT to speak with someone who knows some science around skincare when they make a purchase. I want people to expect to be told the TRUTH about what they are buying. I want people to EXPECT that the ingredients are from not only proven, but natural sources. I want people to start seeing skincare as a part of their nutrition intake.

story:
Hi. My name is Emile Janse.

I am a musician and sound healer. I play instruments for sound and healing primarily in the bay area and at festivals.

I have been playing these instruments which include singing bowls, native flutes, didgeridoos, and much more for 8 years ever since I chose this musical direction after playing piano and guitar most of my life before that. Picking up flutes dramatically changed my direction. It felt so right to play them and it had such a positive effect on my life.

I was recently approached by a representative from Meinl to promote their Sonic Energy line of instruments. This includes singing bowls, tuning forks, GONGS, didgeridoos, chimes, even handpans.

The instruments are of a very high quality and I'd like to invest in 12 or more of their instruments and bring them to more spaces including hospitals - which I've been at regularly for the last 3 months playing flute, didgeridoo, and sharing singing bowls + overtone singing. It's been really potent and I've gotten to do this both for individuals as well as for groups in two hospitals - Kaiser and Alta Bates - both in Oakland.

In this period I've seen the huge benefit and excitement that patients and staff feel when I play there. The patients often light up like they haven't ever before. It often makes the day for them and their family

So, I'm asking for $10,000 to buy gongs and singing bowls. The gongs are $500-3,000 each depending on the quality and the singing bowls are $50-500 each. A set of tuning forks is about $500. With these instruments I will be able to bring sound healing into hospitals in an even more potent way. As part of this campaign I am providing the instruments for sale as well.

Supporting this campaign helps me bring more sound healing into hospitals, and helps me get started on a business selling sound healing instruments. I intend to get a gong (of which Meinl produces some of the finest gongs in the world), a set of tuning forks and Tibetan singing bowls, a handpan, and didgeridoos for students to purchase and take lessons on.

I'm offering instrument packages to contributors along with lessons - and also the best deals on the Meinl gongs and handpans. If you would like to contribute but are not looking for an instrument or a lesson that is great as well. The funds are going toward getting more instruments into hospitals and my making an initial investment in these instruments for sharing on a broader and more impactful scale with my community and the world.

story:
CAMPAIGN UPDATE: CAMPAIGN IS GAINING MEDIA TRACTION WITH VIDEO COVERAGE ON KRON4 NEWS SAN FRANCISCO

Warren & Seth Scott, founders of Hi-Drops and the brains behind this campaign were named KRON4 Heroes this week by KRON 4 San Francisco. WATCH THE NEWS STORY HERE:

https://www.kron4.com/features/kron4-heroes/eye...

Patch outlets are also reporting  in support to the initiative: https://patch.com/california/pacifica/peninsula...

AND, front-line workers in Alameda county have specifically requested that this campaign be extended outside of San Mateo County so that they could receive the much needed support that eye drops would provide as part of their PPE kit -- so, we listened and NOW eye drops will be donated not only in San Mateo County, but throughout Alameda county and other Bay areas!

Campaign Fundamentals

Our made in the U.S.A. product was named & branded  with the intention of being specifically distributed at legal marijuana dispensaries; it does not contain THC or CBD. It's a straight up FDA compliant eye drop comparable to major drug store brands -- and it's designed to rejuvenate dry, tired, red-eyes.

Our product can be something of value to front line workers who are at increased risk for COVID-19. While eye drops aren't on the list of PPE (personal protective equipment), drops can help reduce the impulse of eye touching that is part of how the virus is spread.  Because of that, as co-founders of Hi-Drops, Inc, we are announcing a program to donate our entire eye drop inventory to front line workers in San Mateo County, CA.   

We have found it difficult to donate our entire inventory of  24,000 units of eye drops.  Like so many start-ups right now we are struggling from Covid-19’s economic impact, but in our case we have a product that can help the front line. We want to be part of fighting the pandemic, but we simply can’t afford to donate our product outright. We need to find partners and individuals to help subsidize the large-scale donation we want to make. We have turned to Indiegogo to launch this campaign in order to find donors who are willing to support the effort.

One partner already helping us is Old Princeton Landing restaurant in Half Moon Bay, CA.  Owners, Peter and Brian Overfelt, purchased Hi-Drops to donate to local firefighters and posted about it on social media. Old Princeton Landing’s Instagram post immediately gained traction, that gave us hope that both the local and national community would come forward to make Hi-Drops’ donation goal possible.

All 24,000 units of Hi-Drops eye drops will be distributed to fire stations and first responders in San Mateo and now Alameda County as well due to popular demand and direct requests from from-line workers.

So, who are we?  We are Warren Scott and Seth Scott - twin brothers who came up with the idea for Hi-Drops all the way back in 2016. We were in the process of  a successful product launch in 2020 when Covid hit. We had just visited 13 states and place our product with 60 retailers....now, our entire focus is on getting our inventory out to front line workers.  If you'd like to know a bit more about us, and read some interesting links on how eye drops can make a difference in the fight against Covid, please go to https://www.hi-drops-donate2frontline.com

WATCH THE NEWS STORY HERE:https://www.kron4.com/features/kron4-heroes/eye...Patch outlets are also reporting  in support to the initiative: https://patch.com/california/pacifica/peninsula...AND, front-line workers in Alameda county have specifically requested that this campaign be extended outside of San Mateo County so that they could receive the much needed support that eye drops would provide as part of their PPE kit -- so, we listened and NOW eye drops will be donated not only in San Mateo County, but throughout Alameda county and other Bay areas!Campaign FundamentalsOur made in the U.S.A. product was named & branded  with the intention of being specifically distributed at legal marijuana dispensaries; it does not contain THC or CBD. story:
The Vision

Thich Nhat Hanh has always encouraged us to explore new ways to create compassionate, engaged and healthy communities, and this is one way we're doing that. 

Plum Village monks and nuns have years of experience creating refreshing and healing environments of mindfulness practice, but this exciting new venture is the first time, inspired by Thich Nhat Hanh, that we'll be creating such an oasis right in the heart of a city centre. 

With your help, we'll be able to offer a restful, inclusive space where anyone who stops by can experience the peace of mindfulness, as well as joy, true presence and community. We hope to create a space where like-minded people can meet and inspire one another.

The People

The monks and nuns are Dharma Teachers trained directly by Thich Nhat Hanh, and they will be sharing his teachings on mindfulness, engaged Buddhism, global ethics, and his compassionate, insightful responses to the challenging situations of our times.

The London Mindfulness Hub is a collaborative venture between Plum Village monks and nuns, the Wake Up London community of young mindfulness practitioners, and the Heart of London all-ages sangha, with support from the UK Community of Interbeing (a registered charity).

Together, our exciting long-term vision is to create a sustainable model for urban mindfulness practice hubs which can be run collaboratively on a non-profit basis by residential practitioners. 

Creating conditions 

With your help, we'll be able to cover the overheads of renting the space at Newspeak House at the top of Brick Lane (133 Bethnal Green Road), from the 5th to the 13th September. We'll also be able to cover the costs of food & lodging for the monastics.

We'll also be asking for donations from everyone who visits the hub, but your kind support now will enable us to keep drop-in visits and meditations open and free to all.

Thank you for joining us

We're deeply grateful for your support for this exciting project, and we hope you'll be able to come by the hub to visit us and join some of our mindfulness sessions.

If possible, please donate via debit card rather than credit card, to help us avoid the 3% credit card fee.

And if you have any ideas or suggestions, if you'd like to get more involved in helping make this project a success, please get in touch. If you have a few hours to spare and would like to volunteer at the hub, we'd also love to hear from you.

Please drop the Mindfulness Hub team an email at: hello@mindfulnesshublondon.org

story:
HEY FRIENDS OF SOLACE!
 

Erin (CEO) here, asking for your help. We have been hard at work transforming the future home of Solace Health and Wellness into a comfortable place that will help our clients feel safe and cared for. But we need your help with the last little bit of renovation.

We would love to replace the dingy carpet and dirty baseboard with shiny new flooring. This campaign will help us cover that final cost, and allow us to open, and finally, bring our signature programs to the folks in Toledo. 

Your donation will be sincerely appreciated and commemorated as the inaugural class of "Frinds of Solace".

This campaign will help us cover that final cost, and allow us to open, and finally, bring our signature programs to the folks in Toledo. Your donation will be sincerely appreciated and commemorated as the inaugural class of "Frinds of Solace".

story:
Who we are

Feet on the Ground was co-founded by Samara Andrade & Emily Pantalone in 2016. We support individuals and communities affected by trauma in building resilience from within through the breath and movement of yoga. We train yoga instructors on the tools and practice of working with trauma-affected individuals, through Yoga Teacher Training (YTT) programs as well as a signature 3-day intensive course on Trauma-Informed Yoga (TIY).

We also teach TIY classes to populations exposed to trauma, work with crisis affected communities - including veterans, domestic violence survivors, public-school children and aid workers - as well as support wellness programs for organizations working in high-stress and trauma-exposed professions.

Co-founders Samara Andrade and Emily Pantalone share a passion for working with trauma-affected people. Bringing together their experience in international aid, development and security, trauma-informed yoga, and self-regulation practices, they founded Feet on the Ground in 2016  Read more about FotG here.

What is the “Feet on the Ground Scholarship Fund?”

FotG regular operations are fully funded by Samara and Emily, who dedicate their personal time and resources to make the organization successful. All of the proceeds from training and workshops are used to cover costs of the organization.  

In an effort to further expand the organization’s reach and impact, in 2017 FotG launched both a Mentorship Program and a Scholarship Fund. The Mentorship Program will bridge the gap for graduates of our 3-day intensive who want to refine their skills and bring TIY classes to their community. The Scholarship Fund will cover the costs of bringing additional training and classes to individuals affected by trauma.

Through this Scholarship fund we are looking to raise $2,000, with a maximum of 9% going to pay Indiegogo’s platform and processing fees, which will provide seed funding to allow FotG to expand outreach into the community in the following ways:

  • Full or partial scholarships for three students with financial need and a passion to bring TIY practices to their community. These scholarships will cover costs for students to attend the next TIY 3-day intensive training, April 7-9th 2017 at Hosh Yoga in Brooklyn and scholars will receive continued support through our Mentorship program to start teaching TIY classes.
  • Trauma Informed Yoga classes for Female Refugees, 3-month pilot program beginning in NYC in Summer 2017. FotG will offer free trauma-informed, culturally appropriate movement classes for refugee women through two 6-week series. FotG co-founders will combine their experience in international aid and development as well as yoga and self-regulation practices to support refugees’ access to complementary psychosocial transition programs. From this pilot, FotG hopes to develop a model which can be expanded and become self-sustaining.
  • Free and open to the public Trauma Informed Yoga classes, 3-month pilot. Currently in New York City there is minimal access for the public to TIY and yet the need is high; this program will offer free classes for the public once per week for 12 weeks, after which they will become self-sustaining through our Mentorship Program. Funds go towards covering the costs of classes, supplies, and paying the teachers.

What happens if we don’t reach our goal?

If we don’t reach our goal, we will prioritize the launch of our free TIY yoga classes to the public and female refugees, and reduce our scholarship offering to one. 

 

What is Trauma Informed Yoga?

Traumatic experiences, large or small, live in the body as well as the mind. Our physical body - our muscles and connective tissue - holds onto traumatic experiences, which is why treating trauma is complex. When someone has experienced trauma, the way their brain processes information and stimuli is different. For example, the part of the brain responsible for time-keeping can be affected, so ordinary stimuli such as a car honking reminds the brain of a past trauma, and may be interpreted subconsciously as a trauma happening right now.

This is also why trauma-informed yoga (TIY) approaches can be an integral complement to “traditional” therapeutic practices like talk therapy. TIY classes are designed to create an enabling environment where students can explore movement, breathing, and mindfulness while cultivating interoception - awareness of the state of their physical body - in order to make choices based on these physiological experiences.

Everything in a trauma-informed yoga class is optional and empowers students to make the decisions that are best for them in this moment.  These practices support self-regulation and empower students to have a greater sense of ownership over their life experiences.  The goal of TIY classes is to build resiliency and cultivate through practice a feeling of being in control of one’s own body.  

Here is what a student of TI yoga classes had to say:  “Last weekend I took my niece to Times Square, and I usually hate going there because the lights and sounds are triggers for me, but I used the breathing practices we do in class and I was able to not only get through it but to actually enjoy the time with my niece, which meant so much to me” - Female Veteran

Here is what a former student had to say about TI yoga training: “Thank you (for the training)!  So much useful, important, insightful information. Brilliant presentation!”

story:
Who is The Tree Yoga Cooperative?

Rita, Jonié (aka J.Cole), Jana, and Jenni launched The Tree Yoga Cooperative in August of 2020 after years of teaching yoga and meditation throughout South Los Angeles. Their community leadership at The Tree South LA (nonprofit organization) united them to reimagine the ways we connect, heal, build and celebrate ourselves and community. 

The Tree Yoga Cooperative is a BIPOC worker-owned cooperative in South Central Los Angeles, which is a values-driven business that puts worker and community benefit at the core of its purpose. Worker cooperatives are a democratic alternative to inequality, gentrification, and the gig economy and provide a pathway to a better future of work.

What are we raising funds for?

All campaign funds will go towards our worker-owned community wellness hub that we hope to launch by Fall of 2021. 

We are eager to re-open in a new community space for our growing yoga school, weekly classes, workshops, and for additional wellness services. It is important that our South Central Los Angeles community has access to wellness practices that support individual and community health. We’ve also had the opportunity to expand virtually over the past year and intend for our new space to have the capacity to continue to produce digital content. 

What is the impact of your donation?

Your donation will go directly to securing a new facility that will serve as our wellness hub. We are committed to educating and empowering individuals, communities, and professionals to improve the health disparities and become health equity advocates. 

This space will also serve as the new home for our transformative 200hr Yoga Teacher Training (YTT) program. That means that your donation will allow community members (BIPOC, LGBTQ, differently-abled, low-income individuals) to deepen their own yoga practice, evolve their leadership in community health, and expand their opportunities as entrepreneurs in wellness. The bedrock of this training is mindfulness, social justice, and public health. We seek to diversify yoga by training yogis from underrepresented groups to become yoga instructors as this is one of our approaches to democratize wellness and remove barriers to healthy living. We are the only Black-led 200hr YTT emphasizing yoga as a tool for social justice, grassroots community building and addressing racial health inequities in our community.

It is important that People of Color know they have a safe space with us to enjoy this practice and to teach, work, and offer their services. 

Our Fundraising Goal to Re-Open

We need $143,000 to cover the initial expenses for our first year back in a physical location since we closed our doors due to COVID. If we meet our goal we would consider using it as a down payment for purchasing a building. We have outlined our expenses to include commercial lease rent, renovations, operational expenses (utilities, subscriptions, COVID protocols, etc). and legal fees. Any additional funds from our initial goal will go towards Yoga Teacher Training scholarships and supporting operational expenses. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share with friends, family, and through your networks. If you happen to have any media contacts, let us know. We are excited to share about our unique story and the impact it has had on BIPOC wellness practitioners throughout South Los Angeles and worldwide!! Please utilize the indiegogo share tools to help spread the word about re-opening our BIPOC worker-owned wellness hub.
