story:
NOW LIVE - from Nov 13 - Nov 29.

Hey I’m Anna! I'm the founder of myMomentum. I started this passion project with the goal to start a movement: to make wellness simple, fun. A seed of thought has taken a life of it’s own. It's been an amazing journey ever since we launched our app in February this year. We couldn't have done this without you.

 

 

What's myMomentum?

myMomentum is a community app that helps you integrate healthy choices into daily life and motivates you through rewards. Through our app and events, we create a real community ecosystem where wellness is simple and fun. Find our free app on iOS and Android: search "myMomentum: wellness made easy".

Get inspired and motivated to live well

Complete bite-sized challenges that get you thinking about your wellness and earn points. Our challenges cover all areas of wellness from movement and healthy eating to mindfulness and self-care.

Discover all things healthy and wellness events

Use your points to explore rewards from wellness businesses like fitness studios, cafes, snacks, drinks and more. All our partners are local! Stay in the know about the best events in the city. We list free, by donations & paid events that are happening in Vancouver, including our own monthly community events where we bring people together for a big sweat, snacks & swag.

OUR GOAL: $35,000

To the community: we need your help to raise $35,000 to invest resources into our tech + grow our presence within Vancouver and beyond. 

Giving back to community

Community is the heart and soul of what we do. We’ll be giving part of what's raised in our campaign to Face of Today, a local charity who empowers youth's wellbeing.⁣⁣ All of our donations will provide fitness programs to at-risk youth. 

 

THE AWESOME PERKS

We have tons of amazing stuff for each donation level. Plus for the first 24 HOURS ONLY (starting from Wednesday Nov 13 at noon until Thursday Nov 14 at noon, we're giving away BONUS goodies for donations for $50 or more! 

 

  • Swag bag ($15 value): filled with surprise goodies - a combo of snacks, drinks and promo from amazing local wellness partners including Conscious Cookies, Herbaland, Himalayan Hydration, Hippie Snacks, Woash, Bite Snacks, Naked Coconuts, Fresh Prep, Feed Me Fit, The Good Stuff, Mat Collective + more.

 

  • Swag bag ($15 value) PLUS...
  • Two $5 Larry's Market gift cards ($10 value): a Vegetarian grocery store and cafe in North Vancouver Shipyards. 
  • One studio class ($25 value): choose from Spin Society, Formation, Barre Belle, Pop Queen Cardio, Salted, MVMT Academy or Uphoria Yoga.

Total value: $50 

 

  • Swag bag ($15 value)
  • One $5 Larry's Market gift card
  • One studio class ($25 value) PLUS...
  • $25 Fresh Prep gift card
  • Skullcandy earbuds ($30 value)
  • 15% ($15) of your donation goes to Face of Today: support us while supporting a great local charity that empowers youth's wellbeing

Total value: $115

 

  • Swag bag ($15 value) PLUS...
  • 1 bag of Nume ($15 value): raw, sprouted, sugar free cereal snacks that are packed with nutrients
  • 20% ($50) of your donation goes to Face of Today and get a tax receipt for $50
  • Community dinner ($50 value): an intimate, family-style dinner at Larry's Market with our team and great company
  • $50 Body Energy Club gift card
  • 1 week unlimited studio pass ($75 value)

Total value: $255 

 

  • Swag bag ($15 value) PLUS...
  • 2 bags of Nume ($30 value)
  • 25% ($125) of your donation goes to Face of Today and get a tax receipt for $125
  • Community dinner PLUS one guest ($100 value)
  • Private group studio class at The Sweat Lab ($250 value)

Total value: $520

 

  • Swag bag ($15 value)
  • Community dinner + one guest ($100 value)
  • Private group studio class at The Sweat Lab ($250 value) PLUS...
  • 3 bags of Nume ($45 value)
  • Cooking class for 2 people ($140 value)
  • 1 consult + personal training session ($150 value)
  • 30% ($300) of your donation goes to Face of Today and get a tax receipt for $300

Total value: $1000

Thank you!

Thank you SO much for your support. Every donation goes a long way! 

Questions?

Please email Celine at celine@itsmymomentum.com.
story_txt:
NOW LIVE - from Nov 13 - Nov 29.Hey I’m Anna! I'm the founder of myMomentum. I started this passion project with the goal to start a movement: to make wellness simple, fun. A seed of thought has taken a life of it’s own. It's been an amazing journey ever since we launched our app in February this year. We couldn't have done this without you.  What's myMomentum?myMomentum is a community app that helps you integrate healthy choices into daily life and motivates you through rewards. Through our app and events, we create a real community ecosystem where wellness is simple and fun. Find our free app on iOS and Android: search "myMomentum: wellness made easy".Get inspired and motivated to live wellComplete bite-sized challenges that get you thinking about your wellness and earn points. Our challenges cover all areas of wellness from movement and healthy eating to mindfulness and self-care.Discover all things healthy and wellness eventsUse your points to explore rewards from wellness businesses like fitness studios, cafes, snacks, drinks and more. All our partners are local! Stay in the know about the best events in the city. We list free, by donations & paid events that are happening in Vancouver, including our own monthly community events where we bring people together for a big sweat, snacks & swag.OUR GOAL: $35,000To the community: we need your help to raise $35,000 to invest resources into our tech + grow our presence within Vancouver and beyond. Giving back to communityCommunity is the heart and soul of what we do. We’ll be giving part of what's raised in our campaign to Face of Today, a local charity who empowers youth's wellbeing.⁣⁣ All of our donations will provide fitness programs to at-risk youth.  THE AWESOME PERKSWe have tons of amazing stuff for each donation level. Plus for the first 24 HOURS ONLY (starting from Wednesday Nov 13 at noon until Thursday Nov 14 at noon, we're giving away BONUS goodies for donations for $50 or more!  
Swag bag ($15 value): filled with surprise goodies - a combo of snacks, drinks and promo from amazing local wellness partners including Conscious Cookies, Herbaland, Himalayan Hydration, Hippie Snacks, Woash, Bite Snacks, Naked Coconuts, Fresh Prep, Feed Me Fit, The Good Stuff, Mat Collective + more. 
Swag bag ($15 value) PLUS...

Two $5 Larry's Market gift cards ($10 value): a Vegetarian grocery store and cafe in North Vancouver Shipyards. 

One studio class ($25 value): choose from Spin Society, Formation, Barre Belle, Pop Queen Cardio, Salted, MVMT Academy or Uphoria Yoga.
Total value: $50  
Swag bag ($15 value)
One $5 Larry's Market gift card
One studio class ($25 value) PLUS...
$25 Fresh Prep gift card

Skullcandy earbuds ($30 value)

15% ($15) of your donation goes to Face of Today: support us while supporting a great local charity that empowers youth's wellbeing
Total value: $115 
Swag bag ($15 value) PLUS...

1 bag of Nume ($15 value): raw, sprouted, sugar free cereal snacks that are packed with nutrients

20% ($50) of your donation goes to Face of Today and get a tax receipt for $50

Community dinner ($50 value): an intimate, family-style dinner at Larry's Market with our team and great company
$50 Body Energy Club gift card

Community dinner + one guest ($100 value)

story:
INTRODUCTION

There are an estimated 567,715 people in the United States experiencing homelessness on a given night, according to the most recent national point-in-time estimate (January 2019). This represents a rate of approximately 17 people experiencing homelessness per every 10,000 people in the general population.

While this number had been steadily decreasing since 2007, in the last two years it has started to increase, the pandemic has pushed more families under the poverty line many of which have become homeless in the last couple of months.

As more and more people are living and sleeping on the streets. All of them, are struggling with hygiene. there are fewer than 20 shower stalls and toilets for thousands of homeless individuals, in any given city or town, at some places people must wait their turn for weeks or even months to just get a shower.

At Organization Of Hope, we believe that with hygiene comes dignity and with dignity and opportunity.

Every night, there are 3,500 homeless men, women and children in Baltimore City and 11,623 homeless people within the greater Washington DC region. Due to the lack of access to existing shelters.

The Organization of Hope will provide Mobile Hygiene services to the homeless to increase their access.

There are only 13 emergency shelters in Baltimore City and only 7 places in the Washington DC area.

Both venues face this challenge daily, with the number of people to be served and limited capacities to accommodate them The Organization of Hope team will be coming out to deliver the hygiene service.

For the homeless community to shower outside of a shelter. Living and maintaining hygiene, laundry, and sanitation needs due to a lack of access presents a severe challenge and reduces the opportunity to embrace an excellent quality of life.

WHAT WE HAVE DONE SO FAR

 
 
 

WHAT WE AIM TO ACHIEVE

We are looking to expand our fleet of Hope on Wheels with more Trucks on the road we can provide service to many more in need and help save dignity one sole at a time.

Our Imitative focuses on the following:

  1. To effectively embrace Empathy by providing an experience for the needy that revitalized and re-humanised.
  2. Build and sustain community partners under one slogan “Be Part of Solution for Homelessness”.
  3. The Mobile Hygiene Unit will be dispatched to the designated site location and will serve 50-60 people per day.
  4. Each Unit will be equipped with 2 Washers, 2 Dryers, a Sink and appropriate disposal receptacles.

To provide showers, toilets, and laundry services in a mobile environment to deliver hygiene and rekindle dignity for our homeless citizens.

We are calling the Mobile Hygiene station “ Hope on Wheels”

WHAT WE NEED

We are looking to raise $80,000 to launch 1 Mobile hygiene station which will serve 50 -60 people per day and moved across the greater Washington area for maximum coverage.

WHAT WILL WE DO WITH THESE FUNDS?

The funding will enable us to do the following tasks

  • Acquiring Bus/Trailor for the mobile locations
  • Hiring Designer to retrofit Sanitation station Inside the Bus/Trailor.- new COVID 19 requirement
  • Procuring PPE, COVID 19 required items for Mobile locations.
  • Hiring Hope on Wheels staff to support FREE service.
  • Getting required permits and permissions from the City Administration
  • Purchasing Inventory/toiletries
  • Running awareness campaigns and volunteer drive.

About Me

My Name is Patrecia Williams, Ph.D., PMP, CBM, QMS, CNE, CNC, RCP, PRS, RPS, CCTP, CSAM, CTMH

pronounced: Pa-tree-see-ya/ (Pronouns- she/her/hers)

Founder/Executive Director

Bridging Hope, Inc 501(c)(3) dba Organization of Hope, Inc./Minority Veteran-Women Lead Business

218 East Lexington St, Ste 600, Baltimore, MD 21202

1629 K. Street NW, Suite 300, Washington, DC 20006

I have had extensive experience working for the needy and driving the message of hope through my organization, with support from concerned citizens and community partners I aim to help more people in need across the country.

In 2009, I followed my vision and dream to develop a community service organization dedicated to enriching and improving communities throughout the Greater Washington/Baltimore Metropolitan Area and founded the organization of Hope.

As the Founder and Managing Director, I am responsible for the management of the organization’s board relations, corporate affairs, strategic planning, and organizational governance/ culture efforts. The Organization of Hope currently provides a minimum of 12 unique treatment services assisted by a valued diverse team of customer service-oriented professionals, corporate sponsors, community partners, and volunteers.

About Organization of Hope

OOH/Bridging Hope which is a 501(c)(3) was founded in 2009

to enrich lives and improving communities.

Our strategy is practical as well as dynamic. We believe in a hands-on approach, and offer highly crafted, evidence-based programs and services to individuals (and animals) in need.

OOH's goal is to re-build communities by making them stronger and more vibrant, and to instil hope in all we serve!

 

Why Support Us?

This pilot program’s best practices will serve as an essential roadmap to other areas including Washington DC. It is a reasonable fact that there are currently a half million Americans who are without the safety and comfort of a permanent place to call home.

At any given time, life’s interruptions and disruptions could occur. Homelessness does not discriminate, which is precisely the primary reason why we should search our hearts, consolidate our resources, and reach out with compassion to the thousands who need our help.

Together, we can make a positive, measurable impact that will sustain their hope and allow the homeless to begin experiencing the gift of life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness.

 

Risks And Challenges

Since the Idea is to make sanitation accessible to all those who need it, the biggest challenge will be to meet the demand with one truck, at the same time meeting the required funding goal to make sure we are able to pull this off, one of the risks that could arise after setting up the unit could be the upkeep cost which may force us to halt our services. Nonetheless, we are committed to make this a reality and reaching out to all the community partners/supporters and our donors for support in this initiative.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign in your social circile.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share our campaign with anyone who think might be able to contribute!

story:
Our hypothesis (or idea) is that with pelvic floor physical therapy, women will experience significantly less trauma during childbirth.  This includes less perineal tearing (aka tearing to their lady parts), less time spent pushing, and less Cesarean section risk.  We also think that they will experience a better recovery with less pain and improved function after delivery.

 

At Revitalize Physical Therapy we specialize in pregnancy and postpartum pelvic floor issues. After years of treating women during pregnancy, we started to notice a trend with our patients.  All of them had really good outcomes during delivery with minimal tearing, fast pushing phases and no C-sections. This was very different from what was considered “normal” and in the research.  When we started looking to the research for answers to our great patient outcomes, we couldn’t find a single research study that looked at the effects of pelvic floor physical therapy. With this data, it could potentially change our standard of care for the pregnant patient and lead to less birth complications and their long-term implications!

After working with pregnant women for over 4 years, we have seen really great results.  They have experienced less trauma with perineal tearing, shorter pushing phases during delivery, less C-sections and faster recoveries with less pain.  In fact, most women tell us that it was their "easiest" delivery to date!

Don't take it from us! Here are some thoughts from some of our recent patients:

Most women are told to do kegels during pregnancy in order to "strengthen the pelvic floor for childbirth."  However, the pelvic floor muscles must stretch 2.5 times their normal length in order to allow for the delivery of baby vaginally through the levator hiatus.  It is also very common during pregnancy, in our experience, that the pelvic floor muscles become too overactive (aka too tight) due to the extra demands on those muscles during this time.  If the pelvic floor muscles become overactive, these muscles aren't as pliable as normal and can’t stretch adequately in order to allow for delivery.  This can hinder the delivery process as well as lead to higher likelihood of tearing and longer amount of time spent pushing. Tearing and other birth trauma can lead to a longer and more challenging recovery from childbirth with further pelvic floor issues. Our goal is to release these commonly tight areas and have data to support what we have seen in our patients.

Note: The levator hiatus is the opening within the pelvic floor muscles that allows for the passage of the baby (see photo).

In order to eliminate these "overactive" pelvic floor muscles, we perform myofascial release as part of pelvic floor physical therapy.  Our study design includes participants starting in their third trimester in order to receive an adequate number of treatment sessions before delivery.  All of our participants will receive standardized treatment so that we can evaluate the results afterwards.  Then we will measure differences in the C-section rate, degree of tearing, length of pushing, and pain and functional limitations in the postpartum period. 

Below is a timeline of the study for our participants:

Pelvic floor physical therapy often involves a comprehensive approach to treating the whole body using manual release techniques, joint mobilizations, strengthening and retraining exercises, and breathing training.  For this research study, we will be focused primarily on manual release techniques called myofascial release, in order to downtrain (aka relax) the deep pelvic floor muscles.  We will also be including training in breathing, pelvic floor stretching, and pelvic floor relaxation.

Internal pelvic floor assessment and treatment is very gentle and usually pain-free, in fact it’s less intrusive than intercourse which is why it’s safe to have this treatment during pregnancy.  This is also MUCH different than "perineal massage" because it is targeting the deeper pelvic floor muscles rather than the superficial muscles surrounding the vaginal opening. 

 

The following benefits are what we have experienced with our clients and what we are hypothesizing to be significant:

 

The results from this research could have long term implications for improving the standard of care for the pregnant woman.  If our treatment does lead to less trauma for the mom, it should be included as part of prenatal care and education.  It also can assist in less birth complications.  With C-sections and longer pushing phases, there are more risks for medical complications for mom and baby, as well as infection risk with C-sections and perineal tearing.  We also hope that this helps aid in a woman's postpartum recovery since she will have less physical and potentially emotional and psychological limitations to deal with if she is not in pain or healing from a potential surgical intervention.

 

As mentioned above, we have been performing these interventions for over 4 years on women and noticing results.  Approximately 3 years ago, we started to develop a research study design in order to collect data for this treatment.  In March 2019, we partnered with University of Wisconsin - Milwaukee for more assistance on this in order to ensure a quality research study.  The proposal for this was submitted to the International Review Board (IRB) in October 2019 and is currently under review.  Once we receive approval from the IRB, we plan to begin collecting data and providing this treatment to pregnant women in our local area.  Currently, the research study will need to include a minimum of 100 participants so we are looking to perform a pilot study with the first 50 with money raised during this campaign.  The remaining 50 will then need to be tested and funding secured.  Our plan is to complete data collection within the following 2 years.

We are crowdfunding and asking for your donation as a way to financially provide these services.  The treatment in this research study is performed one-on-one for an hour (each session) and is very personal and intimate.  Because of this, we have overhead costs to pay staff in order to provide this treatment.  Since we are a small, private practice, we do not have access to funds or grants that a large healthcare organization would.  It is also a substantial time commitment  that will greatly impact the revenue of our clinic and ability to treat other clients that are not part of this study. It is important to us to keep the cost as low as possible for the participant in order to be able to provide this treatment to a diverse demographic of women.

Our goal amount is to be able to fully fund the first 50 participants of our study after discounting our services to only cover overhead costs (no profit).  Any amount raised will help offset the cost for our participants so our flexible goal is to be able to provide some additional funding for our participants if our goal is not met.

 

 

 

Stretch Goal #1: $25, 000

This stretch goal will allow us to fully fund the first 50 participants for the research study so there is no cost to them to participate.  This will also allow for a greater diversity within the demographics of our participants since there will be no financial barrier to them.

Stretch Goal #2: $50,000

Reaching stretch goal #2 would allow us to fully fund all 100 participants for the research study and complete the data collection much faster since there are less barriers to getting participants. 

Any excess funds raised above our initial goal will be divided up among our participants to offset the cost as much as possible with the money raised.

 

When we first starting seeing these results in our patients, it made us so excited and hopeful that we may have found a way to help and empower women to have better deliveries and better recoveries!  Complications and trauma during childbirth has been shown to increase a woman's risk for pelvic floor dysfunction including painful intercourse, incontinence, and pelvic organ prolapse.  We thought that this type of treatment could help decrease that risk and help women have better long-term function without pelvic floor issues.  As we always say, pelvic floor dysfunction is common but not normal!

By funding this research study, you could help the women in your life have less childbirth complications, a better recovery, and an improved beginning to their motherhood journey.

For the last 3 years we've been working so hard to design this study and find a way to provide better prenatal care to women and now we need your help to spread the word about it!  We'd love if you shared with your friends, family, and anyone who might be interested.  Thank you so much!

Interested in being a participant in our research study?  Apply here

Visit our website

Tag us on Instagram and Facebook

story:
Short Summary

Thank you for your interest in our campaign!  We are San Diego Seed Company, a small certified organic urban farm that produces bioregional seeds for Southern California and the American Southwest.  We have been in business since 2011  producing and selling organic garden and farm seed.  After all these years of running our business successfully, we have come to a crossroads where we need to improve our packaging for our customers and our retailers. We need to raise funds to create and print full-color industry-standard seed packs with print on front and back. This improvement will greatly increase our ability to educate our growers, gain more retail outlets and allow us to have a seat at the seed packet industry table.  After almost a decade of working to build our family-run small business this step would be monumental for our success in the decades to come. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We need $7,000 to cover the cost of packaging development and printing.  Complete costs below are:

    • 600$ for label set up through Cambridge Pacific https://www.cpacific.com/

      5,400 for 120 varieties of labels 1K of each

      750 for design work

      2,500$ Copy write work

  • By helping us create and print front and back packaging, you are helping us educate our customers, gain more retailers and spread the benefit of organically produced, bioregional seeds that are so important to sustainable agriculture. 
  • Our goal is to cover the large upfront costs of the packaging makeover. Whatever funds we raise will be applied to this goal.

Why should you contribute

  • San Diego Seed Company educates growers all over the world about the importance of growing locally and sustainably. Our seed packet makeover will allow our customers to be more successful by providing more growing instructions on the packet.  This will allow for more small scale growers and gardeners to produce local food for their communities. 
  • We have successfully managed our resources and contributed positively to our community with more than $5,000 dollars in seed donations to school and community gardens. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help monetarily with our goal, please try and help us in other ways.

  • Spread the word about us and our campaign!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Thank you for your interest in our campaign!  We are San Diego Seed Company, a small certified organic urban farm that produces bioregional seeds for Southern California and the American Southwest.  We have been in business since 2011  producing and selling organic garden and farm seed.  After all these years of running our business successfully, we have come to a crossroads where we need to improve our packaging for our customers and our retailers. We need to raise funds to create and print full-color industry-standard seed packs with print on front and back. This improvement will greatly increase our ability to educate our growers, gain more retail outlets and allow us to have a seat at the seed packet industry table.  After almost a decade of working to build our family-run small business this step would be monumental for our success in the decades to come. 
 

What We Need & What You Get
 

We need $7,000 to cover the cost of packaging development and printing.  Complete costs below are:
600$ for label set up through Cambridge Pacific https://www.cpacific.com/
5,400 for 120 varieties of labels 1K of each
750 for design work
2,500$ Copy write work


By helping us create and print front and back packaging, you are helping us educate our customers, gain more retailers and spread the benefit of organically produced, bioregional seeds that are so important to sustainable agriculture. 
Our goal is to cover the large upfront costs of the packaging makeover. Whatever funds we raise will be applied to this goal.


Why should you contribute

San Diego Seed Company educates growers all over the world about the importance of growing locally and sustainably. Our seed packet makeover will allow our customers to be more successful by providing more growing instructions on the packet.  This will allow for more small scale growers and gardeners to produce local food for their communities. 
We have successfully managed our resources and contributed positively to our community with more than $5,000 dollars in seed donations to school and community gardens. 

 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't help monetarily with our goal, please try and help us in other ways.
Spread the word about us and our campaign!

story:
Over the last year I moved away from my beautiful friends, family and teammates in Chicago with hopes of completing my goal of becoming a legit and certified herbalist. Unfortunately, the path has not been as smooth as I thought it would be and have been struggling with my journey. However I have spent more time than ever still trying to learn how to grow, harvest and create my own medicine from the earth. I have studied independently for as long as I can remember, and I know in order to take my studies to the next level, I need classes; teachers; a mentor to guide me along my way. I have researched many online herbal medicine making programs, and I keep coming back to this particular course and would love to be able to take it, but due to lack of funding I haven't been able to yet. Any help would be extremely appreciated in achieving my life long dream of starting my own DIY herbal medicine business. 

I promise to become the most dedicated and best damn herbalist you'll ever know. I want to teach skaters across the globe to heal their own injuries, ailments, and emotional imbalances so they can be the strongest, healthiest athletes both on and off the track! 

I would love to have this course completed by the spring of 2018, but I know once I start taking my classes, Ill begin experimenting with everything I learn, so Ill be able to get the ball rolling as soon as I can start taking the course!

The course I want to take can be found here: https://chestnutherbs.com/online-herbal-classes/herbal-medicine-making-course/

Thanks so much!

story:
"Over two thirds (68%) of the public would like more rest, according to the worlds largest ever survey on the topic. 

The results of the survey, led by Durham University researchers, also revealed that nearly a third (32%) of respondents said they need more rest than the average person, while 10% think they need less.  More than 18,000 people from 134 countries took part in the Rest Test.

The survey found that those who felt they needed more rest scored lower in terms of well-being. Similarly, those who responded saying they think they get more rest than average or don't feel in need of more rest, have well being scores twice as high as those who wanted more rest.  This suggests that the perception of rest matters, as well as the reality."

 Truth is, at every turn there is some form of unrest. The television, newspaper or internet will reveal any number of crises. It is becoming more distressing as we witness this epidemic intensify.

 

 

What if there is an answer closer than we realise? What if there is a key to finding a rest that we have never experienced before?

The experience of peace, hope and calm is THE much needed remedy which is hidden within the very essence of nature. Here is found the place of Rest and healing.

Rest is a continual series of nature films.  Each program contains stunning nature scenes, overlaid a bed of peaceful and calming music, interlaced with sounds of nature, mingled with uplifting and inspirational words.

Broadcast and digital media, the very platforms that reveal the turbulence our world is in, also have the opportunity to bring a Rest our world needs to experience.

 

“Research, conducted with Professor Dacher Keltner, an expert in the science of emotion at the University of California, Berkeley, confirms that even short engagement with nature programs leads to significant increases in positive emotions including awe, contentedness, joy and amusement. The study also found substantial decreases in emotions such as nervousness, anxiety, fear, stress and tiredness.”

EVERY one of us needs REST.  Rest from physical labour is extremely important - we get that, our bodies need to regenerate.  But our minds ALSO need REST. Nature has many healing properties on many different levels. It is the most effective lesson book to study. We here at BTMV have researched and applied what nature and it’s Creator have to offer.

Personal experience has proven that a program of peaceful music, stunning nature imagery coupled with uplifting words bring much needed hope and rest.  

 

 

"Mandy"

 “. . . . . so now my sister Mandy is playing the Rest programs more and finding them wonderful.  A close friend said Mandy was so improved, (ie not so distracted or withdrawn by the ‘voices’ in her head), to the extent that she would like to receive more if you have them. I wanted you to know  they are blessing her abundantly. She is calmer and less preoccupied.”

 

Did you know the most successful mobile platform app in 2017 was based around nature and meditation?  The world is becoming aware of the power of nature.  

 

 

 

Broadcast television and digital streaming across the world need Rest content - GOOD content!  There is content that informs us, entertains us, dare we say, worries us and more, but there is also a need for content that allows our minds to rest, watch, listen and just meditate upon the wonders of nature.

The dedicated BTMV media teams mission is to seek, capture, and magnify those precious and glorious moments of natures ever passing beauty.

It is our sincere desire to produce programs that bring hope and rest into the lives of every person.  We have begun to produce a continual series of programs that combine peaceful music, stunning images with powerful and uplifting words.  Please, take a moment to view the teaser of our first program . . .

 

 
 
 
 

Our challenge has been to produce this program with the little we have. Whilst we are continuing to be faithful with the little, we would like to offer the highest quality possible.

The best nature has to offer demands the best equipment possible!

The huge commitment and specialist enterprise needed to capture natures calming, restful smorgasbord of hidden grandeur and beauty needed to minister to the hearts of a stressed and anxious world, requires professional high quality, costly and specialty media equipment. Our calling at BTMV is to seek out and capture that hidden beauty of the Divine handy work. 

 

 

Your contribution to our campaign will facilitate the purchase of necessary equipment and production costs, enabling us to capture creation in all its glory.  

Our invitation and appeal to you is to partner with us at BTMV through your financial support and most earnest prayers enabling us together to bring the power of Rest into the hearts of broken people through the art of cinematography and sounds of nature.

 

We are blessed to have in place International broadcast partners who have already begun to air Rest.  The web will also make Rest available to all those in need, as will the availability of disc media for those who desire a tangible Rest resource.  Even so we are not even scratching the surface.  

Rest has the real possibility of making a difference not only in YOUR home and work place but also in hospitals, retirement villages, churches, health clinics, prisons, offices, schools/colleges and cafes. The list goes on… Your support will bring Rest to so many.  

If you are aware of, or have opportunity to share and or promote Rest programs in your sphere of influence we would love to hear from you.  Please email us at info@btmv.rest

 

 

Perspective is an interesting concept.  Depending on your financial environment our campaign is either a small bump or a huge mountain.  To help a little in accomodating either view we have done our best to break our target into two.

The first target will enable us to make a positive start.  It will make a big difference to our ability of achieving a higher level of quality.  Our complete campaign target will provide additional hardware enabling a more streamlined approach to edit, as well as allowing for upgrade of some ageing  existing equipment. Further, it also provides for greater funding in both Production Costs and Travel Expenses.

 

 

The following Pie Chart breaks down each cost area as a percentage of the complete target.

 

Aerial Vision Equipment                                                                              

The view from above is simply spectacular.  Aerial vision always ties nature content together.  A specialty camera on a remote controlled aerial vehicle will provide these necessary clips.

Travel Expenses                                                                                          

The world has so many beautiful places that are worthy of being captured on film.  Your continued support will allow many  locations to be brought to life through Rest.

Computer and Editing Equipment                                                          

High quality film is always represented by very large file sizes.  Super powerful computers, as well as speciality supporting computer hardware will turn the captured footage into the most amazing sequences of natures spectacular.

Camera Support                                                                                            

There are so many beautiful places on earth that can only be captured and fully appreciated by a moving camera.  Highly stable camera support equipment will provide the necessary tools to balance and smoothly move our camera through these stunning locations.

Camera and Lenses                                            

Top quality motion picture cameras have now surpassed the capability of the human eye to process and capture instantaneously the high variation between light and dark.  This wide dynamic range in capture brings new and stunning perspective.  The best nature has to offer can now be seen in all its beauty.

Camera Ancillaries                                                                                       

The true essence of nature can only be captured when all the natural elements are represented. In addition to standard motion picture, time-lapse, as well as surround sound bring the majesty and grandeur of nature to life. Ancillary motion picture equipment will make this possible.

Production                                                                                                      

We are so pleased to inform you that we have in place a top shelf graphic design team, social media analyst as well as digital platform developers.  This team has the absolute capability of bringing the Rest programs into the digital world, thereby allowing people across the globe access to this most important and necessary calming resource.

Fees / Perks / Overheads                                                                        

We are so thankful for the support offered by all those involved with our campaign.  This rewards your valuable time and contribution.

 

We would be sincerely grateful to hear directly from anyone who would be interested in either supporting Rest in a continual sponsorship capacity (such as ongoing travel costs), or by providing means of assistance other than financial support, or even by means of significant donation.  Please contact us directly at info@btmv.rest

 

 

We are a husband and wife team, blessed and supported by our 6 wonderful children. We are thankful to call the Sunshine Coast in Queensland Australia, home. We are Craig and Nicole.  Our combined family is the BTMV team!

 

 

With combined experience in music, lifestyle and wellness coaching, photography and cinematography we are well equipped to put these programs together. 

We have received the greatest satisfaction from our time spent so far in developing the Rest program.

 

 

We are about to complete our first DVD/BluRay/Ultra High Definition compilation for public distribution.  Through broadcast, our programs have already been viewed multiple times in many countries over the world. We are so looking forward to you joining with us as we continue to further develop ultra high quality Rest programs that we know will bring peace, calm, hope and rest into the lives of so many people

 We sincerely believe in the power of Rest. Our collective risk is that we do not have the necessary funds to take these programs to the next required level, and therefore risk not bringing Rest to those so desperately in need.

 

 

BTMV is committed to bringing the power of natures book of creation into the lives of a broken world. Thank you for your earnest support to this powerful campaign, allowing us to play our part in providing Rest for our turbulent world.

​To view more about who we are, log onto www.btmv.rest

 

We are thankful for all the support we receive.  The least we can do is to offer our heart felt appreciation and to try and say thank you through some small gift.  Please take a look at each reward level and see what fits you best.  Please know that every reward listed is not an anticipated retail value, just a small gift in recognition of your support. If you would like to just make a contribution and are not taken by any reward please just select 'Back It'.  We will still value your contribution greatly.

***Please note for those interested in the Flash Drive Reward ($250), it is essential that you make all necessary checks regarding compatibility so as to avoid disappointment.  The flash drive we provide will be formatted in NFTS.  This should allow problem free viewing on all UHD devices that allow for file playing from a flash drive.

 

 

We are well aware of the mountain we are beginning to climb in endeavouring to reach our target. Even so, we have faith that you will see the incredible importance and benefit this program can bring.  With your support, we believe we can achieve this ambitious target. Together we will share Rest with the world.

 Our request of you is to assist us additionally by sharing our campaign with family, friends and colleagues.  We would be so grateful if you would take the time to pass your support of our campaign through Facebook, Instagram, email and any other means you can, encouraging as many as possible to join with us as we bring Rest to the world.  Please remember, wherever possible use the Indiegogo tools to share as these contribute to additional exposure for our campaign.

 

 

Our world has many opportunities for us to rest.  The very least we can do is to bring as much of natures beauty into the lives of those who through circumstance and need, may not be able to enjoy the great outdoors as freely as others. Would you join with us?

“Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.”

Matthew 11:28

story:
Welcome

Hey there! I am River Devora, director of Strong Roots and Wide Branches, an interfaith polytheist learning community. This year, myself, Cara Freyasdaughter and other folks from our group are hosting a Pan-Polytheist hospitality suite at PantheaCon, and we need your help!

This hospitality suite will allow us a dedicated space to connect with  other polytheists, host classes and rituals, and provide spiritual services for our community. This suite will allow us to take care of our community and provide a calm and safe sanctuary space in the midst of a very large and sometimes overwhelming conference!  We will also be providing dedicated and accessible shrines to a number of Gods and Spirits from several different pantheons, and space for folks to worship and meaningfully connect with their Blessed Powers. 

The Roots and Branches program, since its inception, has always been dedicated to providing an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment for our participants. Our suite will be committed to providing programming and safe space for folks of a variety of backgrounds and identities. 

                                                                                                                                      

What Your Contributions Cover

Your contributions will help us to cover the costs of the renting and rearranging the hotel room for five nights; providing offerings to the gods and spirits; providing food and drink hospitality to the folks who make use of our space; providing food and drink to help sustain our SRWB  team of volunteers; and purchasing spiritual triage supplies for folks who may find themselves in spiritual need during the course of the conference. This is a huge goal, but we feel that given the strength of our extended Strong Roots and Wide Branches community, we can make all of this happen and more!

Our Suite's Offerings

Though our main focus will be providing open shrine space and hospitality, here are some of the rituals, classes, and workshops that we will also be offering at the Suite:

Rituals:

  • Matronae Devotional
  • Devotional for the Vanic Gods of Norse Mythology
  • Celebration honoring the Eternal Marriage of Ariadne and Dionysus

Classes and Workshops:

  • Polytheist Meet & Greet
  • Introduction to Polytheist Beliefs and Practices
  • Introduction to the Matronae Cultus
  • Introduction to the Norse Gods
  • Greek and Latin Ritual
  • Spiritual Self-Care
  • Ancestor Veneration
  • Furious Revels! Parades and Processionals Throughout Europe (and the opportunity to get costumed up for one!)

Our Perks

Please check out our fantastic perks as well! Our perks include offerings to your gods made in your name at our shrines as well as hand-crafted ritual items and other wonderful gifts based on the level of your donation. You are always welcome to donate to the Suite without a receiving a perk as well.

$ 10 -- Opening Ceremony

You will be included and mentioned by name in our Opening Ceremony to all of the assembled Gods and Powers as a person who helped make this Suite a reality. You will also receive a Strong Roots Wide Branches badge ribbon and be listed in our Suite as one of our donors.

$ 25 -- Opening Ceremony Video

The same as the Opening Ceremony perk, but videotaped! Get a video file of our Opening Ceremony. You will also receive a Strong Roots Wide Branches badge ribbon and be listed in our Suite as one of our donors.

$35 -- Carved Antler Rune Token

Receive a hand-carved antler rune token featuring a rune of your choice from the Elder Futhark. (You will get a chance to specify which rune at time of ordering.) The token is a handmade product and the actual measurements may vary. Generally, however, it measures approximately 1.5"x1.5"x1.5". It is a beautifully crafted item that can be used as a pendant, a magical focus, or an altar item. This perk also includes a SRWB Badge Ribbon and a mention in the Opening Ceremony. (Shipping fee will be refunded if you can pick this perk up on site.)

$35 -- Hand-Made Leather Crown

Receive a hand-made painted leather crown! This crown makes a great addition to your ritual accoutrements. Choose between the Triple Moon or the Oak Leaves style. This perk also includes a SRWB Badge Ribbon and a mention in the Opening Ceremony. (Shipping fee will be refunded if you can pick this perk up on site.)

$35 -- Felted Skulls

Receive a hand-felted woolen skull made by our own River Devora. The skull is a handmade product and the actual measurements may vary. Generally, however, it measures approximately 1"x1". This perk also includes a SRWB Badge Ribbon and a mention in the Opening Ceremony. (Shipping fee will be refunded if you can pick this perk up on site.)

(Note: The handcrafted perks do NOT include the Opening Ceremony video.)

$50 -- Libation Offering

A bottle of liquor of your choice will be placed on the altar of the deity or pantheon of your choice in your name, allowing visitors to the Suite to make a libation to your God(s) using the alcohol that your contribution provided. The alcohol will be a popular mid-grade brand of whiskey, vodka, mead, red wine, or rum (your choice). This perk also includes a SRWB Badge Ribbon, a mention in the Opening Ceremony, and the Ceremony video file.

$75 -- Rune or Tarot Reading at Con

A member of the Strong Roots Wide Branches will give you a 30 min. Rune or Tarot Reading (your choice) at PantheaCon this year. Depending on timing and availability, this make take place either in the Suite itself or in an adjacent room. This perk also includes a SRWB Badge Ribbon, a mention in the Opening Ceremony, and the Ceremony video file.

$100 -- Divination / Spiritual Consult

Receive one hour-long divination/spiritual consultation session with River Devora, the leader of Strong Roots Wide Branches and an experienced, professional spirit worker. This session will take place in person or via Skype/Google Chat within a month after PantheaCon 2017 is over. This perk also includes a SRWB Badge Ribbon, a mention in the Opening Ceremony, and the Ceremony video file.

Thank you for supporting us, and for giving us the opportunity to support you, our community. Blessings and thanks!

 

Help spread the word!

 

You can also help support our Suite by sharing our Facebook event:

https://www.facebook.com/events/1355219707875563/
story_txt:
WelcomeHey there! I am River Devora, director of Strong Roots and Wide Branches, an interfaith polytheist learning community. This year, myself, Cara Freyasdaughter and other folks from our group are hosting a Pan-Polytheist hospitality suite at PantheaCon, and we need your help!This hospitality suite will allow us a dedicated space to connect with  other polytheists, host classes and rituals, and provide spiritual services for our community. This suite will allow us to take care of our community and provide a calm and safe sanctuary space in the midst of a very large and sometimes overwhelming conference!  We will also be providing dedicated and accessible shrines to a number of Gods and Spirits from several different pantheons, and space for folks to worship and meaningfully connect with their Blessed Powers. The Roots and Branches program, since its inception, has always been dedicated to providing an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment for our participants. Our suite will be committed to providing programming and safe space for folks of a variety of backgrounds and identities.                                                                                                                                       What Your Contributions CoverYour contributions will help us to cover the costs of the renting and rearranging the hotel room for five nights; providing offerings to the gods and spirits; providing food and drink hospitality to the folks who make use of our space; providing food and drink to help sustain our SRWB  team of volunteers; and purchasing spiritual triage supplies for folks who may find themselves in spiritual need during the course of the conference. This is a huge goal, but we feel that given the strength of our extended Strong Roots and Wide Branches community, we can make all of this happen and more!Our Suite's OfferingsThough our main focus will be providing open shrine space and hospitality, here are some of the rituals, classes, and workshops that we will also be offering at the Suite:Rituals:
Matronae Devotional
Devotional for the Vanic Gods of Norse Mythology
Celebration honoring the Eternal Marriage of Ariadne and Dionysus
Classes and Workshops:
Polytheist Meet & Greet
Introduction to Polytheist Beliefs and Practices
Introduction to the Matronae Cultus
Introduction to the Norse Gods
Greek and Latin Ritual
Spiritual Self-Care
Ancestor Veneration
Furious Revels! Parades and Processionals Throughout Europe (and the opportunity to get costumed up for one!)
Our PerksPlease check out our fantastic perks as well! Our perks include offerings to your gods made in your name at our shrines as well as hand-crafted ritual items and other wonderful gifts based on the level of your donation. story:
Short Summary

My name is Elliot and I am female-to-male transgender and part of my medical transition is getting top surgery. In basic terms top surgery is when you get your chest reconstructed to look more masculine. For some people top surgery is covered by their insurance. Unfortunately, my insurance does not. *Booo*

What I Need & How You Can Help

I am trying to raise $8000 before December so I can get surgery before Christmas. Asking for help can be hard so I thought I could at least make it fun for those who can help me. There are three ways you can help me reach my goal.

Donate

The first way is by clicking the Back It button to the side of the video. With this you can donate any amount of money you can to my surgery fund.

Perks

The second way is by picking one of the perks. Each perk has a different dollar amount donation. So for example, if you pick the $10 perk, you donate $10 to my surgery fund and in return I send you a picture of my cat, signed by my cat!

Spread the Word

I understand that not everyone can donate but that’s ok. So the third way you can help me out is by spreading the word and sharing my video. Every little bit helps!

The Impact

This surgery is something I have wanted for so long and it would be a life-changing procedure. With the ability to be more comfortable in my body I will able to be a visible trans role model for those around me.

Finally, Thank You!

I won't be able to say that enough!

story:
My journey with Yoga Asana...

In 2014, I took a Yoga Asana class that transformed my relationship with the practice. Surrounded by African artwork and Adinkra symbols, as I rolled out my mat, I knew this class had something special to offer.

Thorough yet brief descriptions of how each asana was healing us from the inside out, long-held asana poses and then guided into a transformative meditation.

That is the day I gained a deep love and appreciation for the practice of yoga asana. Yoga Sundays at Shades of Afrika in Long Beach, CA allowed me to access more wisdom and a deeper sense of healing. 

The deep love and appreciation that I found for yoga is now a fabric of my life. Everywhere I go, every time I practice, I remember Yoga Sundays, holding on to the knowing. 

Last year, I was led to leave my career in the tech industry. 

This year, I have been called to walk in my sacred duty on Earth, as a Reiki Master & Yogini. I have always known that I walk this earth to heal myself and to support others on their healing journey. As a Shamanic Reiki Practitioner, the next step in the divine plan is to earn my credentials as a Registered Yoga Teacher.

After yoga teacher training, I will host a healing experience infusing Yin Yoga and Shamanic Reiki. The healing experience will honor and incorporate aspects from the Yoga Sunday practice and is designed for anyone who desires to feel renewed body, mind, and soul. 

I am amazed and thankful that I am chosen and cherished to share the healing powers of Yin Yoga & Shamanic Reiki with the world.

“Yoga is the uniting of consciousness in the heart."

Nischala Joy Devi told by Yogi, Mila Marshall

Lakshmi Rising 21-Day Yoga Teacher Training Immersion

Being called as a healing activator using Yoga Asana as the medium is a transformation of my practice and a transformation of my life. The 200-Hour Lakshmi Rising Yoga Teacher Training (YTT) aligns with the transformation. 

The Yoga Alliance verified and approved YTT immersion encompasses education, empowerment, and evolution, emphasizing more than the physical practice of yoga. The uniqueness of the Lakshmi Rising YTT includes mantra, meditation, dance, wellness, self-care, and ritual to support the transformation.

Your contribution also supports the transformation.

Included in the all-inclusive funding goal

  • 200-hour Yoga Teacher Training and Certification 
  • 20-night accommodations 
  • 3 organic vegetarian meals a day + an unlimited assortment of teas, and fresh fruit for snacks
  • Access to magical private properties including gardens, trails, streams, and mountainsides
  • Making lifetime friends with like-minded souls from around the world
  • A deepened Spiritual Awakening and Evolution

A day at the Lakshmi Rising YTT

  • 6–9 am: Daily Spiritual Practice: Asana, Pranayama (Conscious Breathing), Mantra, and Discussion
  • 9–10 am: Silent Breakfast
  • 11–2 pm: Training Session
  • 2–3 pm: Lunch with Natural Health Discussion
  • 4–7 pm: Training Session
  • 7–8 pm: Dinner with Gratitude Practice

Weekends are dedicated to relaxation, rejuvenation, excursions, self-study, and self-care. 

How you can support the journey...

  • Claim a perk
  • Contribute any amount of $11 or more through Cash App or Venmo
  • Share the campaign on social media
  • Share the campaign with 5  people in your network
  • Send positive vibrations to the campaign 

 

As I transform, right here, right now, I embody the journey, and all support is received with so much gratitude.

Contributions through Cash App ($BritTyus) and Venmo (@BritTyus) will be added to this campaign to ensure that backers and contributions remain current.

Perks

Life Purpose Oracle Pull: With every contribution of $11 or more, backers will receive an email of gratitude and one card from the Life Purpose Oracle Deck by Doreen Virtue. This card will give insight into your soul's chosen path. All contributions of $11 or more will automatically receive this perk. If you are contributing to another platform, please be sure to send me a message, including your email address to receive your Life Purpose Card. 

The Angel Guide Oracle Reading: With this perk, backers will receive a three-card reading from The Angel Guide Oracle Deck by Kyle Gray. This shamanic reading reflects your strengths, your heart and offers guidance to achieving your goals. We can meet in person for the reading, or we can meet virtually.

Magdalene Oracle Reading: With this perk, backers will receive a seven-card reading from the Magdalene Oracle Deck by Toni Carmine Salerno. For this shamanic reading, we will invite our ancestors and angels to deliver messages that offer insights into your past, present, and future. We can meet in person for the reading, or we can meet virtually.

Shamanic Reiki Energy Healing Session: Reiki is an ancient healing art that brings balance to our spiritual, physical, mental, and emotional selves through the "laying of hands". During the session, healing energy is channeled to the client to clear internal blockages and activate the flow of healing. We will journey to a place of deep healing through conscious breathing while being guided by Spirit. Reiki addresses physical illness, emotional and mental disorders and allows us to return to oneness with ourselves. 

The session will take place at my Sacred Space or we can meet virtually. Before the session, we will review how you can best prepare. I am looking forward to sharing this beautiful healing practice with you! 

And I say Ashé

Ashé is derived from the Yoruba word àse and is a Praise word used to Give Thanks. Ashé is the power behind all things in the universe. 

I am eternally grateful for your support. 

And so it is! 

Namaste

story:
Let's Do this! :)

Hi! My name is Jenifer! 

I AM a Lightworker~Healer and Ascension Pioneer! I AM an average American girl that grew up in the suburbs of Detroit. I AM a single mother of a 22 year old son that I raised on my own as a Server and Bartender ! I AM also a Reiki HEALER and Certified Massage Therapist. I have spent my whole life struggling through my own mistakes and negative situations brought on by family , and society. Which would make me like MOST of the population! Through my own journey into Ascension , there are things that I have learned, observed, and also that have been downloaded into my consciousness .This is why I AM striving to provide a Sacred Space for the HEART OPENING to happen for many AWAKENING souls , And so I would consider this one of my missions that I was sent here to complete! If you resonate with Me and my story, hop on board! 

We can make a big difference in so many lives! 

Also these Centers could spread a cross the globe.

I have overcome many obstacles in my life and I AM not giving up on this one! 

I AM another YOU! :)

Please if you cannot contribute , please spread the word ! Help my Angels n helping me! :)

story:
Mission Statement


The WeWALK Movement is a fundraising project initiated by YGA (Young Guru Academy), an international nonprofit organization. 

YGA's mission is to cultivate competent, socially conscious young leaders who innovate new solutions to society's biggest problems. Together, YGA leaders have designed the world's most revolutionary smart cane, WeWALK.

YGA has over 10 years of expertise designing new technologies for the visually impaired and have won multiple global awards including the Edison Awards, MWC Awards by GSMA and the MIT Social Innovation of the Year. YGA has also been provided with support from Vestel, utilizing "Vestel City" (the largest manufacturing facility in Europe) in order to develop and mass-produce WeWALK.
 


We want to make an impact in assistive technology with WeWALK Smart Cane Incubation. Be a part of it. Join the movement! Let's WeWALK Together.

UPDATE! #OneCupChallenge

What can you do with a cup of coffee?

We challenge you to replace your morning coffee with a power walk and donate to the WeWALK campaign. Your contribution has a direct impact in our goal to bring WeWALK to the masses.

Every bit counts! We also invite you to challenge two of your friends to share in the movement. Hashtag #OneCupChallenge & let the challenge begin! Lets WeWALK together.

 

Did You Know?

Today, there are

 

In other words,


are visually impaired and blind. On top of that, an astonishing 50 million of them use a cane.

In the US alone, there are 10 million visually impaired demographic, which accounts for the rate of 

In fact, low-income level constitutes a majority of the visually impaired. Also considering such fact, the affordability to WeWALK can be challenging to some. 

With your support, we aim to use all funding to change the current status quo, making the lives of those who are blind or visual impaired safer and more convenient with the supportive network of hospitals and organizations to deliver advanced assistive technology to those in need.

 

WeWALK's Accolades


We are honored to have been featured and supported by all of the following individuals and organizations.

WeWALK is proud to be in partnership with Helen Keller Services for the Blind.

We will be donating WeWALKs across various organizations, & your support is deeply appreciated.

We are also thankful for the below who know our products and have given us praise.

Equally, we are thankful for the below charitable donators.

 

Introducing

 

Most Integrated Smart Cane for The Visually Impaired
 

 

Stay Safer with Smart Ultrasonic Sensors

The ultrasonic sensor system alerts you of obstacles with two vibration buttons, right at your fingertips. 

 

Easily Connect to 3rd Party Apps

With the WeWALK app, simply connect and activate your WeWALK smart cane. Use integrations like Google Maps, Uber, Lyft 

 

Comes with Speaker, Microphone & Touchpad

The touchpad works by sensing its user's gesture and is used to control your connected mobile phone.

WeWALK has a speaker and microphone built that works perfectly with Alexa. A true one hand free advantage we have yet seen on the cane market. 

 

WeWALK Testimonials

 

#WeWALKTogether

Alone they can do so little, together we can do so much more. Join the WeWALK Movement! Let's WeWALK together. Help us spread the word and use hashtag #WeWALKTogether

We also created links below for your convenience to share to your social sites with 1 simple click. 

 

 

 

About WeWALK & YGA

For decades, YGA has run a nonprofit business with a mission to create and deliver cutting-edge technology, providing innovative solutions to the visually disabled and other disadvantaged groups in our society.

We've touched the lives of over 170,000 people, been honored by the GSMA and the Edison Awards and have acknowledged at best practice showcases at the UN.

We are a diverse team of dreamers growing globally to make a bigger impact. With the invention of WeWALK, we are turning our dream of a better world into a reality.

WeWALK is on track to make an impact

 

 

 

Frequently Asked Questions

 

What is WeWALK Movement?    
The WeWALK Movement is a fundraising project initiated by YGA with the aim to make an impact in assistive technology with WeWALK Smart Cane Incubation for the visually impaired. Alone they can do so little, together we can do so much. Donate or pre-order for yourself or a loved one. 

What is WeWALK Smart Cane?    
WeWALK smart cane is an innovative smart white cane designed for the visually impaired. It's built with Alexa and works with other third-party apps such as Google Maps, Uber, Lyft. With an open platform available to developers, endless practical skills can be developed overtime catering to specific user needs as an innovative and expandable smart cane.

Why are you crowdfunding?    
We funded WeWALK at Arikovani which is crowdfunding platform in Turkey. WeWALK raised over $94,000 within 48 hours. The campaign set a track record for Arikovani and WeWALK team is growing it's reach to more countries and expand the reach of the WeWALK movement and continuation of advancing the WeWALK smart cane to those in need. 
 

 

What WeWALK features are available?    
Obstacle detection, smartphone integration, and open platform for new skills to build on.  

What is the battery life of WeWALK?
Up to 5 days ( Average daily usage is 4 hours). The micro USB input, which is at the narrow side of the device, is used to charge the battery of your WeWALK.

Does it have an app? Which phones does it work with?
WeWalk Smart Cane runs on Android and iOS-based mobile phones. Android-based devices should have the software version 5.0 or later, iOS-based devices require OS version 10 or later.

 

What are the recommended ages?  
Anyone who is capable of using a white cane between the age of 15 to 60 years old but not subject exclusively to the range.   

Is it safe?
WeWALK helps visually disabled users to sense obstacles at head level, to improve safety. But improper use of a white cane by people who are incapable of using it could cause some potential hazards. 

 

When does shipping begin?    
WeWALK Smart Cane will begin shipping in December 2018. Orders will be shipped sequentially

Which countries will WeWALK ship to?     
We are able to ship WeWALK to worldwide.

Why pre-order WeWALK Smart Cane now?    
By backing now you'll get to donate or own a WeWALK Smart Cane. You get exclusive access to provide valuable feedback that will shape future generations of the product and join the WeWALK Movement.

 

What is your refund policy after campaign conclusion?    
Refunds are processed on a case-by-case basis; at some point, we will need to lock refunds in order to go into production & shipment. We will not be able to refund orders once they've shipped.  

What is your return/exchange policy?
Return and exchange are processed on a case-by-case basis. If you find your WeWALK defective and unable to operate as expected, please contact support@wewalk.io. We will get back to you timely with complimentary technical support.

If I have other questions, who should I contact?   

  • Customer Support: support@wewalk.io
  • Press Contact: press@wewalk.io
  • Be a WeWALK Ambassador: hello@wewalk.io
story_txt:
Mission StatementThe WeWALK Movement is a fundraising project initiated by YGA (Young Guru Academy), an international nonprofit organization. YGA's mission is to cultivate competent, socially conscious young leaders who innovate new solutions to society's biggest problems. Together, YGA leaders have designed the world's most revolutionary smart cane, WeWALK.YGA has over 10 years of expertise designing new technologies for the visually impaired and have won multiple global awards including the Edison Awards, MWC Awards by GSMA and the MIT Social Innovation of the Year. YGA has also been provided with support from Vestel, utilizing "Vestel City" (the largest manufacturing facility in Europe) in order to develop and mass-produce WeWALK. We want to make an impact in assistive technology with WeWALK Smart Cane Incubation. Be a part of it. Join the movement! Let's WeWALK Together.UPDATE! #OneCupChallenge
What can you do with a cup of coffee?We challenge you to replace your morning coffee with a power walk and donate to the WeWALK campaign. Your contribution has a direct impact in our goal to bring WeWALK to the masses.Every bit counts! We also invite you to challenge two of your friends to share in the movement. Hashtag #OneCupChallenge & let the challenge begin! Lets WeWALK together. Did You Know?Today, there are In other words,are visually impaired and blind. On top of that, an astonishing 50 million of them use a cane.In the US alone, there are 10 million visually impaired demographic, which accounts for the rate of In fact, low-income level constitutes a majority of the visually impaired. Also considering such fact, the affordability to WeWALK can be challenging to some. With your support, we aim to use all funding to change the current status quo, making the lives of those who are blind or visual impaired safer and more convenient with the supportive network of hospitals and organizations to deliver advanced assistive technology to those in need. WeWALK's AccoladesWe are honored to have been featured and supported by all of the following individuals and organizations.WeWALK is proud to be in partnership with Helen Keller Services for the Blind.We will be donating WeWALKs across various organizations, & your support is deeply appreciated.We are also thankful for the below who know our products and have given us praise.Equally, we are thankful for the below charitable donators. Introducing Most Integrated Smart Cane for The Visually Impaired  Stay Safer with Smart Ultrasonic SensorsThe ultrasonic sensor system alerts you of obstacles with two vibration buttons, right at your fingertips.  Easily Connect to 3rd Party AppsWith the WeWALK app, simply connect and activate your WeWALK smart cane. Use integrations like Google Maps, Uber, Lyft  Comes with Speaker, Microphone & TouchpadThe touchpad works by sensing its user's gesture and is used to control your connected mobile phone.WeWALK has a speaker and microphone built that works perfectly with Alexa. A true one hand free advantage we have yet seen on the cane market.  WeWALK Testimonials #WeWALKTogetherAlone they can do so little, together we can do so much more. Join the WeWALK Movement! Let's WeWALK together. Help us spread the word and use hashtag #WeWALKTogetherWe also created links below for your convenience to share to your social sites with 1 simple click.    About WeWALK & YGAFor decades, YGA has run a nonprofit business with a mission to create and deliver cutting-edge technology, providing innovative solutions to the visually disabled and other disadvantaged groups in our society.We've touched the lives of over 170,000 people, been honored by the GSMA and the Edison Awards and have acknowledged at best practice showcases at the UN.We are a diverse team of dreamers growing globally to make a bigger impact. With the invention of WeWALK, we are turning our dream of a better world into a reality.WeWALK is on track to make an impact   Frequently Asked Questions What is WeWALK Movement?    The WeWALK Movement is a fundraising project initiated by YGA with the aim to make an impact in assistive technology with WeWALK Smart Cane Incubation for the visually impaired. Alone they can do so little, together we can do so much. It's built with Alexa and works with other third-party apps such as Google Maps, Uber, Lyft. With an open platform available to developers, endless practical skills can be developed overtime catering to specific user needs as an innovative and expandable smart cane.Why are you crowdfunding?    We funded WeWALK at Arikovani which is crowdfunding platform in Turkey. WeWALK raised over $94,000 within 48 hours. The campaign set a track record for Arikovani and WeWALK team is growing it's reach to more countries and expand the reach of the WeWALK movement and continuation of advancing the WeWALK smart cane to those in need.   What WeWALK features are available?    Obstacle detection, smartphone integration, and open platform for new skills to build on.  What is the battery life of WeWALK? Up to 5 days ( Average daily usage is 4 hours). The micro USB input, which is at the narrow side of the device, is used to charge the battery of your WeWALK.Does it have an app? Which phones does it work with? WeWalk Smart Cane runs on Android and iOS-based mobile phones. Android-based devices should have the software version 5.0 or later, iOS-based devices require OS version 10 or later. What are the recommended ages?  Anyone who is capable of using a white cane between the age of 15 to 60 years old but not subject exclusively to the range.   Is it safe? story:
Jenaro & Marc bought Church Street Boxing Gym 5 years ago. Since than we now have 2 locations, our staff has doubled and we have twice as many AMAZING members!! To many, this place has become a second home and we want to show a special thanks to Jenaro and Marc for keeping our second home alive. 

For the next 14 days, we are raising money to deck out Walker! We can't think of a better way to show thanks than to give a gift everyone, including the staff and members can enjoy. 

Please contribute anything you can in order to make this possible. We're asking members and staff to contribute at least $20 to help facilitate the project. 

 

Your contributions will go towards some or all of the following:

  1. A mural, much like the one at Park Place
  2. Fight posters
  3. Enlarged photo of members training, fight nights, and other experiences we all shared together. 

We want everyone to be a part of this and contribute in any way they can. Please see Rocky or Shannon with any questions!

story:
A Wellness Transformation

The Scarlet Sage Herb Co. is transforming into a Wellness Venue, and we need you to be part of it! 

After 23 years in business, Scarlet Sage is finally ready to offer practitioners and event/workshop space right below our current location (in the basement, actually). We have been dreaming of this expansion of services for a few years now, and it's finally able to come true! 

We will be able to offer more transformative experiences:

  • Traditional Healing Arts and Divination intensives and workshops
  • Certifications in Western Herbal Medicine, Aromatherapy, and Indigenous Healing 
  • Private Botanical Inspired Events
  • Clinical consultations with herbalists, aromatherapists, divination healers, acupuncturists, aestheticians, and energy workers.

What We Need & What You Get

You are the reason this is happening. The first 100 supporters will be celebrated with a launch party on July 21!

And we know that our community will come together to support our goal! 

  • This is happening quickly, and we need your help to make sure it's a success out the door!
  • We are asking for $9,900 to help with our initial increase in rent and deposit, install fixtures such as a stainless utility sink, a second entrance for clinical space, chairs for classes, shelves for products, and a tincture bar for compounding herbal and energetic formulas. All funding above $9,900 will go toward scholarships for our classes and workshops, increasing product offerings, maintaining a finacial buffer for growth. 
  • We are launching our Carnelian and Amethyst Memberships, and Seasonal Subscription Boxes for this expansion. Our memberships are where our community grows and stays strong in this growing and expanding city. Depending on the desired tier, memberships include private events, monthly product launches, member-only newsletters, a 10% discount on all classes and products (online and in-store), and our seasonal subscription boxes. 

A Healthy Impact

  • Access to vetted clinical herbalists and alternative practitioners is difficult in a big city. With Laura's 17 years of herbal industry experience, a trained staff with diverse healing traditions, and Scarlet Sage's 23 years of serving the local mission district, we are stoked to bring the best practitioners forward to serve you. 
  • San Francisco is in need of a formal herbal medicine center and school. We are ready to create the dream education center. You have been asking for more from us and due to space constrictions, we have not been able to offer clinical space nor workshops and intensives - until now! 
  • We are dedicated to inclusion and resurgence of traditional knowledge! We are a diverse community of healers that hold intentional space for everyone to be loved and honored exactly as they are. We will be hosting space for POC-only gatherings, Indigenous-only traditional knowledge groups, queer-centered care, and European ancestral resurgence education and rituals. 
  • Since the owner transition three years ago, we have offered more opportunities to learn and grow with our community, supporting healthy individuals and families. This dream is big, and we cannot do it alone. Transformation of health comes in many forms, and we are dedicated to sourcing renowned teachers and gifted souls to help bring healing tools to everyone's life. 

Who We Are

  • Laura Ash : 

Laura has been a clinical western herbalist since 2005 when she attended the California School of Herbal Studies. Laura has traveled all over the world in search of healing modalities. She has trained in Ayurveda with Dr. Vasant Lad in New Mexico, southern France for essential oils, traveled to Northern Lapland Sweden to seek out her own ancestry medicine, and to Tanzania to work with the Maasai in documenting their traditional medicine, starting Herbal Anthropology Project, 501(c)3, to keep their knowledge safeguarded with Intellectual Property protection.

Laura is a queer mother of two beautiful children, and a strong advocate for radical self-care for traveling families who are out to create change in the world with love, vision, and passion.

  • The Scarlet Sage Team: Our staff are dedicated herbalists and healers that are steeped in traditional medicine and modern science. Together, we represent many cultures and views of the body, transformation, and magical knowledge. We are excited about this expansion and to offer all customers and clients a deeper healing experience. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Make sure you're on our email list to hear about events and stay updated on the space launch. Spread the word to friends, too! Join online
  • Share this campaign
  • Follow us on Instagram and Facebook

story:
I am Tereza Owomugisha,female aged 57 and single mother.

I live in Rushaki Ward,Southern Division,Kabale Municipality in Uganda.

 

I am stepping in for miss  Teopista Masanyu(above in Photo), a disabled female aged 30 and living in the same area.

Teopista was disabled by polio at the age of 3 years.She lost her father about 20 years ago and now lives with her old mother aged about 80 years.

Teopista also is a person living with diabetes and at one time was surgically operated on.

She earns a living by using a manual sewing machine bought for her by a kind person in 1999.Now the sewing machine is very old and beyond repair. Also the manual sewing machine makes her work with pain and uncomfortably since her hips and lower limbs are lame.

So now she has no source of income and together with the mother depends on well wishers to get food. They live in an old house.

She needs a new sewing machine, an electrically operated one that she can operated easily, so she can feed herself and her old mother.

The sewing machine, with its accessories, and deposit on payment of space she will rent from where she will work totals to USD 500.

This is the amount I am appealing for on behalf of Teopista Masanyu.

Contribute using the Back it button on the campaign.

Contact me at: owomugishatereza@yahoo.com
