story:
Short Summary

 

Welcome to Hidden Thoughts Press. HTP is a publishing house dedicated to producing quality books filled with real stories from people who are surviving and coping with mental illness. We’re dedicated to helping those with mental illness realize they aren’t alone through inspirational non-fiction anthologies and non-fiction novels. Our staff focuses on the theme of mental wellness throughout the works, offering sufferers, their families, and friends help, hope, and a place to share their stories, including failures, set-backs, and successes.

 

Hidden Thoughts Press strives to be a strong resource to show mental illness is not a problem to be ignored. Sufferers can and do lead productive lives. We publish works in the belief they will be a life ring in the seas of turmoil. Hopefully the stories found here will help make the burdens feel a little lighter through shared experiences.

HERE'S WHAT WE'RE DOING WITH THE PLEDGES IF WE MEET OUR GOAL AMOUNT

 

With our first book, MENTAL WELLNESS REAL STORIES FROM SURVIVORS, all of us at HTP learned a great deal. We found out that although we were able to reach a modest amount of our targeted audience here in Suffolk County, it was a very small percentage, to say the least. Why, you ask? Simple. Money. We want to get our second book into the hands of the thousands of New Yorker's who suffer some form of a mental illness.

Also, In order to get MENTAL WELLNESS 2 advertised in the magazines that cater to the mental health industry, it costs hundreds of dollars. To pull in respected professionals from the industry to write a chapter, costs money. For all the authors who  are working hard at getting a story written for this next collection and then be ready to apply the edits in a what sometimes becomes a rigorous process, these authors need to be compensated as well. And we at HTP want to compensate them with at minimum, semi-professional writer rates.

That's why we are hosting our first Indegogo pledge for our next MENTAL WELLNESS COLLECTION. Besides all the costs involved in getting the book professionally formatted with a cover and interior formatting and making it available to schools, libraries and universities,we want this book to be available to a much wider audience. 

We want to purchase ads in Psychology Today ($750.00 for a small spot in their magazine,) and other respected mental wellness magazines. We want to attend Mental Wellness conferences so we can get a booth, have author signings for our book, and travel outside of New York so those who suffer mental illness can have the opportunity to get these inspirational books. We want to host workshops in adult homes, residential settings, and consumer agencies, universities and more. Not just in a small county in New York.This all cost money, and unfortunately we were unable to get too far with our first book. 

We know what we are asking for will barely cover all our costs from production to advertising, to traveling to so many consumers outside of New York for workshops and book signings, but it will certainly do much better for this book than our first. However, we feel confident that we will exceed our minimum pledge.

We are a Small Press, and unlike the big traditional publishers the funds are just not there. So, by doing this pledge, we will be offering everyone rewards such as an ebook, print books, and more. We can also pre-order all copies of MENTAL WELLNESS 2 to our pledger's, and if we exceed what we're asking for, we will unlock additional rewards and apply the funds to hosting a conference or book signing in your town, begin our next project that is already in pre-development and will showcase real stories from those who are living in residential facilities and dealing with the changes to the housing industry. The working title so far is THE ADULT HOME/SUPPORTED HOUSING INDUSTRY:REAL ESSAYS FROM THE TRENCHES

To this end, I wanted to thank you all in advance for your pledge. Every bit helps us to reach our goals.On behalf of the authors and editors at Hidden Thoughts Press, we thank you.

story:
Hello friends! I am seeking support for my continuing studies in somatic movement education. I am excited to invite you to become a part of my learning journey!

My Story

In 2018, I was inspired to take action towards my desire for more human connection, learning, and transformation in the work that I do in the world. I enrolled in a 4 year program with the Feldenkrais Training Academy in Seattle to become a certified Feldenkrais® practitioner.

Through this immersive, experiential program, I am learning the art and the practice of teaching Awareness Through Movement® (group classes) and Functional Integration® (a type of body work that helps the body and the mind find a new integrated way of functioning together).

On a personal level, I’ve struggled to find healing modalities that are effective in healing chronic health conditions stemming from accumulated stress and trauma. Over the past decade, I have dedicated myself to experimenting with naturopathy, psychotherapy, yoga, meditation, and energy healing, with limited success and inconsistent results.

I’ve come to realize that all of these methods impose an external system onto an internal system that is dysregulated, and therefore, do not work in synergy with the organic intelligence of the body.

Through this process of experimentation, I discovered that I feel my best when engaged in meditative movement that creates space for self-exploration, such as free-flowing dancing or walking in nature. When moving in this way, I feel more alive and joyful, and notice that many of my chronic health symptoms briefly disappear. I became deeply curious about how this could be!

In 2018, I took a course on healing trauma and rewiring the nervous system that changed the course of my life. Through this course, I experienced the effectiveness of nervous system based modalities such as Somatic Experiencing, Somatic Practice, and Feldenkrais. I discovered practices that allow me to work with my own biology to prevent anxiety, overwhelm, and chronic stress from accumulating and creating chronic health issues.

Through my ongoing Feldenkrais practice, I am beginning to shift my internal terrain that allowed many of the chronic health issues and self-limiting patterns to emerge in the first place.

Immersing myself in the Feldenkrais Training Academy has allowed me to access an inner resourcefulness and resilience that I didn’t know was possible. A year ago, I couldn’t have imagined being able to work full-time, dedicate myself to continuing studies, and teach Awareness Through Movement lessons twice a week – without burning out and sacrificing my wellness. I’m experiencing an expansion of my ability to meet the challenges and opportunities that life presents me.

As a result, I’m now living my life with a sense of calm composure and capability, open to possibilities.

The past year of teaching Awareness Through Movement lessons to friends, family, and practice clients has affirmed that this work is nourishing and energizing for me. The movement lessons have helped my students alleviate chronic tension and pain patterns, quiet persistent thoughts and worries, and find a greater sense of presence and emotional calmness. The most common self-discovery my students share is that by directing their attention to how they are moving, they are able to shift their underlying emotional state.  

As our lives become increasingly complex and the prevalence of childhood adversity, trauma, and chronic illness increases, I see the lack of healing modalities that enable self-learning, empowerment, and access to inner resources as extremely problematic. My vision is to offer a modality that enables people to heal with emotional dignity through true empowerment and learning. I believe that becoming a Feldenkrais practitioner will enable this.

How You Can Help

While I have completed the first year of the Feldenkrais practitioner training program, three more years remain, with the outstanding tuition costs totaling $18,000 CDN. I plan to continue working full-time (apart from the eight weeks of training per year) over the duration of the program to help fund my studies. Unfortunately, I have depleted my savings and it won’t be possible for me to continue the training within the constraints of my current salary and the cost of living in Vancouver (famous for being the most expensive city in Canada).

But, as I’m learning, the Feldenkrais Method has a way of making “the impossible possible, the possible easy, and the easy elegant.” Inspired to explore other possibilities beyond what is immediately available, I am reaching out to my community for support.

I would be beyond grateful to receive donations of any amount towards my somatic movement education. My next tuition installment of $2196 CDN is due in November 2019. If 100 people each donate $21.96, this will cover the costs of my upcoming tuition payment.

Please share this campaign with your network and anyone in your life who you feel would benefit from experiencing Awareness Through Movement or receiving a nutritional consultation on the paleo and ketogenic diet (see below for the rewards I’m offering).

I would be honoured to support individuals on their health and wellness journeys, as the potential for personal transformation with this work is profound.

My Gifts to You

As an expression of my gratitude for your contributions, I am excited to offer the following reward levels:

 

For donations of $22: A recorded somatic movement lesson that will guide you through novel movement patterns that create more ease, fluidity, and possibility in your way of moving and relating to the world. These lessons can help you:

  • Reduce stress and overwhelm
  • Create mental clarity and emotional resilience
  • Recover from injury, surgery, or loss of mobility
  • Improve quality of movement and athletic performance
  • Overcome learning challenges
  • Practice self-care

 

For donations of $60: A recorded somatic movement lesson (see details above) AND a choice of:

  1. A conversation on nervous system based modalities, including Somatic Experiencing, Somatic Practice, and the Feldenkrais Method. I will share my experience with each of these modalities and help you discover which would be the best place for you to start, based on the stages of neuroplastic healing.
  2. A nutritional consultation on the paleo and ketogenic diet. As many of you know, I have been experimenting with ancestral nutrition for over a decade. It would be a pleasure to share my knowledge and experience in this realm to support you on your journey to optimal health. I truly believe that diet is the most direct tool we have available for preventing and reversing inflammation, mental health issues, and chronic disease.

 

For donations of $100: Two private somatic movement lessons taught live online AND a choice of:

  1. A conversation on nervous system based modalities, including Somatic Experiencing, Somatic Practice, and the Feldenkrais Method.
  2. A nutritional consultation on the paleo and ketogenic diet.

 

For donations of $200 or more: Four private somatic movement lessons taught live online AND:

  • A conversation on nervous system based modalities, including Somatic Experiencing, Somatic Practice, and the Feldenkrais Method.
  • A nutritional consultation on the paleo and ketogenic diet.

 

For donations of $800 or more: A full-day private immersion, offered in-person in West Vancouver or online, featuring:

  • Two private Awareness Through Movement lessons.
  • An introduction to nervous system based modalities, including Somatic Experiencing, Somatic Practice, and the Feldenkrais Method.
  • A nutritional consultation on the paleo and ketogenic diet.
  • Forest walks for reflection and integration.
  • A cohesive plan for bringing the learning forward into your life.
story_txt:
Hello friends! I am seeking support for my continuing studies in somatic movement education. I am excited to invite you to become a part of my learning journey!My StoryIn 2018, I was inspired to take action towards my desire for more human connection, learning, and transformation in the work that I do in the world. I enrolled in a 4 year program with the Feldenkrais Training Academy in Seattle to become a certified Feldenkrais® practitioner.Through this immersive, experiential program, I am learning the art and the practice of teaching Awareness Through Movement® (group classes) and Functional Integration® (a type of body work that helps the body and the mind find a new integrated way of functioning together).On a personal level, I’ve struggled to find healing modalities that are effective in healing chronic health conditions stemming from accumulated stress and trauma. Over the past decade, I have dedicated myself to experimenting with naturopathy, psychotherapy, yoga, meditation, and energy healing, with limited success and inconsistent results.I’ve come to realize that all of these methods impose an external system onto an internal system that is dysregulated, and therefore, do not work in synergy with the organic intelligence of the body.Through this process of experimentation, I discovered that I feel my best when engaged in meditative movement that creates space for self-exploration, such as free-flowing dancing or walking in nature. When moving in this way, I feel more alive and joyful, and notice that many of my chronic health symptoms briefly disappear. I became deeply curious about how this could be!In 2018, I took a course on healing trauma and rewiring the nervous system that changed the course of my life. Through this course, I experienced the effectiveness of nervous system based modalities such as Somatic Experiencing, Somatic Practice, and Feldenkrais. I discovered practices that allow me to work with my own biology to prevent anxiety, overwhelm, and chronic stress from accumulating and creating chronic health issues.Through my ongoing Feldenkrais practice, I am beginning to shift my internal terrain that allowed many of the chronic health issues and self-limiting patterns to emerge in the first place.Immersing myself in the Feldenkrais Training Academy has allowed me to access an inner resourcefulness and resilience that I didn’t know was possible. A year ago, I couldn’t have imagined being able to work full-time, dedicate myself to continuing studies, and teach Awareness Through Movement lessons twice a week – without burning out and sacrificing my wellness. I’m experiencing an expansion of my ability to meet the challenges and opportunities that life presents me.As a result, I’m now living my life with a sense of calm composure and capability, open to possibilities.The past year of teaching Awareness Through Movement lessons to friends, family, and practice clients has affirmed that this work is nourishing and energizing for me. The movement lessons have helped my students alleviate chronic tension and pain patterns, quiet persistent thoughts and worries, and find a greater sense of presence and emotional calmness. The most common self-discovery my students share is that by directing their attention to how they are moving, they are able to shift their underlying emotional state.  As our lives become increasingly complex and the prevalence of childhood adversity, trauma, and chronic illness increases, I see the lack of healing modalities that enable self-learning, empowerment, and access to inner resources as extremely problematic. My vision is to offer a modality that enables people to heal with emotional dignity through true empowerment and learning. I believe that becoming a Feldenkrais practitioner will enable this.How You Can HelpWhile I have completed the first year of the Feldenkrais practitioner training program, three more years remain, with the outstanding tuition costs totaling $18,000 CDN. I plan to continue working full-time (apart from the eight weeks of training per year) over the duration of the program to help fund my studies. Unfortunately, I have depleted my savings and it won’t be possible for me to continue the training within the constraints of my current salary and the cost of living in Vancouver (famous for being the most expensive city in Canada).But, as I’m learning, the Feldenkrais Method has a way of making “the impossible possible, the possible easy, and the easy elegant.” Inspired to explore other possibilities beyond what is immediately available, I am reaching out to my community for support.I would be beyond grateful to receive donations of any amount towards my somatic movement education. My next tuition installment of $2196 CDN is due in November 2019. If 100 people each donate $21.96, this will cover the costs of my upcoming tuition payment. Please share this campaign with your network and anyone in your life who you feel would benefit from experiencing Awareness Through Movement or receiving a nutritional consultation on the paleo and ketogenic diet (see below for the rewards I’m offering).I would be honoured to support individuals on their health and wellness journeys, as the potential for personal transformation with this work is profound.My Gifts to YouAs an expression of my gratitude for your contributions, I am excited to offer the following reward levels: For donations of $22: A recorded somatic movement lesson that will guide you through novel movement patterns that create more ease, fluidity, and possibility in your way of moving and relating to the world. These lessons can help you:
Reduce stress and overwhelm
Create mental clarity and emotional resilience
Recover from injury, surgery, or loss of mobility
Improve quality of movement and athletic performance
Overcome learning challenges
Practice self-care
 For donations of $60: A recorded somatic movement lesson (see details above) AND a choice of:
A conversation on nervous system based modalities, including Somatic Experiencing, Somatic Practice, and the Feldenkrais Method. I will share my experience with each of these modalities and help you discover which would be the best place for you to start, based on the stages of neuroplastic healing.
A nutritional consultation on the paleo and ketogenic diet. As many of you know, I have been experimenting with ancestral nutrition for over a decade. It would be a pleasure to share my knowledge and experience in this realm to support you on your journey to optimal health. I truly believe that diet is the most direct tool we have available for preventing and reversing inflammation, mental health issues, and chronic disease.
 For donations of $100: Two private somatic movement lessons taught live online AND a choice of:
A conversation on nervous system based modalities, including Somatic Experiencing, Somatic Practice, and the Feldenkrais Method.
A nutritional consultation on the paleo and ketogenic diet.
 For donations of $200 or more: Four private somatic movement lessons taught live online AND:
A conversation on nervous system based modalities, including Somatic Experiencing, Somatic Practice, and the Feldenkrais Method.
A nutritional consultation on the paleo and ketogenic diet.
 For donations of $800 or more: A full-day private immersion, offered in-person in West Vancouver or online, featuring:

story: Syria has been in a war for the past 8 years. With the continual increase of medical professionals that relocate out of Syria, access to health care has been harder than ever before. I have decided to start a free Wellness Clinic in Sahnaya, Syria (a suburb South of Damascus), with the help of an Endocrinologist and Pharmacist, that will provide under represented patients with unbiased support and medical care. We will screen patients for diabetes and hypertension. Your support will provide much necessary Glucometers, BP Cuffs, and medication for patients with diabetes and hypertension. This clinic, opening in mid-August, is extremely important as there are very few medical clinics in the area.

story:
Our Goal

Our goal is to  raise $6K to provide 10 scholarships of $500 each for queer women of color, particularly Black women, to the 2018 annual Ojah Yoga Retreat in Dos Rios, CA the weekend of Friday, August  31st to Monday, September 3rd.  The remaining $1K of the funds will cover indiegogo fees and the cost of shipping perks. 

Our minimum target is to raise $3K to provide 4 scholarships. If we do not raise $3K, we will not receive any of the funds from the indiegogo campaign. 

Our Perks

Our funder perks are simply amazing, and were donated by people who knew and loved Chef Yulunda and experienced the healing power of her food and the Ojah Yoga Retreat. Support early before your favorite perks is gone!!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give, please help us reach our goal by:

- Getting the word out - make some noise about the campaign.

- Using the Indiegogo share tools & your own crafty social media skills

- Telling queer women of color working hard to support their community to apply using this link: https://goo.gl/forms/p2gbwrRPceZ3DjFp2

- Registering for the 2018 Ojah Yoga Retreat here: http://www.ojahlife.com/retreats.html

Thank you for considering this request. For reals.

story:
Background

Rise Up! Good Witch Is a small apothecary carrying garden grown, wildcrafted and organic herbal elixirs and oils and affordable tarot card readings and workshops in rural Eureka, California. With around ten years experience studying, growing and making herbal medicine and reading tarot, in June of 2017 Corinna Rosella decided to take a more serious approach to sharing her practices by starting a business, Rise up! Good Witch. For more information about the project, please visit http://www.riseupgoodwitch.com

 

Humboldt Area Center for Harm Reduction aims to reduce harm to the Humboldt community through advocacy, education, and services. They have existed since 2015, and grown as a program as they reach hundreds of individuals on a monthly basis to provide needle exchange and harm reduction education. Their low barrier services connect individuals at risk of infection, overdose death, hepatitis (A, B, and C) and HIV. Their services have reduced rates of infection related hospitalization in Humboldt County. For more info, visit hachr707.com

According to California’s public health data, Humboldt County’s health profile ranks 53 of 58 in health status indicator, making it one of the counties with the worst health disparities in the state. The most alarming are that of stroke, cirrhosis of the liver, and drug related overdose, all ranking in the top five of California counties.

 

Project Outline:

In order to provide herbal consultations, and free teas and tinctures to communities in need, Rise up! Good Witch is looking to establish a free herbal clinic. The clinic would be housed out of HACHR (Humboldt Area Center for Harm Reduction) and would provide one or two days a week of space during drop in hours for clients to receive support through free teas, tinctures and herbal self care education. Ideally, the free herbal clinic will provide a wide variety of herbal remedies, but will focus on issues that arise more frequently in the unhoused and injection drug using population- including heart slowing and anxiety/mood tonics, topical formulas to prevent and improve minor wounds and infections, pain relieving tonics and detoxing elixirs. In addition, herbalists would be able to provide self care and harm reduction information, both in the form of conversations, workshops, and printed material. This project would be in operation from June 4th to September 14th, granted sufficient funding is available.

Project Goals

Set and maintain a minimum of 100 of open clinic hours (averaging 6.5 hours per week)

Design and conduct a minimum of 5 workshops on self care with herbs, focusing on different themes that most affect the IV drug using/unhoused community (wound care, heart slowing/anxiety, liver support & detox, lung and respiratory health, immune support)

Directly serve (in workshops or private consultation) at least 50 people

Participate in at least 3 community events, providing education, information and free herbal remedies and supplements

Build partnerships with community stakeholders (English Express, Jefferson Community Center, The Raven Project, etc) to offer further education and workshops

Connect with other herbalist enterprises locally (Humboldt Herbals, Moonrise Herbs, Dandelion herbal center, northwest school of botanical studies)

Project Timeline

May 14th- 31st

- Secure funding

- Advertise and flyer for services

- Set up herbalism space

- Complete scheduling for workshops, print schedule and begin advertising

June 4th - September 1st

-Provide at least 6 workshops (two per month)

-Connect and give herbal education/support to at least 50 individuals

-Maintain open program for the public a minimum of 100 hours

-Attend at least 3 community events to promote the program

September 1st- 28th

-Complete end of summer report on deliverables and outcomes

-Reassess funding and support to continue into the Fall

 

Project Needs and Expenses:

Packaging material, including:

200 glass tincture bottles - 10ml and 15ml

100 jars - 30ml and 60ml

Organic loose herbs in bulk- purchased from local apothecary to be used for tea and other preparations

Materials for preparing tinctures, elixirs, oils and salves (alcohol, shea butter, oils, apple cider vinegar, honey, etc)

Kitchen equipment (mini fridge, teapot, mugs, hot plate, etc) 

Books on herbalism and self-care for reference library

Table, chairs and shelves

Mason Jars to store herbs

Gardening materials (soil, compost, starts, seeds, pots, etc) for small herb garden

Stipends for herbalist program coordinator ($1200 for 100 hours of active clinic open hours) and herbalist assistant/possible volunteers (12 $25 stipends for gas reimbursement and assistance for herbalist assistant or volunteer)

Herbs to be purchased in 1lb quantities 

For a more detailed description of funding needed for the above program needs, and which herbs are desired for operation, please download the official strategic plan here.

Other ways to support the project:

Share this crowdfunding campaign with folks in your life who may be able to support this project

If you have any of the materials needed, or access to any of the herbs listed on the strategic plan, we would love to accept donations

During the summer when the project is up and running, volunteers who can educate about herbal healing and self care, attend events to represent the project, or help with collocating and distributing promotional materials will be very helpful. 

If you have a business, donating items for a silent auction will be very helpful and appreciated

Incentives:

For donations of $100 or more, you will receive a gift, including products made by both myself (rise up! good witch) and other herbalists and makers of wellness products.

story:
#AWARENESS


After 18-plus years of working as a
professional model for QVC and other outlets, my life and my health as I knew it ended. My last day there as a model, I fell to the ground while waiting to take before and after shots for a beauty show. I had what could only be described as a seizure. 
I felt poisoned, and in fact, I was poisoned. I had a toxic injury due to
environmental chemicals that ravaged my body and struck down my immune system.

I was horrifically introduced to a new world and generation of 21st century diseases that modern medicine hasn't yet had the pleasure to meet. A world where toxic chemicals, unsafe pharmaceuticals, and the lack of air regulation in our schools and work environments are now giving birth to health issues that are unrecognizeable to traditional medicine. Welcome to my life. I hope you never come for a visit.


An unbelievable journey of what it's like to live without an innate immune system.


 I became intolerant to everything one would typically take for granted. The ability to drive by elecrical wires, power plants, being able to eat without having to subject myself to daily allergy shots and expensive supplements, and even wearing the clothing I wanted, because of synthetic materials, dyes and fire retardants.

                                            

Yes, I reacted to clothing because of chemicals, dyes and fire retardants they're made with. My immune system was so shattered that I couldn’t even put a cell phone up to my ear without feeling sharp stabbing pains from the radiation it emitted. My body had lost its ability to protect me from environmental stimuli and irritants: A loss of tolerance. 


My goal with this funding campaign is to
finance help for my patient care at the Chung Institute of Integrative Medicine in
Moorestown, New Jersey. There I will work with doctors that have successfully
treated people with my injury. I will use funds to form a treatment plan to better my health. If I raise enough, I will move into a healthier and more controlled living environment that will help my health thrive. Secondly, I will continue to build and support bodybyearth.com, and bring awareness to all. 

 Bodybyearth, a much needed  business and career that will give me an opportunity to work in a safe  and controlled environment and keep me from relapses and setbacks. I purchased this domain years back after I personally experienced the negative impact  toxic chemicals in  beauty and skin care ingredients  had on my health. Bodybyearth.com is a shopping destination and educational website for
safer but effective product options, and provide you and consumers around the
world with real-life stories through video, photography, media and social
platforms, beginning with my own story of how I became injured and disabled. 


While most people were beginning to run away from me because of my injury and illness, one person actually ran towards me. It was the president and CEO of Mindseye Concepts, Matt Mondzelewski. He recognized my need to work in a safe environment and generously built bodybyearth.com and unscented.me in
support of my dream for a safe shopping destination. Most of all, he gave me hope at a time when I had none. He understood and believed in my dream of creating an online space where people can shop for safer products and learn all about the environmental injuries, illnesses and health impacts many consumer products, workplace and home environments are associated with and how they are impacting the health of many people not just in our country, but around the world.


I fought to be normal and perhaps was in denial about being able to do things outside of my present circumstances. I relapsed many times and had even more setbacks. Now, I am ready to embrace my restrictions and pursue my dream. I hope I am cured someday, but now it's time for me to get help and to focus and plan for a future to work safely from home. I believe this is my lifes calling: bodybyearth.com and unscented.me. 

Getting where I need to be health-wise may

take a village, and with your help, I believe I will reach my goal and
eventually live a healthier, happier life. My real job is to regain my health,
my true spirit and my energy, but my passion is for all of you. To share
everything that I have experienced and learned through my journey. I want you
and your children to have the knowledge that grew from a place of suffering and
ignorance. Most women, including myself, have blindly trusted many products
that we as consumers use every day without knowing what is truly in them.

My past daily ritual included many products and ingredients that can be harmful to one’s health. As I look for safer, effective product options for myself, know that I am also searching for all of your daughters, sons and the entire family. Know that what I find for myself, I also find for you.

My long-term goal is to help more people like myself and even more people like you to become aware. To help sensitive people that don’t even know they’re sensitive. People with chronic health conditions, autoimmune issues, cancer, and anyone really that may have no idea how their personal care, beauty and skincare could be impacting their present health situation. Help me live – help me to help you. Thank you for reading my story, and please share if you feel inspired to.


BE conscious

Always, Trina

While most people were beginning to run away from me because of my injury and illness, one person actually ran towards me. It was the president and CEO of Mindseye Concepts, Matt Mondzelewski. He recognized my need to work in a safe environment and generously built bodybyearth.com and unscented.me insupport of my dream for a safe shopping destination. Most of all, he gave me hope at a time when I had none. He understood and believed in my dream of creating an online space where people can shop for safer products and learn all about the environmental injuries, illnesses and health impacts many consumer products, workplace and home environments are associated with and how they are impacting the health of many people not just in our country, but around the world.
I fought to be normal and perhaps was in denial about being able to do things outside of my present circumstances. I relapsed many times and had even more setbacks. Now, I am ready to embrace my restrictions and pursue my dream. I hope I am cured someday, but now it's time for me to get help and to focus and plan for a future to work safely from home. I believe this is my lifes calling: bodybyearth.com and unscented.me. 
Getting where I need to be health-wise maytake a village, and with your help, I believe I will reach my goal andeventually live a healthier, happier life. My real job is to regain my health,my true spirit and my energy, but my passion is for all of you. To shareeverything that I have experienced and learned through my journey. I want youand your children to have the knowledge that grew from a place of suffering andignorance. Most women, including myself, have blindly trusted many productsthat we as consumers use every day without knowing what is truly in them.
My past daily ritual included many products and ingredients that can be harmful to one’s health. As I look for safer, effective product options for myself, know that I am also searching for all of your daughters, sons and the entire family. Know that what I find for myself, I also find for you.
My long-term goal is to help more people like myself and even more people like you to become aware. To help sensitive people that don’t even know they’re sensitive. People with chronic health conditions, autoimmune issues, cancer, and anyone really that may have no idea how their personal care, beauty and skincare could be impacting their present health situation. Help me live – help me to help you. Thank you for reading my story, and please share if you feel inspired to.



BE conscious
Always, Trina

story:
My actual expenses are not that high. I'll be taking the train to Poughkeepsie and then traveling, probably by taxi, to Fishkill from there. I just need enough to cover the train fare, the taxi, and the hotel. $550 will be perfectly sufficient. I have already raised $150 through prior donations, and I am incredibly grateful, however, I still need more to be able to afford the trip! 

I will be presenting on the topic: Polytheism for Contemporary America. My intention is to explore the foundations of Polytheism in experience, personal, indirect, and undisclosed, and then to sketch out the ramifications of adopting a Polytheistic worldview and how that impacts the Contemporary American lifestyle. If you think that this sounds interesting, I invite you to help support my work!

It is my intention to use this presentation as the foundation for a book on the same topic, much expanded. So, really, my attendance at the Polytheist Leadership Conference marks the beginning on an ongoing project.

Perks:

Among other things, I am also an artist, and I am offering my services as such for those who donate $75. I will create a hand drawn, custom devotional image of the God/Goddess/Divinity of your choice. I will be happy to work out the details on an individual basis.

story:
My Project

My name is Danielle Benjamin and I am a Black herbalist living and working in Northern California's Bay Area. I have been researching and creating medicine with plants, supporting the physiological and spiritual health of my two-year-old and our community for the past four years. It was through the experience of supporting my sister as her doula at my nephew's birth that I fully understood this was the right pivot for my work. I applied to Ancestral Apothecary's herbal medicine training program and was accepted!

In this 400 hour training, I will study with frontline herbal masters who are experts at the cutting edge of herbal medicine, and POC whose foundations as herbalists come from their own indigenous lineages with the plants. This is an incredible opportunity to train in the art, science & spirituality of herbal medicine from a decolonized lens.

I will initially be developing my personal body of work by adding to my line of herbal offerings for my family & community, and ultimately training to launch my own healing practice.

 

Why support my project?

While I've been awarded a partial scholarship for Cecemmana, this Indiegogo campaign will raise funds for the remaining cost of the program — including the instructional training and ancillary fees from the school. My goal is to raise $3,000 with your help.

$30 in support of this project will receive ETERNAL REWARDS FROM THE HEAVENS! and your choice of the following:

*A sweet, blissful herbal tea blend! You can brew it as a tea, sit back and sip sip, or add it to your bath and soak in the magic and medicine — both equally lovely experiences (created by me!)

*A beautiful aromatherapeutic bundle of herbs for smudging and sweetening the energy in your space! Made for the angels! (created by me!)

*A tarot or oracle reading with me! fun fun! (a $60-80 value, and something I'd quite honestly do for free — but we're fundraising here!)

 

Long Term Goals

The main goal for this project is to develop my personal body of work as an herbalist and to lay the groundwork to launch my own clinical healing practice. My vision is a storefront apothecary and sliding scale clinic.

I intend to offer affordable support for nourishing physical, mental and spiritual vibrancy in the Bay Area and beyond, all the more considering the cruelty and violence of our country's healthcare choices. As a Black woman, I am especially called to work with women of color and those at the intersections of the systemic diseases of racism and patriarchy.

I intend to:

  • make holistic wellness accessible to low income communities
  • engage ancestral medicine and ancient ways
  • facilitate optimal well-being using functional nutrition, herbal therapies and vibrational healing modalities

 

Unable to support monetarily? No problem!

If you are unable to support with a pledge, your voice is an even greater help! Liking and/or sharing my campaign will be an enormous aid in making my project come to fruition. Even sending a message of encouragement means more than you know :) 

Other sharables:

Instagram: @ummaluna @sweetsourcebotanicals

story:
Objective

Build a world-class 100-Bed Children’s Hospital, Super Surgical Hospital, and Medical Village in the United States.

Goal

To provide free world-class health care to children in the United States. This project combines the staple elements of total Family Care Services (FCS), incorporating the latest elements of Technology Innovation Green Renewable Energy (TIGRE™).

The Need

The KIEDC Kingdom Free Children’s Specialty Hospital Project (KKFCSH)was conceived in recognition of the fact that many children each year are underinsured or uninsured. Families are faced with impossible decisions about care for their children and maintaining a sense of normalcy. KKFCSH’s goal is to help families at zero cost to have access to medical treatment, housing, education, mental health, rehabilitation services while providing for the daily needs of taking care of the entire family unit.

Hospital Areas

The hospital building will comprise of 3 floors and 100 beds.

•The General Pediatric Floor (2nd and 3rd floors)

• First Floor Emergency Room

•First Floor Community Clinic

•Neo Natal Intensive Care Unit (NICU)

•Pediatric Intensive Care Unit (PICU)

•Surgical Specialty Suite

•Adolescent Center

•Autism Intervention Center

THE ASK

The estimated cost of implementing the KKFCSHP is $1.2 Billion

100-bed hospital @ $500K per hospital bed, utilizing Transmodular Hospital construction.

Implementation of advanced technology like Telemedicine, robotic, fuel cells and energy independence features, and Implement real-time Global Response Emergency Action Network (GREAN) Monitor™: Real-time monitoring system for Hospital Planning/Capacity/Capabilities System nationwide, and worldwide.

•Children’s Hospital Medical Village

•Startup costs

•Two-year budget, sustainment

•Cost of the family housing

story: In 2016 there were 11,594 homeless animals coming into Young-Williams Animal Center. Young Williams is a local animal shelter in Knoxville, Tennessee that has been helping end pet overpopulation since 2001. Their mission is to serve the community through innovative approaches to sheltering, adopting, the spaying/neutering of animals and public education about animal welfare. Not only does Young Williams take in homeless animals to help control overpopulation, they also offer various training sessions for pets and aid to the injured. After reading that there were 11,594 homeless animals that came into the center in 2016, my classmates and I were greatly moved and impacted. This is one of the main reasons we have decided to support their organization. My classmates and I are all students at the University of Tennessee who have a passion and love for animals and their wellbeing. In choosing Young-Williams we hope to raise $1000. By donating to our campaign you are helping us buy the items the shelter has shared are the most pressing needs. Whether it is through spreading the word of our project to those with generous interest or donating any amount directly to our campaign, we are grateful and appreciative of any contribution.

story:
Kocoono™ takes the original concept of a weighted blanket and improves on it in every capacity with its patent pending design including fully customizable weight, unique shoulder embrace and much more! 

You can add or remove the weights to suit you needs and place one in the freezer and reinsert back into the blanket to keep you cool at night (if thats how you roll!!). With the unique shoulder embrace you are able to get the deep touch pressure up around your shoulders to reduce the tension where you need it most. 

Kocoono™ uses Deep Touch Pressure Therapy to stimulate pressure points in the body. This helps to reduce cortisol levels associated with stress, and in turn increase dopamine and serotonin, our "happy chemicals". 

Kocoono™ is a natural self-soothing tool that helps users to have improved quality sleep, mood and relaxation, which in turn can have other overall health benefits.

Other blankets have a set weight and cannot be changed. With Kocoono™ you can alter the weight to your exact liking.   Or if the blanket is for a child, it can grow with your child,  which saves you buying a new blanket every few years!

In order to stay cool in summer you can place the weighted  strips in the freezer and reinsert back onto your Kocoono™.  This is also applicable for people with a sports injury, or anyone  experiencing hot flushes or for those that sleep hot.

Just remove the weight strips and throw the outer blanket in the washing machine, just like a regular blanket!

We used 33% up-cycled material and non toxic glass beads.  Also, since the weight can be adjusted the blanket grows with you! No need to buy a new one.

One side of the blanket is made from a soft fleecy material designed  to keep you warm on even the coldest winter night. The  other side is made from cotton and is designed to cool you down in the summertime.

All of our Kocoono™ blankets are designed and ethically manufactured in Europe using the highest quality materials available.

 

#

Kocoono™ Wellness Toolbox is designed to strengthen your mind and increase focus and mental well-being in your day to day life.

It is typically recommended that a weighted  blanket is 10% of a persons body weight. Thats why we have a range of Kocoono™ weights to suit everyone. See the charts above to find the one for you! All of our blankets measure 195 x 110 cm.

Kocoono™ originated in 2011 after I designed a weighted blanket for a child with Autism. My mother is a dress maker, so I had all the materials that I needed. The colors were chosen due to extensive market research on their calming qualities. We chose fleece for one side so that people can feel a sense of cosy comfort, and cotton on the other side to keep people cool in summer.

 

All graphic design, web design and video production for Kocoono™ by Unbound Media Galway, Ireland.


 

Health Disclaimer: Kocoono™ does not claim to be a cure for any medical or mental condition or disorder. It is designed only to be used as an aid which can be used to help with sleep and stress.

Shipping disclaimer: Some international orders may be subject to import taxes, customs duties, and/or fees imposed by the destination country. You are responsible with ensuring to comply with laws and regulations of the country of destination

Risks and challenges

As myself and the team have designed, prototyped and constructed Kocoono™ ourselves with love, care and attention to detail we know the standard and quality that we want to provide our supportive backers.

We have communicated this to our manufactures and we will have boots on the ground to oversee the quality of all Kocoono™blankets and products being delivered to our backers. Your Kocoono™ blanket is ethically produced in Europe and we feel very confident about the quality and quantity we are able to deliver.

We have limited the number we can produce before Christmas to ensure our early bird backers are snuggled up in time for the holiday season.

story:
Keep the Scottish brand!

The big supermarkets in the UK (notably Tescos) have recently been replacing the Saltire on Scottish produce with a standard British (union) flag. With Brexit under way, this is perhaps understandable.

BUT...

Scottish produce has a global and growing reputation for quality and environmental standards. The Scottish Government has banned GM crops and fracking, further enhancing Scotland's reputation for quality and purity.

Replacing the Scottish branding with a British flag is likely to undermine sales of Scottish produce rather than enhancing them!

It's important that Scottish produce is clearly labelled with its origins to maintain its market-leading reputation.

 

Who are we?

ayeMail is a not-for-profit organisation that promotes Scotland and the case for Scottish independence (although the latter is not part of this campaign). We exist to help other organisations campaign in Scotland's interests.

 

What We Need

We want to print and distribute 100,000+ leaflets/flyers raising awareness of the quality and reputation of Scottish food. This is about maintaining the sales of our fish, beef, lamb, strawberries, potatoes, haggis, black pudding, whisky, gin, oatcakes, teacakes... and every other food & drink product made or grown in Scotland.

The leaflets will be professionally designed and explain why it is so critically important to support our farmers and other businesses by keeping the Scottish Brand on our produce. The call to action on the leaflets will be to contact the supermarkets and ask them to reinstate (or in some cases keep) the Scottish branding on Scottish produce.

Distributing these leaflets in the last couple of weeks before Christmas will have the biggest impact as people are shopping for festive food and drink.

To be absolutely clear, we are NOT asking people to "boycott" produce with the British flag or produce originated elsewhere in the UK - and nor should we. This is purely about getting the supermarkets to keep the Scottish Brand on Scottish produce.

 

Is this about independence?

No. This issue transcends the constitutional question. This is about defending and supporting our food and drink industry at a time when it is already threatened by Brexit. It is crucial to protect Scotland's reputation for food and drink excellence if we are to protect jobs and exports.

A recent Bank of Scotland survey revealed that 67% of Scottish food and drink companies had changed their recruitment plans as a result of Brexit.

 

Delivery

The National Yes Registry has established a network of Yes groups across Scotland, so we can use that to spread word, and we'll use the usual social media channels to raise broader public awareness.

The cartons of printed leaflets will be available for anybody to "purchase" (shipping costs only) through the ayeMail.scot store.

We're crowdfunding for the printing of the leaflets only. To actually deliver them, we'll have to ask groups and individuals to pay for the postage/courier fees (these will be nominal amounts compared to the value of leaflets shipped).

We'd like to distribute everything for free, but we don't think that it's right to crowdfund payments to couriers and/or the Post Office. We prefer every penny of donations to go to actual leaflet production. Since they get the leaflets for free, we think it's only fair to ask recipients to cover the postage.

Our time and effort is already covered. We're in this to help Scotland, not to make a profit, so you are funding the leaflet printing only. There are no staff costs and no profit margins to cover.

 

Perks

There is one perk level where we'll send you 100 leaflets via post. After the ~10% crowdfunding fees, the bulk of the £15 goes to getting the leaflets mass-printed, with £2 covering the physical postage. Obviously, if you can spare a few quid more, that will help us towards our target!

Once the leaflets are printed, they will be available to everybody.

story:
You can watch the renovation process here :



About us

Our studio offers classes in Yoga, Pilates, Dancing, Healthy Bodymind practices and therapeutic massages. We have a small and committed team of certified and experienced instructors and massagists. We are the FIRST AND ONLY ONE STUDIO WITH ENGLISH CLASSES in Kyiv, Ukraine.

We help expatriates to integrate smoothly into an unknown culture, find friends and support. Also, local people can make international friends and improve their English.

We are the intercultural bridge between post-soviet country and another world as well as we help people to connect with themselves.

Our current website is http://kiev-yoga.com/

FOUNDERS

Lena Zhuravlova Gueulet, the experienced (over 5 yrs) and internationally certified yoga instructor, MD in Economics.
Iryna Kuksa, the experienced (over 4 yrs) sound yoga instructor, MD in Engineering.
 

Studio space creation campaign

After long months of search, negotiations, and estimations we finally found a dream studio space:
148 sqm, in the heart of Kyiv, near the Botanic garden.



The only thing that remains is to make it ready for our activities.
The total renovation budget is about 5000 USD, and basic equipment is about 1500 USD.

WE NEED YOUR HELP TO FINANCE THE PART OF THE EXPENSES TO LAUNCH THE STUDIO!



What We Need & What You Get
 

YOU CAN DONATE ANY AMOUNT,
JUST CLICKING ON THE PINK BUTTON [BACK IT!] ON THE TOP.

According to our renovation plan, we need:
Works:
walls removal,
doors replacement,
electrical works,
new walls building,
floor installation,
walls painting,
lighting,
tea spot setting-up

Equipment:
lockers and banks for changing rooms,
tea spot sitting place,
massage table,
chairs 20 pieces,

We have a small and committed team of certified and experienced instructors and massagists. We are the FIRST AND ONLY ONE STUDIO WITH ENGLISH CLASSES in Kyiv, Ukraine.We help expatriates to integrate smoothly into an unknown culture, find friends and support. Also, local people can make international friends and improve their English.We are the intercultural bridge between post-soviet country and another world as well as we help people to connect with themselves.Our current website is http://kiev-yoga.com/FOUNDERSLena Zhuravlova Gueulet, the experienced (over 5 yrs) and internationally certified yoga instructor, MD in Economics.Iryna Kuksa, the experienced (over 4 yrs) sound yoga instructor, MD in Engineering.

story:
Story of My Book

With Firmness of Mind: A collection of advice from professional psychologists on how young members of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints can use the study of human happiness to live happier lives. 

*100% of the book's profits will be donated to nonprofit organizations including The National Alliance on Mental Illness, The American Foundation for Suicide Prevention, and Latter-day Saint Charities.

My name is Ian Kahng and I am the author of With Firmness of Mind. I wrote this book because I want to share specialized advice from positive psychology experts to help young church members live truly happy lives among the unique challenges we face today.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover there are many ways you can improve your mental wellbeing using the science of happiness. My hope is you will become inspired by the stories of other young people overcoming challenges and living happier lives by making mental wellbeing part of their regular routine. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you live a happier life as well.

In this book, you'll learn there are myths about what makes us happy, and there are simple ways to work on your wellbeing:

  • identifying areas where you can improve the way you think

  • positively changing the structure of your brain through certain activities

  • learning advice from psychologists who specialize in working with challenges young LDS members face

Every young person will benefit from this book, whether you are content but trying to live an even happier life, or if you are struggling with challenges and trying to get on solid ground.

With Firmness of Mind is a nonfiction book that speaks to young members of the church who are looking at improving their mental wellbeing from the perspective of the science of positive psychology.

 

The Book - With Firmness of Mind


The book is written in 3 parts:

Part 1 contains the introduction and a guide on how to use the book. You will learn that many people follow myths about happiness, and that science shows you can improve your happiness by focusing less on changing your circumstances and focusing more on changing your thinking. You will learn about how to change the structure of your brain using the science of neuroplasticity, and create a plan on how to implement specific activities in your life.

Part 2 contains Chapters 2-5, which provide activities to improve your happiness and mental wellbeing in four different spheres of influence in your life. The first sphere is changing your brain through healthily managing your thoughts. The second sphere is supporting mental wellbeing through working on your body to maximize production of mood-boosting chemicals. The third sphere relates to your immediate relationships, which benefit both the happiness of yourself and your loved ones. The fourth sphere covers the community sphere, which discusses how you can overcome challenges that your community (church, school, group, etc.) presents you and use your community to both improve your mental wellbeing and help others in your community.

Part 3 contains the conclusion, which will help you tie all you learned together into a regular routine, and further sources to consult for more expert advice.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

 

As I mentioned earlier, 100% of the book's profits will be donated to nonprofit organizations including The National Alliance on Mental Illness, The American Foundation for Suicide Prevention, and Latter-day Saint Charities.


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020.
  • The cover design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, eBook formats)
  • The copyediting for my book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The launch and promotion efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Fall

 

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I presell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I presell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who preorder my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for preordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a special acknowledgements section of my book (“With Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to be a beta tester and be involved in selecting my cover
  • Participation in a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author


Ian Kahng grew up in the Seattle area, and did his undergrad at BYU where he first developed his passion for positive psychology. In addition to taking six courses on positive psychology, Ian also has been featured as a panelist and speaker on mental wellness and self improvement related topics.

Ian went on his two year LDS mission in New Jersey. He is currently employed at McKinsey and Company as a management consultant and is also working with Positive Voices, a startup focused on helping people increase happiness and find meaning in their lives.

In his spare time, Ian loves spending time with his family and friends. He can be found outside fishing, hiking, rock climbing, or attempting to play basketball. He also spends lots of time in the kitchen either trying new recipes or eating leftovers.

This is Ian’s first book.

For more information you can connect with Ian at iankahng@gmail.com and www.iankahng.com

 

Risks & Challenges

 

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #withfirmnessofmind and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Ian Kahng

story:
OUR STORY:

We are Cherryl and Armen, long-time friends who are like two peas in a pod. We started our personal development journey together, and have embraced the ideas of self-awareness, mindfulness, the concepts of quantum physics and the law of attraction. We were inspired after encountering a store cashier with an infectious zest for life and desire to spread cheer. A simple thought came to mind: what can we do to make happiness contagious – to make the world a better, more joyful place? The initial thought was to create handmade, specialized cards with positive phrases to hand out to people. Then, we thought bigger. Like, really big! That’s when POSITOOT was born.

 

WHAT IS POSITOOT?

More times than not, a person just needs a pat on the back, or a simple high-5 to enrich their spirit. That’s where POSITOOT  comes in, with 100% positive content. The name is a combination of “posi-,” short for “positive” + “toot,” as in helping someone toot their horn. With thousands of special messages to choose from, you can send a TOOT and make an immediate impact.

Need a change of pace? Hop on over and start TOOTing. Want to tell someone you’re proud of them? Send them a TOOT. Want to send someone starting their own business an encouraging message? Or provide someone battling an illness with a message of compassion? TOOT, TOOT, TOOT! All it takes is a couple of clicks and a desire to make someone smile.

Just imagine: by contributing to POSITOOT, you can help create a beautiful domino effect, with people everywhere paying positivity forward. All in hopes of creating true tranquility in this world. World peace from an app? Well, we live in a world of infinite possibilities – so, why not?

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

We’re very excited to have raised the funds necessary to complete the application design as part of Phase 1. We’re now ready to proceed with Phase 2, which is to create the application and administrative functionalities. As Phase 2 is wrapping up, we will move our focus to Phase 3, which is to grow our brand and community.

We require funds totaling $40,000, broken down as follows:

Phase 2: Functionality - $31,000

  • Phase 2a: Build application functionality - $17,000
  • Phase 2b: Build administrative functionality - $14,000

Phase 3: Brand recognition and marketing - $9,000

Every contribution counts, so in the event we do not reach our goal, we will still proceed with the development of the application with what we have raised. We believe in the positive impact our application will make on the world and know the remainder of the funds will present itself in due time.

PERKS! PERKS! PERKS!

Our application is all about giving. We are honored to receive any contribution amount and would love to show our gratitude with these perks:

  1. Add your personal TOOT to our inventory
  2. Start at a higher point-level and title
  3. We will add your name to the wall of “People That Made It Happen” on our app

MARKET TRENDS

Social media plays a direct role in our culture today. In fact, 42% of Generation Z says social media impacts how they feel about themselves. Even more alarming, 37% say social media has a direct impact on their happiness. While the popular platforms have billions of users and provide value when it comes to connecting, advertising, and new trends, a major point is being ignored here: the impact of negativity on our overall well-being, something those platforms just cannot avoid.

Data suggests 62% of missed workdays are due to mental health reasons, and that 69% of employees hide their condition out of fear or shame. Thankfully, individuals and businesses have begun to place a huge emphasis on mental wellness. In 2018, Apple named “self-care” its application trend of the year. But the gap between social networking and well-being continues to grow, and competitors have not addressed the impact this is having on our society. POSITOOT is aiming to bridge that gap.

RISKS & CHALLENGES

There are so many apps to choose from, and trying to launch a global social development platform is no easy task. The popular apps have a large share of the market. But we are not looking to take away market share; we are transforming and expanding the market. The number of social media accounts per person continues to increase each year and the time spent on a social media app has reached nearly 2.5 hours a day. We believe what we have to offer will expand the market through:

  • Purely positive content
    • TOOTs
    • Videos
    • Podcasts
    • Blogs
    • Inspirational content
  • Hybrid application
    • A social development app incorporating personal development
  • User engagement with the application
    • Suggest TOOTs
    • Suggest affirmations
    • Game-type approach
    • Complete surveys for new functionality
    • Become a member of the administrative team
  • Incentivized Approach
    • Utilize points, titles, and rewards.
    • Track the impact
    • Milestones for personal accomplishments

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Contributions are not only about money. We would love for everyone to download our app and starting TOOTing. Share with others you believe will benefit from the positivity. Join our community and help expand our cause to bring more smiles and happiness to people’s lives.

story:
Dear Friends,

Thank you for all support and help so far. Thank you for following us at our journey to the real home.

We have to focus first to settle down at the Park or at close friendly space, as we lost the beautiful farm we use to lease last three years. 

We hope that you will choose to be part of SPIRIT’s miracle and to make this happen. With your donation, you are supporting a great cause and will provide a future for a life-changing program in our community.

Our crowdfunding project now is dedicated to the expenses related to moving into the Park - purchasing new barns, tractor, truck, trailer.
Please share our story with your friends and family and continue to create a future for the SPIRIT Mission.

Thank you to everyone who has supported SPIRIT and our Home for SPIRIT Campaign.  Together, we can continue to provide healing and growth in our community!

 

Spirit Open Equestrian Program, Inc.  

 

 

About SPIRIT

 

 

SPIRIT provides therapy, learning and improvement of life skills healing of the body, mind and spirit - using Equine-Assisted Activities.

 

SPIRIT has the power to change and improve the community by serving those with special needs as a much-needed source of therapeutic activities. The longer-term impact of SPIRIT is that it can help to improve basic life skills for youth populations and young adults.
 

Horses used in therapy provide healing processes. Human interaction with them, as created by a well-trained and skilled instructor or therapist, can change the quality of life of the participant and his/her family. Raising generations of young people with a strong sense of respect, compassion, self-esteem, responsibility and good leadership skills are just a few of the benefits derived from the therapeutic service of horses.

Our vision is to create a unique model for Equine Assisted Activities - therapies and education in urban areas such as the one we serve currently.

 

 

SPIRIT is a young but strong organization.  All our horses have been adopted from auctions or were generously and kindly donated to the program. 

We serve our community with over 3,000 lesson-hours a year. Our program has been supported by many volunteers who have given over 10,000 yearly volunteer hours to the program. 
 

In case we are unable to raise enough funds to cover a down payment for the purchase of the farm the funds can and will  be used to help SPIRIT to cover any future renting fees and relocation costs that might be incurred should we lose the lease on the farm land we currently occupy. 

How You Can Help
  • Advocate to preserve our service in Fairfax County :)
  • Donor contributions to SPIRIT OEP - P.O. box 1342, Great Falls, VA 22066, online at www.spiritequestrian.org or here all welcomed and greatly appreciated 
  • If you cannot contribute money, please share our story and help us to reach those who can and want to support this good cause.  
  • Email us directly with your ideas and suggestions at spiritoep@gmail.com 
  • Go ahead and use the Indiegogo share tools! 

 

 

About myself and my background:

 

  • I am Davorka Suvak "Dada" - Founder and Program Director of SPIRIT.  I came from Croatia 10 years ago and was fortunate to be able to continue my life's dream of building a SPIRIT program here in the United States.
  • Working over 20 years in the nonprofit field, I can say that my life has been dedicated to the mission of developing SPIRIT, an Equine Assisted Activity program.
  • My life experience is from Croatia.  With the help of many great people, we started an Equine Assisted Activity program in the Balkan area, the first SPIRIT. I led a Para Equestrian National Team to the highest international level, from World Championships to the Para Olympics. I am in the process of establishing the program's educational requirements and official industry standards for Equine Assisted Activities.
  • My reward comes from witnessing the power of horses to heal and teach, to help youth in this urban area learn better life skills and to improve the quality of life for seniors with dementia and their caregivers.
  • SPIRIT is my dream and Life Mission. 
  • So many wonderful people have helped SPIRIT to evolve and grow over the years, to be recognized for what it is now- a valued and necessary contribution to the well-being of this community. Now is our best chance to provide a long- term home for SPIRIT which will preserve farmland in our area and provide an opportunity for generations to come to heal, grow and learn with horses.

About SPIRIT
 
 
SPIRIT provides therapy, learning and improvement of life skills healing of the body, mind and spirit - using Equine-Assisted Activities.
 



SPIRIT has the power to change and improve the community by serving those with special needs as a much-needed source of therapeutic activities. The longer-term impact of SPIRIT is that it can help to improve basic life skills for youth populations and young adults. Horses used in therapy provide healing processes. Human interaction with them, as created by a well-trained and skilled instructor or therapist, can change the quality of life of the participant and his/her family. Raising generations of young people with a strong sense of respect, compassion, self-esteem, responsibility and good leadership skills are just a few of the benefits derived from the therapeutic service of horses.Our vision is to create a unique model for Equine Assisted Activities - therapies and education in urban areas such as the one we serve currently.



  
SPIRIT is a young but strong organization.  All our horses have been adopted from auctions or were generously and kindly donated to the program. 

We serve our community with over 3,000 lesson-hours a year. Our program has been supported by many volunteers who have given over 10,000 yearly volunteer hours to the program. 
 


In case we are unable to raise enough funds to cover a down payment for the purchase of the farm the funds can and will  be used to help SPIRIT to cover any future renting fees and relocation costs that might be incurred should we lose the lease on the farm land we currently occupy. 
How You Can Help


Advocate to preserve our service in Fairfax County :)
Donor contributions to SPIRIT OEP - P.O. box 1342, Great Falls, VA 22066, online at www.spiritequestrian.org or here all welcomed and greatly appreciated 
If you cannot contribute money, please share our story and help us to reach those who can and want to support this good cause.  
Email us directly with your ideas and suggestions at spiritoep@gmail.com 
Go ahead and use the Indiegogo share tools! 

  About myself and my background: 
I am Davorka Suvak "Dada" - Founder and Program Director of SPIRIT.  I came from Croatia 10 years ago and was fortunate to be able to continue my life's dream of building a SPIRIT program here in the United States. 

Working over 20 years in the nonprofit field, I can say that my life has been dedicated to the mission of developing SPIRIT, an Equine Assisted Activity program.
My life experience is from Croatia.  With the help of many great people, we started an Equine Assisted Activity program in the Balkan area, the first SPIRIT. I led a Para Equestrian National Team to the highest international level, from World Championships to the Para Olympics. I am in the process of establishing the program's educational requirements and official industry standards for Equine Assisted Activities.
My reward comes from witnessing the power of horses to heal and teach, to help youth in this urban area learn better life skills and to improve the quality of life for seniors with dementia and their caregivers.
SPIRIT is my dream and Life Mission. 
So many wonderful people have helped SPIRIT to evolve and grow over the years, to be recognized for what it is now- a valued and necessary contribution to the well-being of this community. Now is our best chance to provide a long- term home for SPIRIT which will preserve farmland in our area and provide an opportunity for generations to come to heal, grow and learn with horses.

story:
Help make SoCal's first cat lounge a wonderful place!

By contributing to our campaign, you not only help LA/OC's homeless cats but yourself too. ZenCat Lounge is about personal connections - the kind you build with feline companions and the kind you build with yourself. We give cats a better place to live while awaiting their forever home and give you an opportunity to relax, escape from the stress of your life for an hour, and get in touch with what really matters. At ZenCat Lounge you can take some time for yourself to listen to music, participate in guided or solo meditation, play with a cat or two, and give love to animals in need. Anyone who's ever held a purring kitty or watched a cat pounce on an unsuspecting toy mouse knows the unique joy cats bring to our lives. We want to give our community an opportunity to share that joy. Contribute today to support a space strongly needed by homeless cats and those of you with love to give.

Why we need YOU

The more money we raise, the better environment we can build and the sooner we can bring it to life! Your contributions will allow us to:

  • Turn blank walls into catification masterpieces with shelves, ramps, and mini gardens
  • Upgrade from Ikea furniture to much more comfortable pieces for you
  • Build luxurious cat towers so our cats can get plenty of exercise
  • Provide the best toys to stimulate our cats' minds
  • Rent the perfect space with enough room to house our goal of 20 cats plus cozy nooks for reading and meditating

How we benefit our community

  • Shelter cat population: We will be a foster home for cats from a local shelter, which allows the shelter to save more cats and gives the cats we house a healthier environment to live in while waiting to be adopted, along with a better chance to find their forever home. The more humans they get to interact with, the friendlier they become, which makes them more likely to be adopted. And if you're looking to add a feline friend to your family, we provide a relaxed, no-pressure environment to get to know available cats and see their personalities in action so you can find the one that's the "purrfect" fit for you! 
  • Cat lovers unable to have their own cat: Get your kitty fix by spending time with ours.
  • Everyone: Several studies have shown the health benefits that spending time and building relationships with animals has on blood pressure, stress, and mental health.

How it works

The health and well-being of our foster cats is our primary concern. Our cats will be allowed to roam the lounge freely and will always have access to food, water, and litter boxes. To avoid overwhelming them with crowds, we'll use an online reservation system and walk-ins will only be accepted if there are open reservations. Not being a cafe means we must charge a cover fee to enter the lounge. This will be our primary source of funding to pay for the cats' needs and keeping the doors open, but we anticipate additional income from special events and classes as well as offering a small, curated selection of cat products for sale.

 

Other ways you can help

Please spread the word about ZenCat Lounge! Use Indiegogo's share tools and follow us on Twitter and Instagram.

story:
About the Shamiri Program

The Shamiri Wellness Program is a low-cost, evidence-based intervention for adolescent depression and anxiety. To overcome stigma, it uses positive psychological principles. To overcome resource limitations, it uses lay-providers (local high-school graduates) and is held in schools. 

What’s the evidence that the Shamiri Program works?

Last year, we tested the Shamiri Wellness Program with students in Kibera, the largest slum in Africa. When compared to a study-skills control group, the Shamiri Wellness Program:

  • Significantly reduced depression and anxiety symptoms.
  • Significantly improved academic performance.
  • Significantly improved social support from friendships. 

Why give to Shamiri?

Adolescent depression and anxiety are globally prevalent and harmful. In Kenya, young people face limited treatment options (there are fewer than 30 psychiatrists in Kenya) and significant social stigma. Most psychological disorders begin during adolescence and influence future life outcomes including income and physical health. 

Why are we raising money?

This summer, we are testing an enhanced Shamiri Program with about 450 students in Kenya. This trial will allow us to: 

  • Evaluate the efficacy of a low-cost, easily accessible depression and anxiety treatment for kids who really need it.
  • Figure out for whom and under what circumstances the treatment works best.
  • Develop strong local relationships with schools, educators, students, and clinicians in Kenya.

 

More about the program:

The main concepts of Shamiri are:

Growth: We target theories about the ability to improve over time, teaching students that personality traits, skills, and situations can be improved through effort and strategies.

Gratitude : Grateful people exhibit more positive experiences and outcomes. Students in the Shamiri program learn about gratitude and practice gratitude exercises.

Values and virtues : We work with students to identify and reflect on specific values that are most important to them. Such a self-reflection can improve individual coping skills by reestablishing an awareness of personal worth, goals, and integrity. 

Students participating in the program meet every week for four-weeks. The one-hour group sessions are led by trained peers who act as lay-providers. 

About the Shamiri Institute

The mission of the Shamiri Institute is to develop and deploy evidence-based interventions that improve the health, wellness, social, and academic outcomes of children and adolescents in East Africa. We envision extending our mission to Sub-Saharan Africa and similar regions around the world in the coming years. We seek to support research on, development of, and implementation of projects that can improve life outcomes for the economically disadvantaged. For more, visit: http://shamiri.institute/
