story:
Help is required to finance me during the time it will take to complete this video based program offered for free for anxiety sufferers world wide.

I believe this is the only program of its kind that will offer you a complete in depth understanding of what anxiety disorder is and how to cure it and lead a normal life again. 

As a recovered sufferer i have funded the start of this program myself and it is my passion to complete this Video based anxiety program over the next 3 months and then offer it for free worldwide so every sufferer can have access to all of the required information  without financial concern. 

Other anxiety programs to date in my opinion can only take you so far and hold back vital information of the understanding of exactly what causes anxiety and how we can break the cycle of the horrific physical symptoms that are caused by the condition.

story:
During my time as a Teach For America corps member in Miami, I often grew frustrated with my the obstacles hindering my class' performance.

I was brainstorming with a friend and my main observations were that my students were tired, lacking focus, and irritable. My friend's response of "they sound hungry" was the moment I realized the biological roadblock these teenagers faced everyday on their way to learning.

B&G Smoothies was created with the primary objective of providing a nutritious breakfast option to students living in communities with limited access to healthy food.

By providing all-natural, healthy breakfast smoothies designed by a certified nutritionist, we can help kids receive their vitamins, nutrients, and a fair chance at learning!

This summer, we launched our mobile smoothie operation licensed in the state of Florida with the purpose of spreading awareness, raising funds for our project, and bringing healthy options to food deserts in Miami.

We are asking for your support and seeking to raise a minimum of $1000 which will allow us to increase our mobility and outreach, to be distributed as follows:

which will be distributed as follows:

$500 - Generator : Currently we are restricted to renting space at a farmers market, or a local business plaza. A Generator increases our mobility and  allows us to pop-up anywhere, giving us better access to attack food deserts and reach everyone.

$100- Signage: Right now we have one large sign, but need a backdrop for our menu, as well as a few signs to make our mobile operation noticeable from a distance. 

$150 - Sturdy Tent: Living in south Florida, either the sun is out, or the rain is... Sometimes both! A canopy will help attract customers, while also protecting us from the elements. 

$150 - Ingredients and Supplies.

$100 - Taxes & Fees.

As you are reading this, we are LIVE and ON THE STREETS of Miami!

Check us out at

www.smoothies4students.com

www.facebook.com/smoothies4students

Instagram: @smoothies4students

story:
* This campaign has finished, but if you wish to DONATE, please write to us at: indiegogo@ibizaenlightfestival.com

ASKING MAKES US VULNERABLE

For years many of us have struggled with the idea that spirituality had to be ‘free’ and called out to the spiritual teachers of the world to either live a life of scarcity; live off their families; or get a job!

“Many years ago, a man who came to my free classes came up to me and stretched out a bill. I said, no thank you. My classes are free. (I had a job).  He looked at me in dismay and sadness and said: ‘You have given me so much and I want to give you back.  I only have money. You have no right to deprive me of the happiness of giving what I have.’  I still didn´t take his money. I had doubts, fear, guilt.  It took years for me to learn this lesson. TO GIVE IS TO RECEIVE.  Thanks to all of you who have allowed me to give and to received. God blesses you all. (ACIM Teacher)

Today, more than asking  …. We are inviting you to participate in our campaign:  

“BRINGING THE TEACHERS”.

Please watch the inspiring video below and Keep on Reading for the ‘HOW’ you can help.

 

* Esta campaña ha concluido, pero si quiere DONAR, por favor escríbenos a indiegogo@ibizaenlightfestival.com

PEDIR NOS HACE VULNERABLES

Durante años, muchos de nosotros luchamos con la idea de que la espiritualidad tenía que ser ‘gratis’ y le pedíamos a los maestros espirituales del mundo que vivieran en escasez; vivieran de sus familias; o se buscaran un empleo!

“Hace años, un hombre que venía a mis clases gratuitas se me acercó y me alargó un billete- Le dije, no gracias. Mis clases son gratis. (Yo tenía un empleo). Me miró con sorpresa y tristeza y me dijo: ‘Me has dado tanto y quiero darte yo. Sólo tengo dinero. No tienes el derecho de privarme de la felicidad de dar lo que tengo.’ Aún así no tomé su dinero. Tenía dudas, miedo, culpa.  Me llevó años aprender esta lección.  DAR ES RECIBIR.  Gracias a todos los que me han permitido dar y recibir.  Dios bendice a todos. (Maestro de UCDM) 

Hoy, más que pedirte …. Queremos invitarte a participar de nuestro proyecto:

“TRAYENDO LOS MAESTROS”

Por favor mira el vídeo inspirador de abajo y SIGUE LEYENDO para descubrir CÓMO puedes ayudar.


 VIDEO  INSPIRATION

       (in English with Spanish subtitles  / En Inglés, subtitulado al español)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=qaxBckKyp80#

MEET OUR TEACHERS !   CONOCE LOS MAESTROS

     Celebrate A Course in Miracles    Celebra Un Curso de Milagros

                                 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-H95Mx1KEY4

                                        

                        www.ibizaenlightfestival.com 

 

It's a time of a special celebration!

01 - 06 OCTOBER, 2013

Honoring A Course in Miracles

Es tiempo de una celebración especial!

      01 - 06 OCTUBRE, 2013

Honrando Un Curso de Milagros

 

This event celebrates having A COURSE IN MIRACLES and is open to everyone: teachers, students, and people who wish to discover The Course in a celebration in which to teach and to learn are resources to JOIN beyond our apparent differences. We will meet for a week of happiness, with workshops, gatherings and activities aimed at reinforcing the Lessons of Love, knowning that every teacher has his own course, thus everything is well when the purpose is to Join and not to separate.

 

Este evento celebra que tenemos UN CURSO de MILAGROS y estamos abiertos a todos: maestros, estudiantes y personas que deseen conocerlo en esta celebración, en la que aprender y enseñar son recursos para REUNIRNOS más allá de nuestras aparentes diferencias, y encontrarnos en unas jornadas de  felicidad en las que los talleres, charlas y actividades tienen como objetivo compartir y reforzar las Lecciones del Amor, sabiendo que cada maestro tiene su propio curso, por lo tanto todo está bien cuando el propósito es Unir y no separar.

"Thanks to Indiegogo and your financial support we will be able to purchase the airplane tickets for all the teachers from their countries of origin to Ibiza and also finance the creation of our website and other initial expenses.”                        THANK YOU SO MUCH!

 

"Gracias a Indiegogo y a tu apoyo financiero podremos pagar los billetes de avión de los maestros desde sus países de origen hasta Ibiza y también financiar la creación de nuestra web y otros gastos inciales."   MUCHAS GRACIAS!

THIS IS US!                               ESTOS SOMOS !

HEALING IS A JOINT VENTURE. 

We are but three, who have joined as One to respond to the calling of Love. IBIZA ENLIGHT, is a not-for-profit  association of recent creation by Carolina Corada, Steve Thompson and Salvador Rodriguez, whose ultimate goal is to share A Course in Miracles in diverse ‘forms’ and –in Spanish and English- to join more and more, trascending the forms that ‘apparently’ separate us.

 

LA SANACIÓN ES UNA EMPRESA DE COLABORACIÓN.

  Somos tres, que nos hemos unido como Uno para responder a la llamada del Amor.   IBIZA ENLIGHT, es una Asociación de reciente creación sin ánimo de lucro, ideada por Carolina Corada, Steve Thompson y Salvador Rodríguez, con la finalidad de compartir Un Curso de Milagros de diversas ‘formas’ -en español e inglés- uniéndonos cada vez más y trascendiendo las formas que ‘aparentemente’ nos distancian.

CLICK to learn more about us in English

http://ibizaenlightfestival.com/en/the-happy-dreamers/

OUR GOAL

We are committed to bringing to Ibiza our 16 A Course in Miracles teachers and perhaps a few more with your help, from Canada, Argentina, Venezuela, USA, Germany, Spain, and Sweden.  We want to pay all of their expenses, and need your collaboration specifically for the airplane tickets.  We wish to share these love-struck teachers for everyone to enjoy their shared light.

 

NUESTRA META

Estamos comprometidos con lograr traer a Ibiza a nuestros 16 maestros invitados de Un Curso de Milagros y quizás algunos más con tu colaboración, provenientes de Canada, Argentina, Venezuela, USA, Alemania, España y Suecia, pagándoles todos sus gastos. Necesitamos tu colaboración específicamente para los billetes de avión. Queremos compartir  a estos maestros tocados por el amor con todos y disfrutar de  Su Luz compartida.   

PINCHA AQUÍ para decubrir más sobre nosotros en Español

http://ibizaenlightfestival.es/the-happy-dreamers/

 

HOW ARE WE GOING TO INVEST YOUR CONTRIBUTION?

All the funds collected will be destined to the payment of airfares of the teachers invited to participate in the Festival and who will be travelling from diverse locations; we will also invest in the payment of our website and its updates as well as in the initial costs of the organization, such as logo design, video, registration of the association.

We would like to invite a few more teachers.  It will depend on you.  Send us your teacher suggestions!

 

¿EN QUÉ VAMOS A EMPLEAR TU CONTRIBUCIÓN?

Todo el dinero recaudado se destinará para pagar los viajes de los maestros que participarán en el festival y que se desplazarán desde diferentes lugares; también los gastos de diseño y actualización de la página web y algunos gastos de gestión derivados de la organización previa del encuentro como diseño del     logo, video y registro de la asociación.

Nos gustaría invitar algunos maestros más. Dependerá de ti. Envíanos tus sugerencias de maestros! 

       

                       indiegogo@ibizaenlightfestival.com

MESSENGER  /  MENSAJERO

COUNTRY / PAIS

PLANE/AVIÓN

OUR IMPACT

6 DAYS OF CONTINUOUS RELEASING differences with regards to the diversity in the 'form' teachers communicate; RELEASING ideas that say 'some cultures or languages are better than others'; PROMOTING the celebration of our Joint Identity.   This is our Ultimate Goal and we trust in God. 

We are very excited too about the GRATITUDE PERKS we have designed for this Project.  We trust you will be excited too.     

All your contributions will be greatly appreciated.   

WE ALSO NEED YOUR SUPPORT  IN GETTING THE WORD OUT TO THE ACIM COMMUNITY IN THE WORLD AND TO EVERYONE!

 

JUST BY SHARING ...  YOU ARE ALSO DONATING!

So please share this campaign with your friends, teachers and fellow students.   IT IS OUR COMMITMENT TO OPEN THIS NEW INTERNATIONAL EVENT FOR EVERY TEACHER OF GOD –famous  or unknown-  …  -in the media or not- …  there is room in the Ibiza Enlight Festival for all. 

HELP US GET THE WORD OUT.  

Indiegogo has many ‘sharing tools’.  We invite you to take a peek!

 

NUESTRO IMPACTO

6 DÍAS DE LIBERACIÓN CONTINUA: SOLTAR las diferencias con respecto a la 'forma' en que los div ersos maestros enseñan; LIBERAR las ideas acerca de que 'algunas culturas o idiomas son mejores que otras'; PROMOVER la celebración de nuestra Identidad Compartida.  Esta es nuestra Meta Final y confiamos en Dios. 

Estamos muy entusiasmados con los REGALOS DE GRATITUD que hemos diseñado para este proyecto.  Confiamos en que tú también te entusiasmarás.

Todas las contribuciones serán profundamente apreciadas.

TAMBIÉN NECESITAMOS TU AYUDA PARA COMPARTIR ESTA CAMPAÑA CON LAS DIVERSAS COMUNIDADES DE UCDM EN EL MUNDO  Y CON TODOS!,

SÓLO COMPARTIENDO... TAMBIÉN ESTÁS DONANDO!

Así que por favor, comparte esta campaña con tus amigos, maestros y estudiantes.  ES NUESTRO COMPROMISO ABRIR ESTE NUEVO EVENTO INTERNACIONAL PARA CADA MAESTRO DE DIOS –famoso o desconocido-  … mediático o no-   …  hay sitio para todos en el Ibiza Enlight Festival. 

AYÚDANOS A CORRER LA VOZ!

Indiegogo y sus  ‘herramientas para compartir’ te ayudarán. ¿Las descubres?

More information in     Más información en 

                       www.ibizaenlightfestival.com

 

 

LINKS  ENGLISH  &  ESPAÑOL 

hello@ibizaenlightfestival.com  ENGLISH

hola@ibizaenlightfestival.com   ESPAÑOL

indiegogo@ibizaenlightfestival.com   DONATIONS / DONATIVOS

FACEBOOK BILINGUAL: https://www.facebook.com/IbizaEnlightFestival?fref=ts
story_txt:
* This campaign has finished, but if you wish to DONATE, please write to us at: indiegogo@ibizaenlightfestival.com

ASKING MAKES US VULNERABLE

For years many of us have struggled with the idea that spirituality had to be ‘free’ and called out to the spiritual teachers of the world to either live a life of scarcity; live off their families; or get a job! 

“Many years ago, a man who came to my free classes came up to me and stretched out a bill. I said, no thank you. My classes are free. (I had a job).  He looked at me in dismay and sadness and said: ‘You have given me so much and I want to give you back.  I only have money. You have no right to deprive me of the happiness of giving what I have.’  I still didn´t take his money. I had doubts, fear, guilt.  It took years for me to learn this lesson. TO GIVE IS TO RECEIVE.  Thanks to all of you who have allowed me to give and to received. God blesses you all. (ACIM Teacher)

Today, more than asking  …. We are inviting you to participate in our campaign:  
“BRINGING THE TEACHERS”. 
Please watch the inspiring video below and Keep on Reading for the ‘HOW’ you can help.


 


* Esta campaña ha concluido, pero si quiere DONAR, por favor escríbenos a indiegogo@ibizaenlightfestival.com
PEDIR NOS HACE VULNERABLES
Durante años, muchos de nosotros luchamos con la idea de que la espiritualidad tenía que ser ‘gratis’ y le pedíamos a los maestros espirituales del mundo que vivieran en escasez; vivieran de sus familias; o se buscaran un empleo!
“Hace años, un hombre que venía a mis clases gratuitas se me acercó y me alargó un billete- Le dije, no gracias. Mis clases son gratis. (Yo tenía un empleo). Me miró con sorpresa y tristeza y me dijo: ‘Me has dado tanto y quiero darte yo. Sólo tengo dinero. No tienes el derecho de privarme de la felicidad de dar lo que tengo.’ Aún así no tomé su dinero. Tenía dudas, miedo, culpa.  Me llevó años aprender esta lección.  DAR ES RECIBIR.  Gracias a todos los que me han permitido dar y recibir.  Dios bendice a todos. (Maestro de UCDM) 
Hoy, más que pedirte …. Queremos invitarte a participar de nuestro proyecto: 
“TRAYENDO LOS MAESTROS”
Por favor mira el vídeo inspirador de abajo y SIGUE LEYENDO para descubrir CÓMO puedes ayudar. 


 VIDEO  INSPIRATION
       (in English with Spanish subtitles  / En Inglés, subtitulado al español)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=qaxBckKyp80#
MEET OUR TEACHERS !   CONOCE LOS MAESTROS
     Celebrate A Course in Miracles    Celebra Un Curso de Milagros
                                 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-H95Mx1KEY4
                                        
                        www.ibizaenlightfestival.com 
 


It's a time of a special celebration!
01 - 06 OCTOBER, 2013
Honoring A Course in Miracles


Es tiempo de una celebración especial!

      01 - 06 OCTUBRE, 2013

Honrando Un Curso de Milagros





 
This event celebrates having A COURSE IN MIRACLES and is open to everyone: teachers, students, and people who wish to discover The Course in a celebration in which to teach and to learn are resources to JOIN beyond our apparent differences. We will meet for a week of happiness, with workshops, gatherings and activities aimed at reinforcing the Lessons of Love, knowning that every teacher has his own course, thus everything is well when the purpose is to Join and not to separate.


 


Este evento celebra que tenemos UN CURSO de MILAGROS y estamos abiertos a todos: maestros, estudiantes y personas que deseen conocerlo en esta celebración, en la que aprender y enseñar son recursos para REUNIRNOS más allá de nuestras aparentes diferencias, y encontrarnos en unas jornadas de  felicidad en las que los talleres, charlas y actividades tienen como objetivo compartir y reforzar las Lecciones del Amor, sabiendo que cada maestro tiene su propio curso, por lo tanto todo está bien cuando el propósito es Unir y no separar.






"Thanks to Indiegogo and your financial support we will be able to purchase the airplane tickets for all the teachers from their countries of origin to Ibiza and also finance the creation of our website and other initial expenses.”                        THANK YOU SO MUCH!


 


"Gracias a Indiegogo y a tu apoyo financiero podremos pagar los billetes de avión de los maestros desde sus países de origen hasta Ibiza y también financiar la creación de nuestra web y otros gastos inciales."   MUCHAS GRACIAS!




THIS IS US!                               ESTOS SOMOS !






HEALING IS A JOINT VENTURE.  
We are but three, who have joined as One to respond to the calling of Love. IBIZA ENLIGHT, is a not-for-profit  association of recent creation by Carolina Corada, Steve Thompson and Salvador Rodriguez, whose ultimate goal is to share A Course in Miracles in diverse ‘forms’ and –in Spanish and English- to join more and more, trascending the forms that ‘apparently’ separate us.


 



LA SANACIÓN ES UNA EMPRESA DE COLABORACIÓN.


  Somos tres, que nos hemos unido como Uno para responder a la llamada del Amor.   IBIZA ENLIGHT, es una Asociación de reciente creación sin ánimo de lucro, ideada por Carolina Corada, Steve Thompson y Salvador Rodríguez, con la finalidad de compartir Un Curso de Milagros de diversas ‘formas’ -en español e inglés- uniéndonos cada vez más y trascendiendo las formas que ‘aparentemente’ nos distancian.


CLICK to learn more about us in English
http://ibizaenlightfestival.com/en/the-happy-dreamers/


OUR GOAL
We are committed to bringing to Ibiza our 16 A Course in Miracles teachers and perhaps a few more with your help, from Canada, Argentina, Venezuela, USA, Germany, Spain, and Sweden.  We want to pay all of their expenses, and need your collaboration specifically for the airplane tickets.  We wish to share these love-struck teachers for everyone to enjoy their shared light.


 


NUESTRA META
Estamos comprometidos con lograr traer a Ibiza a nuestros 16 maestros invitados de Un Curso de Milagros y quizás algunos más con tu colaboración, provenientes de Canada, Argentina, Venezuela, USA, Alemania, España y Suecia, pagándoles todos sus gastos. Necesitamos tu colaboración específicamente para los billetes de avión. Queremos compartir  a estos maestros tocados por el amor con todos y disfrutar de  Su Luz compartida.   


PINCHA AQUÍ para decubrir más sobre nosotros en Español
http://ibizaenlightfestival.es/the-happy-dreamers/
 


HOW ARE WE GOING TO INVEST YOUR CONTRIBUTION?
All the funds collected will be destined to the payment of airfares of the teachers invited to participate in the Festival and who will be travelling from diverse locations; we will also invest in the payment of our website and its updates as well as in the initial costs of the organization, such as logo design, video, registration of the association. 
We would like to invite a few more teachers.  It will depend on you.  Send us your teacher suggestions!


 


¿EN QUÉ VAMOS A EMPLEAR TU CONTRIBUCIÓN?

Todo el dinero recaudado se destinará para pagar los viajes de los maestros que participarán en el festival y que se desplazarán desde diferentes lugares; también los gastos de diseño y actualización de la página web y algunos gastos de gestión derivados de la organización previa del encuentro como diseño del     logo, video y registro de la asociación.

Nos gustaría invitar algunos maestros más. Dependerá de ti. Envíanos tus sugerencias de maestros! 


       
                       indiegogo@ibizaenlightfestival.com

OUR IMPACT
6 DAYS OF CONTINUOUS RELEASING differences with regards to the diversity in the 'form' teachers communicate; RELEASING ideas that say 'some cultures or languages are better than others'; PROMOTING the celebration of our Joint Identity.   This is our Ultimate Goal and we trust in God. 
We are very excited too about the GRATITUDE PERKS we have designed for this Project.  We trust you will be excited too.     
All your contributions will be greatly appreciated.   
WE ALSO NEED YOUR SUPPORT  IN GETTING THE WORD OUT TO THE ACIM COMMUNITY IN THE WORLD AND TO EVERYONE!
 
JUST BY SHARING ...  YOU ARE ALSO DONATING!
So please share this campaign with your friends, teachers and fellow students.   IT IS OUR COMMITMENT TO OPEN THIS NEW INTERNATIONAL EVENT FOR EVERY TEACHER OF GOD –famous  or unknown-  …  -in the media or not- …  there is room in the Ibiza Enlight Festival for all. 
HELP US GET THE WORD OUT.  
Indiegogo has many ‘sharing tools’.  We invite you to take a peek!


 


NUESTRO IMPACTO

6 DÍAS DE LIBERACIÓN CONTINUA: SOLTAR las diferencias con respecto a la 'forma' en que los div ersos maestros enseñan; LIBERAR las ideas acerca de que 'algunas culturas o idiomas son mejores que otras'; PROMOVER la celebración de nuestra Identidad Compartida.  Esta es nuestra Meta Final y confiamos en Dios. 
Estamos muy entusiasmados con los REGALOS DE GRATITUD que hemos diseñado para este proyecto.  Confiamos en que tú también te entusiasmarás.
Todas las contribuciones serán profundamente apreciadas.
TAMBIÉN NECESITAMOS TU AYUDA PARA COMPARTIR ESTA CAMPAÑA CON LAS DIVERSAS COMUNIDADES DE UCDM EN EL MUNDO  Y CON TODOS!,
SÓLO COMPARTIENDO... TAMBIÉN ESTÁS DONANDO!
Así que por favor, comparte esta campaña con tus amigos, maestros y estudiantes.  ES NUESTRO COMPROMISO ABRIR ESTE NUEVO EVENTO INTERNACIONAL PARA CADA MAESTRO DE DIOS –famoso o desconocido-  … mediático o no-   …  hay sitio para todos en el Ibiza Enlight Festival. 
AYÚDANOS A CORRER LA VOZ!
Indiegogo y sus  ‘herramientas para compartir’ te ayudarán. ¿Las descubres?

story:
Short Summary

Re-Generation has evolved to become the main mission of Re-Green while working with nature since 2012. We walk in a Permaculture way, eat Real Food, build Nature friendly Structures and trust Holistic Healing  Re-Green is our home and farm together with an Experiential -Educational Retreat Center. Every year we host more and more guests from all over the globe to find information, interaction, time to retreat and re-discover how healing and important it is to care for the Earth and ourselves. The need of more food increases dramatically!

Our intention is to offer all visitors home grown organic food, that they can see, touch, smell and taste, Understanding the nourishment and growth from the 'earth to belly.' This versatile Keder greenhouse that we are crowd funding for, with its “Twin Skinned” UV resistant covering, is guaranteed for 20 years and has many benefits that fit with our strategy of being self-supportive in our vegetable food production.
 

What We Need & What You Get

To make this dream possible we have managed to get a special discounted price for a Keder Greenhouse of 6950 euros ( 8500 USD) that we are trying to raise and assure you that we will greatly value all donations.

We ask for your collaboration so that all who visit Re-Green can experience the power of growing and eating home grown organic healthy nutritional tasty food and to give the gift of empowering yourself and others to care for the earth and organic nourishment.

Yet as permaculture tells us to 'creatively use and respond to change', should we not meet the target set, we can find a smaller solution. Still we reach out to you to help with our ideal goal and offer gratitude in the form of perks that you can find here on the side.

Mill Millichap our Permaculture teacher has agreed to use his  tree
nursery's Triodos Bank (ethical bank) account for our international
fundraising . 

The Impact

Why a greenhouse?

It is nowadays becoming more well known and all different nutritional approaches agree that “every meal that we eat should consist of at least 2/3 of vegetables”. The importance of this fact has been incorporated in our kitchen in order to provide our guests and residents the best possible nutrition. This fact however, creates the necessity for re-green to grow “7 tons of vegetables a year” a number that could not be achieved until today due to the small spring-summer season. In order to achieve our veggie growth quantities, the cultivation of greens during the cold season must be increased and the only way that this can be achieved is by a good size green house. Having carefully done our research we have concluded that amongst the greenhouses in the market the “Keder” suits our situation and needs better than any other.

www.kedergreenhouse.co.uk

Risks & Challenges

This is our first crowndfunding project, as we don't tend to be so commercial, reusing, repairing, refusing in the first place. Yet some carefully selected, sustainable and long life expenses are necessary to be brought into our lives. We assure you that we will greatly value and honour all donations. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Communication is the key! Any sharing of this  project is much appreciated.

story:
Your Donation

I will forward all donations made here to the Improv Embassy here in Ottawa, so that they can run an Intro to Improv course specifically for people dealing with PTSD and anxiety. 

Initially my intention was to donate half the profits from my Fringe Show "How to Get Over a Guy in 723 Days (And Other Useful Things I Learned From Afghanistan, The Dildo Dory Grill, and PTSD)". However, I didn't make a profit - I almost broke even! The experience was totally worth it, and I was also thrilled to have been awarded the Spirit of the Fringe award.

Seeing as I have no profit to share, I will be giving 100% of all donations to the funding of an anxiety/PTSD improv course. I will be donating as well! 

The rest of the pitch below is from my original posting. If you'd like to learn more about the show, why I did it, and a bit about how I dealt with PTSD - read on.

The Show

Breaking up is hard to do. Breaking up while dealing with weird PTSD symptoms like crying whenever you hear Carly Rae Jepson’s “Call Me Maybe” is just waaaaay harder. This is my story of how working in Kandahar Airfield for four years changed me, and the lessons I learned as I tried to cope with crying jags, freaking out on public transit, and paying good money for shitty under-eye concealer… and maybe even discovering something better along the way. Turns out that panicking on stage = less freaking out in life.

I'll be performing six shows at the National Arts Centre (in the Pavilion) and if you'll be in the Ottawa area between June 14 and 24, you can buy your tickets here. 

Me and PTSD

I was born in Newfoundland, grew-up in Labrador, lived and worked in Scotland, Bosnia, Afghanistan, the oil fields of northern Alberta and now Ottawa where I work as a security officer. I joined the Canadian Forces Reserves while in university and deployed to Bosnia in 2000. At the end of my deployment was hired to stay on as a civilian contractor for three years and a few years later I worked in Kandahar Airfield, returning to Canada in 2011.

I didn’t realize I might have PTSD until I was home from Afghanistan for a couple of years. In 2014 while dealing with the worst of my symptoms and a pending breakup, I drove my newly decorated motorcycle Cupcake, from Ottawa to Newfoundland to stay with my very generous aunts and uncles, and spent part of the summer working at the Dildo Dory Grill (my birthplace – Dildo, not the Grill), clearing some of the land my father left me and my sister, and even taking a stunt workshop with the extras from CBC's “Republic of Doyle”.

I attempted to cope with my PTSD after returning to work in Ottawa and taking a long, long time getting over my break-up with my boyfriend (hint: it took more than 723 days). For a couple of years I tried counselling, anti-depressants, self-help books, not-so-helpful books/wine/Netflix binges and isolating. In 2017 I took a class with the Improv Embassy  which unexpectedly helped me deal with everyday stress that would normally freak me out.  And then a couple of storytellers from the 2017 Ottawa Fringe show inspired me to try telling my own story.

I sometimes think that I shouldn't have PTSD; that I hadn't experienced enough trauma to warrant the diagnosis. Compared to the soldiers and civilians who worked outside the wire in Afghanistan I had it easy. In Kandahar Airfield we had Tim Horton's, salsa classes, and zero chance of running over an IED. And yet - years after coming home I am still dealing with issues and triggers. My hope is that by talking about my own mental health struggles, I may make it easier for someone else to ask for help if they need it.

I’m still taking classes at the Improv Embassy, testing the waters of stand-up, and am now a cast member and a wanna-be contributing writer for the Shit Hot Shit Show, Ottawa’s only regularly performing sketch comedy troupe (which is also performing in this year’s Fringe).

How You Can Help

Improv was so helpful in teaching me to calm the f*ck down, that I’m donating half the profits from my Fringe show to the Improv Embassy to fund an Intro to Improv class specifically for people dealing with PTSD, anxiety and other issues. 

If you're in the Ottawa area between June 14 and 24, you can help by coming out to my show. If you can't make it, you can help by donating $10 or $20 to the show... and then telling everyone you know to come to the show!

By helping with some of my show expenses, I'll have more to donate. My budget expenses consist of the Fringe fee ($540), venue rental ($1500 - hey, it's the NAC!), and promo ($200 for flyers and postcards), for a total of $2,240 (Cdn).  I don't have any actual perks offered - unless you count me putting the name of all donors on my website - oh the glory!

I'm not looking for big donations. I'm mostly just looking to get the word out about the show and its subject. So if you do donate - thank you! But if you don't - no worries. However I do ask that if you have a friend or family member that might be interested in the show or the topic, or if they're just having a really shitty day - I'd truly appreciate it if you could share this campaign with them. Maybe we could trade break-up tips.

You can find out more about me and my show at www.oddjobninja.com.

story:
Thank you so much for taking the time to view my campaign! 

My name is Samantha Okumura and I am a yoga teacher in Las Vegas, NV. Shortly after graduating college, I accepted an internship working for a nonprofit organization that offered adaptive exercise therapy to individuals who have suffered a spinal cord injury. From that moment I knew that I would pursue a career working with neurological injuries. I didn't know at the time how underserved this community was or how difficult it was to find affordable, long-term, post-acute therapy that is so critical to maintaining overall health in the body post-injury. This studio is my humble attempt to provide an affordable recreational therapy, a healing atmosphere and a space to build community. 

Many individuals who suffer from paralysis, multiple sclerosis, or other neurological disorders/injuries experience high tone and spasticity in the muscles, decreased bone mineral density, chronic nerve pain, weak diaphragms (weak breath), poor circulation/ability to regulate blood pressure, overall disconnectedness to the body, depression and anxiety, as well as the negative consequences of spending a lot of time in a seated position. Yoga therapy (modified asana (postures), pranayama (breath work), and meditation) is a beautiful complement or addition to other physical therapy. We work one on one to maintain mobility and flexibility in the joints and spine, build posture and core strength, improve breath control, and calm the mind and spirit while building better awareness and connectedness to the body. 

 

I truly believe that the benefits of yoga should be accessible to everyone and are not only life-changing but critical to physical, mental and spiritual well being. This campaign is a small drop in the bucket to empowering this community but has the potential to provide a much needed space for healing. The SCI community is terribly underserved. Not only is it difficult to get the bare minimum of what they need for daily living (which can cost hundreds of thousands of dollars per year and up to a million dollars the first year post-injury) but the majority of post-acute rehabilitation and therapy is not covered by medical insurance even though it is absolutely critical and irreplaceable in maintaining  health.  

I'm am setting my goal at $10,000 but I would be beyond grateful for any amount. This money will go directly to the cost to open and appropriately furnish a healing yoga space in Las Vegas, NV and more specifically to:

- flooring and paint 

- wall mirrors 

- specialized adaptive equipment for grip strength 

- therapy tables for those that can't transfer to and from the floor 

- stall bars 

- pulley system and resistance band systems 

- yoga blocks, mats, bolsters, straps, and wedges

- other adaptive tools

- organic cleaning supplies

Anything that is left over will go directly to free sessions to a fixed income individual with a cervical level injury resulting in paralysis from the shoulders down. 

 

I am beyond grateful for any donation but that's not all you can do to help. Simply spreading the word by sharing this campaign on your social media accounts may allow this campaign to reach an individual who truly needs this service and feels that there are no resources available to them. 

Thank you Thank you Thank you!

Namaste

Namaste

story:
Sweet CommUnity!

I reach out with so much Love & Gratitude. I am intending to have a geodesic dome built in Spring 2014, upon my return from Cuenca, Ecuador where I will be co~creating a healing village center called OASIS.  The Dome will function as a hOMe for Jahna & Nefeye as well as a Spiritual Activation Space for the commUnity as it will reside in an intentional healing eco-village just outside of Asheville! Jahna does various forms of healing work including: Healing Earth Cuisine food services, Intuitive Readings/Healing, Feather Crown Adornments, Wellness/LifeCoaching, Intuitive Business coaching & more! She owns the world-bridging nature of her spirit, and seeks connection to All new paradigm developers in order to facilitate a new world, sustainable experience for our communities and beyond. She has innovative ideas that are of great value to those who give her a chance to really exercise who she is.

During Jahna's college years, she began to develop an acute awareness to spiritual matters, working hard to grow exponentially in this field. Through conscious discipline and utilizing techniques such as fasting, meditation, yoga, spiritual/scientific literature, raw foods, energy work, biodanza (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biodanza), mindful living, etc. on a regular and reoccurring basis, she has become developed and able to share what she has learned through her own highly varied and rich life experiences of trial and error, conscious change and growth, and self-education. Thus, Jahna Love Healing & Wellness is created, and infinite opportunities for creative expansion.

Jahna has reached her pinnacle of truth, and is asking the Universe for what she craves. Her destiny. This destiny's purpose is to benefit the entire world! The Meditation Dome is not only a home, but a space where immediate and global Healing Work can be achieved, in perfect solitude in nature. In perfect simplicity. Prayer healing, energy projection, meditation, love, connection all exist here amongst Mother and child, family, and community. Ideas for a sustainable future are created here. Healing happens here. Your support does not go to waste. It is cherished and honored and backed with Universal intention, and the karmic circle always comes back around! Jahna's Mayan Galactic Signature is "White Solar World Bridger"! (http://www.icandosomething.com/mayancalendar/si...). This is what she Is and represents in her human existence ~ her spirit carries enough power & energy to make a real difference. Your support is so much honored and appreciated.

In exchange for your help, you will gladly receive gifts of the Spirit. Be it conscious cuisine services, feather crown blessings, spiritual readings, intuitive guidance amongst other healing modals. Tune into the "Perks" on the lower right-hand side to see a detailed list of energy in exchange for your help.  In addition, a dome layout has been created with utmost affordability & sustainability in mind. You can have your own dome for approximately $500-1600 and we will gladly share the method of creating such a structure. I have been blessed with a dear friend who does geodesic dome charity work amongst other amazing work and it's his mission to help us all get free in this capacity, without expecting anything in return.

Help manifest this solid vision. The blessings will come back around 10 fold, as I speak it into intention. Abundance for Us All ~:)

~Jahna & Nefeye~

Note: If you cannot contribute at this time, please remember to use the campaign share tools to help promote our campaign!

story:
At the Canadian Sport Film Festival (CSFF) we pride ourselves on living up to our mission of “Provoking dialogue on the power of sport to inspire social change.” The 9th annual 2017 CSFF is set for June 9-11 at TIFF Bell Lightbox in Toronto.

With your help, CSFF will support young Indigenous athletes coming to Toronto, connect them with local community groups, provide access to film screenings for Toronto youth, and continue to offer free youth workshops and a free screening for high-school students.

A central feature of CSFF has been – and always will be – reaching out to young people: encouraging them to be active, providing them with opportunities to be creative, and creating spaces where important conversations can be had that break-down boundaries, and forge community.

We do this by offering a variety of FREE activities for young people within the cinema and by reaching out to them. Young people attend the festival, watch relatable content, and meet filmmakers and storytellers – making connections that would otherwise be unavailable to them.

This year’s program highlights the resilience of Indigenous youth through sport. CSFF 2017 opens with the Toronto premiere of Keepers of the Game  and the efforts of Mohawk young women to start a girls’ lacrosse team at their high school. Our consistently sold-out Family Screening, features Salluit Run Club and a group of young runners, led by award-winning teacher, Maggie Macdonnell, striving to run the Hawaii Marathon. We want to have athletes from both groups attend CSFF and interact with local youth.

Reaching young people through sport and film

CSFF prides itself on bringing powerful stories and amazing films to Canadian audiences. But we do much more than show films in cinemas. An important component of what we do is getting young people active while also engaging their creative minds.

Our youth outreach activities target underserved communities and with the help of your generous support we are able to reduce barriers to participation by offering many of these opportunities FREE of charge to participants and families.  

  • Youth workshop – an innovative free workshop for young people that combines physical activity with the opportunity for youth to make films. Participants and their guardians are provided with free access to our annual Family Screening
  • Family Screening – a program of films geared towards young people with panel discussions that highlight the issues raised in the films and provide youth the opportunity to interact with filmmakers and athletes.
  • High school screening – an annual free screening for local high school students, with special guests specifically organized for students.
  • Community outreach – where possible, we connect filmmakers and film stars with community groups providing for some meaningful out-of-theatre interactions.
  • Free tickets – CSFF provides blocks of free tickets for the youth-oriented films in our program to local social service organizations.

This commitment to youth outreach allowed young people at CSFF 2016 to

  • Host 43 youth in our free workshop, where among other things they scripted and made their own stop-motion animated films
  • Participate in a post-screening Q&A where they met aspiring young athletes and Canadian Paralympic gold medallist Chelsey Gotell

  • Watched Fighting for Peace, a film about a boxing program in the favelas of Rio de Janeiro, at our free high school screening. Students met the filmmakers from the Netherlands and boxed with Canadian Olympian Arthur Biyarslanov.

  • Be coached by an internationally acclaimed instructor. Nassra Mohammed, the star of Zanzibar Soccer Dreams, is a FIFA-accredited coach and an assistant coach with the national women’s team of Tanzania. While in Toronto for CSFF 2016, she spent a day coaching a soccer team of young, first-generation Canadian, Muslim girls and women at Regent Park Community Centre. 

Making a difference

Sport and film are powerful tools to start conversations. Together, our workshops and discussion help facilitate a space for young people to:

  • Forge trust and confidence in one another
  • Have conversations that contribute to breaking down social barriers of class, race, gender, sexual orientation, ability, age, and more

  • Create and build stronger communities

  • Encourage people to invest their energies into healthy activities that contribute to holistic wellness. 

It’s a special privilege to be able to connect people like Nassra Mohammed with young people in Toronto. Since our inception, CSFF has been programming with young people in mind.  This began with our Youth Workshop, which was larger than ever in 2016. The feedback that we received is that 90% of participants “agree” or “strongly agree” with the statement that “I (child) learned/gained something from attending this event.”

Here is some of the other feedback that we get from parents/guardians and youth …

How we’ll put your money to use

The Canadian Sport Film Festival is a not-for-profit corporation; our mission is one of outreach and artistic engagement by sharing films that use sport to speak to larger issues. Our Youth Workshop continues to grow (nearly doubling the number of participants in 2016) and our commitment to connecting local youth with newsmakers and storytellers remains as firm as ever.

Your support of $3,000 will enable us to: 

  • expand and improve our Youth Workshop where young people will get the opportunity to engage in both inclusive physical activity programming and filmmaking
  • host an exclusive screening for high school students
  • Invite Indigenous youth, the stars of Keepers of the Game and Salluit Run Club, to meet and participate in discussions with young audience members
  • engage our community and connect these guests with local groups outside the cinema

CSFF 2017: Within and beyond the cinema

In 2008, we launched the Canadian Sport Film Festival to share human stories from around the world that are told through sport and film. Since then, we have connected with thousands of filmgoers and screened more than 200 films -- many of them world, North American, and Canadian premieres -- from more than 35 countries. In addition to our youth programming and outreach, we host filmmakers and film stars.

Our 2017 festival showcases a program that deals with issues as diverse as our own city.  The 23 films – 22 of which are premiering at CSFF - focus on challenges related to women's rights, mental health, youth and children, substance use, addiction and resilience, and the importance of community.

We truly appreciate your support as we look to provide these opportunities to young people in Toronto and we look forward to welcoming you at the 9th annual Canadian Sport Film Festival on June 9-11 at TIFF Bell Lightbox.

story:
Who am I?

I´m Rebecca Wheaton, concerned global citizen and married mother of a 4-year old. I am a therapist and an educator. I want to increase awareness about what we can do about stress in Managua, Nicaragua. Nicaragua is one of the poorest countries in the hemisphere. People suffer from poverty, physical and emotional violence, gender inequality and lack of affection and quality time in the family. This results in high stress, anxiety, and physical problems. I want to do all I can and add to the growing network of healers and teachers working on this important social issue.

What is this about? Why do I need money?

Interest in the healing arts is growing globally. People are looking to understand stress and how to overcome anxiety. Power Brain Wellness Education is an integral health program involving action to combat the roots of stress coupled with physical fitness which promotes creative intellectual activity. Power Brain Wellness Education blends current neuroscience concepts with exercises and activities that awaken the body and brain. It provides a wealth of positive messages and focuses on interpersonal relationships; helping students awaken their natural intelligences. The program targets the vital role of teachers' positive frame of mind and pushes for a collaborative teaching atmosphere. 

I am asking for your help to fund my training as a Power Brain Wellness Educator and provide books and materials for students.

Who do work with?

I use massage therapy and yoga classes with leaders of community service organizations who are stressed and need more self care. I also work as a yoga teacher for children and teens, introducing movement and mindfulness in after-school programming. Participants, including parents, report finding enhanced clarity, focus, inner peace and self-awareness through the classes they receive. This program will certify me to further my scope to help others as a Power Brain Educator. I will begin interweaving Power Brain Education and Wellness into my current services as well as new courses, workshops and retreats. 

Currently my services include:

> Massage therapy 

> After school yoga classes and healing instruction for students ages 6-16

> Community group yoga classes

> Stress relief workshops for businesses leaders and empoyees

To learn more details about Power Brain Wellness Education, I recommend reading about it here: http://www.powerbraineducation.com

While mindfulness and wellness practices are being assimilated with enthusiasm in the U.S., they are just up-and-coming in Nicaragua. Expenses are high and money is tight. It will take money, sponsorship and time before teachers, parents and schools are ready to devote funds to alternative education.

I want to champion this important work and I need your help.

When you donate your dollars, I will donate my hours!

This campaign has a built-in PERK! In exchange for your generous donations towards my training, I will reach out to a variety of well-known and beloved institutions to offer free healing packages to the people in desperate need but cannot pay for individual healing sessions, yoga classes or exposure to the benefits of Power Brain Wellness and Education. 

As I collect your donations, every $1,000 converts into a small healing project that includes:

20 Healing sessions...12 Yoga Classes...8 Family Classes...2 retreat scholarships

In order to have a deeper impact on people's lives, 4 to 5 different people will benefit from each healing project. A given recipient will receive:

5 Healing sessions

3 Yoga classes

2 Family Classes(in group setting with 3 or 4 other families)

2 retreats scholarships per group

I am coordinating these mini projects with:

CDCA & Nueva Vida Clinic: http://jhc-cdca.org/ 

CEPS: https://www.facebook.com/Centro-de-Estudios-y-P... 

CANTERA: http://cscantera.blogspot.com/ & CANTERA - Centro de Comunicación y Educación Popular

...and if you know of a group, institution or individual/family that really needs support and you think this might help please consider sponsoring them.

FUNDRAISING GOALS

Current Goal: $7,000

Original GOAL: $10,000

ALREADY RAISED $3,000!!!! Thanks to all contributors, friends and family!

Breakdown of the $10,000:

$6,000 for both level 2 and 3 Power Brain trainings held in the Summer and Fall of 2017.

$1,000 for room and board(during the trainings).

$3,000 for travel and marketing costs and promotional materials and books

Synopsis of training: BEL2 is an advanced program designed to give BE(Brain Education) Instructors a boost of passion and professionalism to take their teaching and presentation skills to a higher level.  BEL3 is an advanced Trainer’s Course where participants will receive instruction on how to teach the basic 2-day Brain Education Teacher’s Workshop. Participants will have the opportunity to train directly with the most dedicated BE Leaders in the country by visiting five New York City schools for real-world practice teaching students, teachers and parents.  Additionally, participants learn how to coordinate BE outreach projects in their region.

 

This funding campaign serves people like you.  You would love to know more about people that are receiving this kind of care, but you aren't sure through whom to give. Help me raise the funds to bring a better quality of life to Nicaragua and I will share with you their pictures, testimonies and video projects that we have accomplished.

If donating isn't within your budget, perhaps there are a few people you know that may be interested in this campaign. Please share the link to this site. Thank you so much for your consideration. 

THANK YOU!!!!

Rebecca Wheaton

Certified Body and Brain Yoga Instructor/Lic. Massage Therapist

Facilitator in Human Development & Alternative Education Leadership programming

A given recipient will receive:5 Healing sessions3 Yoga classes2 Family Classes(in group setting with 3 or 4 other families)2 retreats scholarships per groupI am coordinating these mini projects with:CDCA & Nueva Vida Clinic: http://jhc-cdca.org/ CEPS: https://www.facebook.com/Centro-de-Estudios-y-P... CANTERA: http://cscantera.blogspot.com/ & CANTERA - Centro de Comunicación y Educación Popular...and if you know of a group, institution or individual/family that really needs support and you think this might help please consider sponsoring them.FUNDRAISING GOALSCurrent Goal: $7,000Original GOAL: $10,000ALREADY RAISED $3,000!!!! Thanks to all contributors, friends and family!Breakdown of the $10,000:$6,000 for both level 2 and 3 Power Brain trainings held in the Summer and Fall of 2017.$1,000 for room and board(during the trainings).$3,000 for travel and marketing costs and promotional materials and booksSynopsis of training: BEL2 is an advanced program designed to give BE(Brain Education) Instructors a boost of passion and professionalism to take their teaching and presentation skills to a higher level.  BEL3 is an advanced Trainer’s Course where participants will receive instruction on how to teach the basic 2-day Brain Education Teacher’s Workshop. Participants will have the opportunity to train directly with the most dedicated BE Leaders in the country by visiting five New York City schools for real-world practice teaching students, teachers and parents.  Additionally, participants learn how to coordinate BE outreach projects in their region. This funding campaign serves people like you.  You would love to know more about people that are receiving this kind of care, but you aren't sure through whom to give. Help me raise the funds to bring a better quality of life to Nicaragua and I will share with you their pictures, testimonies and video projects that we have accomplished.If donating isn't within your budget, perhaps there are a few people you know that may be interested in this campaign. Please share the link to this site. Thank you so much for your consideration. THANK YOU!!!!Rebecca WheatonCertified Body and Brain Yoga Instructor/Lic. Massage TherapistFacilitator in Human Development & Alternative Education Leadership programming

story:
What is Special Places Special Faces

We are a group of students from the University of Tennessee, Knoxville that are working to raise money for Special Spaces. Our names are Angela Galyon, Morgan-Ann Baker, Blake Garner, and Tim He.

Special Spaces is a non-profit organization that creates dream bedrooms for children, ages 2-18, battling life-threatening illnesses. The money raised in this campaign will be going directly to Special Spaces where they will use it to fund the bedroom makeovers. Special Spaces operates off of the donations received from community members, local businesses, and volunteers. By donating you are giving a child a place they can retreat to after a long day of doctor's appointments. A place they can be their most expressive and creative self. A place they can call their own. A place they can live life to the fullest extent while also keeping their health a number one priority.

What We Need

An average bedroom makeover costs between $4,000-$5,000 dollars. These numbers vary from bedroom to bedroom depending on the condition of the home and can run up to $10,000 dollars.

For this campaign's purpose, we are setting a goal of $1,000 with hopes of earning more and being able to make a significant impact. The money we raise will go directly to Special Spaces and from there will be used for a future bedroom makeover.

Every additional dollar raised contributes to an additional personal touch within the bedroom.

What are some of the expenses?

  • Paint
  • Flooring
  • Decorations
  • Bedding
  • Therapy equipment
  • Ect.

The Impact

(From Left to Right: JT, Jullian, Masson, Khloee, Giddeon, and Kailey)

The Simpson Family, pictured above, is one the many families that has experienced first hand the impact that Special Spaces makes. Below is Kailey Simpsons story and a little more about her family. 

"Jullian (he will be 8 next week). He plays football is Homeschooled and loves to dance especially after a great play. He has special needs. He has Ocular Motor Apraxia and Frontal Cortical Dysplasia. He doesn't let it stop him, he has been captain of his football team for the last 4 yrs and has been a starter on both sides of the ball.

Masson is next, he is 6.5. He is the little guy but don't let that fool you. His heart is GIANT. He too plays football and starts on both sides of the ball he is passionate about his studies and is convinced he has to be the one to take care of his brothers when they are all grown up. He is my wild child and the silly one of the group.

Next is little Khloee. She will be 5 in December. She is our only Princess, and full of spunk as well. She is all girl but can definitely handle herself with these boys! She is the captain of her cheer squad and is very very passionate about competitive cheer. She starts school next year but is always asking questions and eager to learn. We call her little mama. She tries to help keep all these boys in line even if it's by changing a diaper or kissing a boo boo until I can get to them. She is sweet as pie but no one crosses her cause she is tough too!

Giddeon was born 8lbs 7oz full term and "perfect". Little did we know Giddeon would be such a warrior. Giddeon has 15 different diagnoses all stemming from his Joubert Syndrome. He is 2.5 and has a smile that could move mountains. He is non-verbal but uses sign language and definitely gets his point across. He is feeding tube dependent and eats by mouth for "fun" on good days. He is our teams "pep squad" lol he loves football and the kids like to walk by him and get their helmet smacked for good luck before a game. He also knows the importance of a mouthpiece and will shove it in their mouths if they don't have it in their mouth already. He loves football and his football friends.Giddeon also loves dinosaurs and just being a kid. Despite his struggles therapy 6 days a week and 11 specialists he is a very happy boy which makes things much easier.

We are super grateful for the way Special spaces truly changed our lives. They gave us access to a whole new lifestyle. I have four burners that work on my stove now. I have a washer and dryer (mine were going out) and a dishwasher. My kids have special spaces for themselves. There are places to organize Giddeons medical supplies and medicines and equipment. We receive in-home therapy and when it gets hard and Giddeon cries the big kids have somewhere to go to feel safe and comfortable so they don't dwell on the overwhelming fact that Giddeon is hurt or uncomfortable during therapy and they cant help him. Jullian has a safe place to go to help prevent a meltdown. It really is amazing how much more the experience is than just a bedroom. It is so much more than just a room, Its a breath of fresh air and freedom."

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate but are inspired by our campaign and Special Spaces please feel to free to share this campaign with your friends and family by using the Indiegogo sharing links below.

If you would like to become more involved with Special Spaces, make sure to check out their website for volunteer opportunities.

Feel free to email us with any questions you may have. Please help us spread the word!

Thank you so much for taking time out of your day to explore our campaign and for any possible donations.

story:
Aquatic Therapy pool in Central California seeking a lift to service special needs clients.

Please help and PASS this on

We thank everyone who participated in donating to our Pool Lift for the AquaZen Center in Central, CA. 

Unfortunately were not close to our $5,000 goal.  This Lift will help so many more people receive the amazing benefits of warm water therapy. 

Please send any amount and SHARE this request on your facebook/any and all of your social media.  If everyone donates $10 ~$20 we would meet our goal easily. 

Thank you so much for your participation and donations….

 Sincerely ~ cameron west, owner AquaZen Center

A Passion for Working With Special Needs

As an Adaptive Physical Educator, and Director of Easter Seals Community Based Programs for 18+ years, Cameron attuned her skills and her passion for seeing the potential of clients being in warm water.  Spanning from mild Arthritis, minor surgeries to major special needs such as Cerebral Palsy, amputation, Stroke and Parkinson’s. 

“Seeing the postures and pain of clients that come in with intense pain and movement issues, then their faces and even smiles as they leave, has been my biggest teacher and inspiration.“

This campaign is to raise money for an Aquatic Lift so we who work at the AquaZen Center can service our Special Needs client’s in safety and with ease of entry and exit from our pool environment. 

At this time our 13 X 17 foot above ground pool is located in an area where there is some degree of difficulty walking down to the pool, from where a car is parked.  Once on the deck entry into the pool is steep for anyone suffering from any problems with knees, hips or back.

The Aquazen Center, besides the day to day services we provide clients,  are committed to a once a month Free Clinic, that services any one who has financial or physical needs. 

Another one of our projects here at the Aquatic Integration Institute is to work with the Wounded Warrior’s, men and woman returning from the war with Post Tramatic Stress Disorder (PTSD).  The lift will enable those who have difficulty in walking a safe way to enter and exit the pool.

 Our goal in purchasing the lift will be to provide safety and have a broader ability to service a larger population of clients needing Aquatic Therapy.

Your contribution will help us to achieve this goal, and be a service to the many who will now be able to receive aquatic therapy.  

What We Need & What You Get

The Aquatic Integration Institute is a privately funded and owned entity.  It’s daily costs and pool maintenance are privately paid for, its revenue earned is minimal.

So that we can purchase the Aquatic Lift we are asking for help.

We need $5,000 to purchase and install an aquatic lift.  Our goal is simple in that all the $ raised will go directly for the lift, if the $5,000 is not raised whatever $ is still needed to complete the purchase the Institute will cover the balance. 

All monies that are gifted are tax deductible and so a receipt will be sent to everyone participating in the fundraiser. 

The Impact

The impact that this lift will give to our Central Coast Community (especially North County) will be both large and significantly small. 

The Institutes purpose is to provide Aquatic Therapy to all peoples.  Those that can afford the therapy and to those who cannot..  So your contribution will be felt on the larger scale by the population of people who cannot get services either because of finances and or because of physical restrictions.

And on a smaller scale to those who can afford treatment but need a safe and easier access getting into the pool. 

Please think about all the people you know, friends and family members that you would like to invite to a pool, and know that your contribution will make this easier for those that may have not been able to attend due to safe access. 

Risks & Challenges

The risk to this fundraiser is non- existent.  This is not a money-making proposal, this is a service oriented project.  The only challenges and risks so far have been that clients who come to the pool have had to walk down quite a ways from their car to the pool over terrain that compromises someone who has balance and coordination issues.  This fundraisers goal is to create a better risk, challenge free environment for access. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We so appreciate every one of you that has gotten this far in reading our proposal.  Please know that you can help as well even if money is not what your able to give now.  If you can send on this invitation to anyone you know or can think of that may know someone that may know someone.  Please spread the word.  The more the word spreads, the more likely we will be able to install a lift to service those with special needs.

You can go to the indiegogo share tools and easily send our invite out to as many people as you wish. 

Again our Warmest Thanks for your support ~~~ Cameron West, Aquatic Integration Institute

Cameron West, CMT, SEP

Currently serves as the Director of Aquatic Integration Institute at the AquaZen Center in Templeton, where she develops and directs Practitioner Programs with concentrations in Aquatic Integration™ & Watsu®, T’ai Chi and EASY (energy aquatic shiatsu yoga).

Cameron is the founder of Aquatic Integration Institute (Aii) and Aquatic Integration, a form of water therapy which combines Eastern meridian and point work with myofascial release, proprioceptive neuromuscular facilitation and breath-work and has proven highly effective in a range of clinical settings from psychological and emotional release modalities to traditional rehabilitation of orthopedic trauma and spinal cord injury. She currently specializes in the training of practitioners in Physical and Somatic Therapy practices, in spas and health centers worldwide. Her Aquatic Integration curriculum has been approved for program credit by the Harbin School of Healing Arts at Harbin Hot Springs, Worldwide Aquatic Bodywork Association (WABA) and National Certification Board for Therapeutic Massage & Bodywork (NCBTMB).

Cameron West, CMT, SEP
